Reviews.Title: “A change in management?”
Reviews.Author: roadprincess
Reviews.Content: We initially stayed at Sofitel Chicago last September and had a pleasant experience (although the rooms do veer toward the cozier side). Last weekend when we were in town for my husband's MBA graduation, we thought of Sofitel again. Unfortunately, our experience began its steady downhill descent when we settled into our room only to find that the AC was not working (normally in March this would not be a problem, but it just so happened that temps were pushing 80 that day). We would have to pack everything back up and move to another room. Even after politely asking the manager at the front desk whether they would offer us anything to compensate for the hassle, he insisted that they could do nothing more than the exact same room on another floor. Nothing. Tip to hotel management: if you don't maintain your temperature control units properly resulting in guests having to re-pack all of their belongings to move to another room, then you'd better be prepared to offer them something - an upgrade, and if not, at the very least breakfast on the house. If this had been the only issue during our stay, then we might possilby consider returning. Maybe the front desk manager was just having a bad day. But during our stay there were a host of other issues including the wireless internet not working (and even worse, the hotel not being able to offer a solution other than waiting until the next day when the whole system apparently reboots), returning to the room in the early afternoon after being out several hours during the morning to find the room still not made up, the safe in our room malfunctioning. The plumbing also leaves something to be desired - the water pressure in the shower was weak, and it felt like they were rationing hot water. There are some good things about this hotel. The location within Gold Coast is convenient. But fortunately, there are plenty of other hotel options in the neighborhood which we will certainly choose over Sofitel the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: LovinMexico7
Reviews.Content: We stayed over St. Patrick's Day weekend and had a wonderful time. From check in to check out, the service was wonderful. The lobby is so beautiful with neat architectural lines and beautiful artfully flower arrangements, lighting and much more! There is a free coffee/tea bar in the morning at the restaurant, no in room coffeemaker. The rooms are small but set up very well. The bathroom was very, very nice with a glass enclosed shower, tub and sink. There are robes and slippers available for your use. We parked in the parking lot next door for about $20 per day less than getting the valet service. (I think your car is parked in the same garage though.;-) The neighborhood is wonderful. If you walk behind the hotel on State St. you will run into such a nice area with restaurants, bars, shops, etc... We walked to the beach/Lakeshore Blvd also, it's very close! All in all, we would definitely stay there again. For the price, it was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “5* Stay - Great Location - Close to the Party/Shopping”
Reviews.Author: surfcali
Reviews.Content: Thank you reviewers. This hotel was wonderful. After reading reviews I booked a room here for my St. Patty's Birthday. It was an easy train ride from O'Heare - just took the Blue Line into downtown - circle transfer at Jackson to Red - and took towards Howard to Chicago- got off Chicago and walked a couple of blocks. I saw Devon Seafood right on the corner - where we had our 1st night dinner reservations- excited to see it so close to the hotel. The hotel lobby is beautiful - and check-in was easy and front desk people were wonderful wishing me a Happy Birthday. My room was on the 24th floor - light oak - spotless clean and flat screen with Bose radio player with plug for my ipod and Android / Pandora music hook ups. The bed was so comfortable - and just had a top comforter. The location was great for getting out - just a short walk to Michigan Ave. - and to Rush street - where I can enjoy Tavern on Rush / Gibson's Steakhouse / Morton's / Ditkas / live music Jilly's Starbucks - and Pancake House and all the fun bars and restaurants on Rush. All within walking distance. It was a 15 min cab ride to Aliena restaurant - my highlight of my Birthday. Thanks Sofitel Chicago it was a great stay and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busymomtraveller
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of Sofitel were 'wow, this looks nice'. No one met us at the taxi so we had to bring our own bags into the lobby. We were greeted by a lovely man at the front desk who checked us in very quickly and were offered a bell boy to bring our bags to our room. The lobby of the hotel is very chic. Loved the lights in the floor! We headed up to our room. The room was modern, clean and somewhat spacious. The bathroom was fabulous! Room service was very fast and the food was always hot. Overall it is a nice hotel and I would rate it as above average.

Reviews.Title: “Deliciously elegant”
Reviews.Author: CarminaTN1
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Water Tower has become my favorite place for weekend getaways to Chicago. Its modern French decor and friendly, attentive service make you feel like a VIP from the moment you check in. The rooms are immaculately clean, beds are luxuriously comfortable, and the bathroom amenities (including large tubs and showers) invite you to relax. (But, don't sleep in too late...you don't want to miss the great shopping that is just around the corner!) What's even better is that he hotel restaurant is a fabulous choice for dinner. Typically I'm not a big fan of eating in hotel restaurants for reasons other than convenience, but the menu, service and wine selection at Les Architectes is not to be missed. Fish dishes are especially good, and if you like chocolate, you MUST try the warm chocolate cake with the salted caramel center. Stop by the separate hotel bar before dinner for an apertif or afterwards for a final libation; the atmosphere is cozy and there is even a fireplace to enjoy on cool nights. I've been to Sofitel about four times now, and can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nimy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with my friend who was here on a business trip. The hotel is lovely and smells very nice in the lobby. Haven't eaten here so no comment on that. Staffs are pretty friendly. They got a free business center also. Walking distance to John Hancock center, Magnificent Miles and other restaurants on Rush st. The room we got, supposed to be Junior suite but the view wasn't very nice. The bed was very comfortable. Had a lovely stay but not sure if I'd stay here if I have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with some services to be improved”
Reviews.Author: Sandrobat
Reviews.Content: I have been at this Hotel on February 2012 for a business meeting. The hotel is very well located in the downtown Chicago, just one block away to the famous Michigan Avenue, the most famous spot for shopping in Chicago. Very nice room (I was at the 25th floor) with nice view on the Chicago skyline. To ve critic there are things to improve. The meeting room that we got was very small and not well climatized... the Fitness room is very small and much less organized than the average in the US. No swimmingpool and no sauna. Also, there is a small coffee that serves also sandwitches but not a real restaurant. Finally the brakfast has no buffet but only a la carte...

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Rundquist Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the sixth year in a row that we have spent our anniversary at the Sofitel. We have ALWAYS been made to feel comfortable and special. You can not go wrong at this hotel. The rooms are spotless and their attention to detail is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in February. If you have stayed at a Sofitel before then the experience here will be very similar. The property is beautifully designed with a nice bar, a small gym that is adequate and a good restaurant. The guest rooms are a little smaller than the rooms at the Sofitel in New York but of a similar design and layout. The rooms are quiet, clean, well appointed and the beds are the best in the industry. The staff was friendly and helpful and quickly recognized me after the first day. The hotel is within close walking distance to the Water Tower shops and Michigan Ave. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Eljay_12
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and once again we thought it was great: the room, the food, the staff, everything was first class. Only gripe is that the free wi-fi was very slow and cell phone service intermittent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Sherri C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night for my 40th birthday - when we got back to the room, there was a decadent chocolate cake that said "Happy Birthday!" on the plate on the dresser with Perrier and another fancy bottled water. How nice! Room was beautiful, staff was extremely accommodating without being invasive and hotel itself was gorgeous. Also, hotel bar was very nice and had a crowd until closing (1am) on a Thursday night. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with Breakfast/Parking package”
Reviews.Author: Lumpajay
Reviews.Content: My top priorities for the hotel I chose for our three nights in Chicago were comfort, breakfast, and parking included for an appropriate rate. I've stayed at one other Sofitel before (Manila) and loved it, so this was my first consideration. The available rates were slightly less than my two other choices (the Peninsula and the Waldor Astoria- WA had an Auto Show special rate that was super cheap), but when I called the hotel directly, they gave me the breakfast and parking package because I asked for a deal and part of my stay did qualify for that package. Also, I believe we were upgraded to the next room category free of charge. Awesome value. LOCATION: It was ideal; it was easy to find, and there were plenty of places to eat within walking distance, as well as a nice little grocery store on the same block just around the corner. Plus, our view from the 22nd floor was very nice! SERVICE: Every person we encountered was very friendly and courteous, and if applicable, very helpful. The only person that disappointed me was the man that checked us out- we didn't receive the 2nd breakfast credit each day (which was $20/person), but the bill that I received wasn't detailed enough to show that. I simply told him that I didn't know why our bill was over $60 more than it should have been. He was unable to find the error, and since I was holding up the line of people checking out, I resigned myself to call back that evening when they may be less busy. I did over-pay upon check out, but the man I spoke with that evening was able to correct the mistake and refund me the difference. To his credit, though, the man who checked us out did show quite a bit of patience for what must have just looked like a young woman who wanted to get out of part of her bill. ROOM: Our room was a little weird since it was in the corner of a triangular building. It could have been a little bigger. The bathroom area was fairly large though. The bed was very comfortable, but after three nights, my back was a little sore from how soft it was. My husband was fine, though. It was also one of the least noisy places we've stayed in, especially considering its location. The toiletries were nice- L'Occitane verbena shampoo, conditioner, etc, as well as nail files, bath loofah, and emergency sewing kit. FOOD: The breakfasts were fantastic, especially since we were given the credit for the full American breakfast regardless of what we ordered. I had the brioche French toast, which was very good, and the Maine lobster omelette was ridiculous. It had a whole lobster claw (without the shell) on top, and more lobster in it than many tails I've had! My husband had the lingonberry waffles, which were exquisite, and the super-fluffy buttermilk pancakes. Our last morning we ordered room service breakfast and both had the delicious apple-cinnamon crepes. The spreads were simply amazing. We were served French pressed coffee, unlimited juice, and had a basket of croissants (regular, raisin, AND chocolate, as well as some baguette rolls) along with our breakfasts. The bacon was awesome too. I would definitely recommend the bacon! BAR: The bar was decent. It was definitely upscale, but nothing stood out about it. I enjoyed the champagne flight while my husband enjoyed their large selection of Scotch. The apps were a good value- relatively inexpensive yet good quality. Overall, I felt our stay was an exceptional value. Unless I decide to spend a fair bit more on our next visit, I will surely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a solid experience”
Reviews.Author: PassportAlwaysOnHand
Reviews.Content: I have been doing a bit of business in Chicago lately, and I stumbled upon the Sofitel through Expedia, which I use quite frequently. There is very little that I would say is "fantastic" here, but there is little that I would say is anywhere below "very good". The rooms are clean, the beds very comfortable, the area is convenient and fun, the restaurant is very good, and overall the service is very good also. I was a little surprised that I saw it was #9 in Chicago... however, bang for your buck? MIght we way up there. Overall? Have never had a bad experience in a half a dozen stays now.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine72
Reviews.Content: From the second we checked in I knew this hotel was going to be amazing. The staff (Adam) was very nice and even wished me a happy birthday. Our room was on the 18th floor and it was awesome. VERY clean and the bathroom was huge and bright. I am very picky and was amazed at how nice our room was. We had a package deal that included parking ($54.00 a night) and breakfast at Cafe Des Architecte. I highly recommend this hotel and the restaurant. The staff in the restaurant couldn't have been nicer. They were packed and we still were not rushed or anything. I hope I get a chance to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ihatebdbgs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary, honeymoon, his bday, and Valentine's Day in a long weekend in Chicago, and wanted a luxury hotel that wouldn't break the bank. We arrived from Ohio on the train at 10:00am. We were greeted at the front desk and were told that we were given a complimentary upgrade to the Prestige Suite, which we were able to check into right away. This was on the 29th floor, a corner room. We were also the guests of the day, and so received tickets for two free cocktails in Le Bar or Cafe Des Architechs. We did purchase the Haute Cuisine package, which included breakfast in the restaurant, and one free dinner. The bar and restaurant staff made us feel like we were the only patrons there! The food and wines were to die for, and the decor was chic yet comfortable. The views from the room were breathtaking! We did not tire of walking out of our room and seeing the skyline, day and night! how the building is setup, you can stand at the window and look down OVER your feet to the ground. The bed was sooo comfy, the bathroom huge and clean, the turn down service was nice, as were the salted caramel chocolates as our welcome gift on the first night.Would give this hotel a 6 or 10 rating if I was able!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: wallybeary
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for this hotel through Amtrak,we were celebrating our 5th anniversary and wanted to travel by train. We stayed 4 nights, and our breakfast was to be included per our reservation. One of the reason I picked the SOFITEL. I email the hotel the day before to tcondfirm our reservation and heard nothing back. When we arrived they could not find our reservation, so after about 20 minutes we got our room. The included Breakfast was according to the hotel something that we should not have recieved because of the rate through Amtrak, but they did horor it anyway. So now about the hotel, we had a king room on a high floor , the delux king . The room was small our view was of the office building behind us, but not bad. The bed was good to sleep in, the bathroom was large compared to the room. The only real complaint I have about the room was there is not a dresser for your clothes, there is a very small closet we could hardly hang our coats and a few shirts. Overall it was clean, and we were in walking distance to several stores and activities. I dont think I would stay again just because I think there are many choices,

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I would have expected”
Reviews.Author: WESTMI
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I really expected a lot more from this hotel. We had a suite on the 24th floor and it smelled from the minute we walked in. It was clean but appeared to be very dated. The bed looked like 2 mattresses that had been thrown right on the floor. I just really expected a lot more due to location, price, reviews, etc. Next time we will pick something different.

Reviews.Title: “Business tripe - great stay, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: serik78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights. From check in to check out the service was impecable. Super friendly staff. Great restaurant and bar. Above all excpectations

Reviews.Title: “An underwhelming experience”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here in February for a long weekend to celebrate a special occasion. Maybe I was expecting a little bit more after reading so many raving reviews, or maybe the front desk and the concierge had a really long day, I felt the check-in process was rather impersonal, and they didn't even mention my elite status with Accor group, ie, thanks for your patronage and etc... They took your ID and credit card, gave them back to you with the key cards, pointed the elevator. That was it, "Next in line!" Wow, I thought I was at the Chic-fil-A down the street. We were assigned to a higher floor with city view, actually it was more like the full view of "One Delaware Place Apartments" building, from my window I could actually see the pizza boxes on the dining table of the tenant who lives at that building. The room is clean, but it has definitely seen better days, but I do like their bed which is softer than most of the hotels here in the US. The housekeeping staff were very helpful and friendly though when providing turn-down service or bringing up room service. The front desk on the other hand seemed couldn't care less. Will I come back again as an elite member? Probably not. There are plenty of choices for 4.5 stars hotels in Magnificent Miles such as Conrad and JW Marriott which you will receive far better service.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious visit”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTatonka
Reviews.Content: My husband and my self went to Chicago for a 3 day getaway and were so happy that we opted to stay here. We took the train/ subway from the airport to the hotel and it took about an hour. From the moment we arrived we found that the front desk staff and concierge were attentive and helpful. The room was very clean (passed our bed bug check) and the amenities in the bathroom (soap, shampoo, body lotion) were of a very good quality. The hotel's location made it very easy for us to get oriented and made it a great spot for us to base our different day tours and visits. We never ate in the cafe or bar so can't comment on it. The bed was very soft, suspected that the pillows and comforter were down and were worried as my husband has allergies- but he didn't react. We were so impressed with how quiet the hotel was- we were by the elevator and it looked as though the hotel was quite full, but we didn't hear anything and slept very peacefully. Hoping that the next time we can bring the kids and take advantage of any future promotions/ discounts as it was a great experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly S
Reviews.Content: When you see the pictures on the website and enter the hotel it is the exact same. Very nice and clean hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. I loved the room. The bed was so soft. I slept like a baby. The room also had a mini bar but be carefull to pick up anything out of there it automatically charges to your bill. We love to eat a Giordanos and it was right down the next block. The hotel also offers babysitting. It does not have a pool or hot tub that would be the only downfall. Would recommend staying there. They also offer military

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: We had heard that this was one of Chicago's nicest hotels and we were not disappointed. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the housekeeping staff was courteous and prompt when I asked for the down to be removed from the room since I'm allergic and the room was very clean and well maintained. While the prices are certainly not for those on a budget, if you have the chance to splurge for a night, I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: Very nice , clean hotel. Very modern. Room is nice, but small; however, the bathroom is large. No coffee service in room and no prices on room service breakfast, which was very expensive for this hotel. We had dinner down the street at Gibsons, which was fantastic. Highly recommend, except room service high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, great staff, close to easy transportation”
Reviews.Author: ccrocks
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is beautiful and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The bar is inviting and the snacks served very tasty. Right outside is a taxi line, and good restaurants are within walking distance. The Red Line subway is just two easy walking blocks away. I will say, the room had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! We had a King bed and we each had two pillows - a firm and a soft. We both slept very well, something not too common when we travel. We stayed four nights, and it was wonderful! Will definitely stay there when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Odessa1801
Reviews.Content: We went for vocation 3 days very good every thing thank you everybody.

Reviews.Title: “An uncommon level of taste and service.”
Reviews.Author: Bethany C
Reviews.Content: I would like to offer my warm appreciation for the exceptional level of service that I experienced while staying with you last week. I was in town on business and made my first visit to your hotel, but I hope that it is not my last. I was impressed with the high level of taste and sophistication first and later by the consistently gracious hospitality shown to me and my colleague over the course of our 3-night stay. Every staff member I interacted with, from the bellmen to the housekeepers to the front desk and restaurant staff were truly professional, absolutely top notch. Whatever you are doing, keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaCin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for 4 days this January. Service, from front desk to doormen to maids was excellent! Had booked a standard, king room and it was clean, spacious and nicely furnished. Also recvd complimentary bottles of Evian. For those who care, toiletries were L'Occitane (Hermes if you are booking the suites) and towels were Frette. One caveat is that I did hear plumbing noises from the room next door one morning but it stopped when the shower ended.. Hotel is literally minutes away from Michigan Ave so it was convenient to walk to shops, restaurants etc. No coffee makers in room but there is a Starbucks on Chestnut St as you walk towards Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Good shopping Location”
Reviews.Author: JamesHAfrica
Reviews.Content: Well managed, good location and great restaurant. I thoroughly enjoy staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “My extremely high expectations were exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: Cam33_8
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for a weekend getaway for my boyfriend's birthday. I had wanted to do something special and when I found an online deal for this hotel, I decided this could be it. Based on others' reviews, I had extremely high expectations and was worried I would be disappointed. I am happy to report that this hotel exceeded my expectations in absolutely every way! Upon arrival, we were greeted by an extremely friendly and helpful front desk. I had mentioned in our online reservation that the reason for our stay was my boyfriend's birthday, when we entered our room, there was a silver platter, with a beautiful handcrafted dessert of mouse, caramelized bananas, and a chocolate bar with the words "Happy Birthday" written on it. The silver platter also included a hand-written birthday card from the manager of the hotel and Saratoga and Perrier water, all at no additional charge! I was blown away! The bathroom also far surpassed my expectations! It had wonderfully soft white robes and slippers along with French shampoo, conditioner, and body wash that all smelled fabulous. The Bose sound system was amazing, but I think the very best part of our entire stay was the bed. I honestly don't think I have ever slept in a more comfortable, soft, perfect-in-every-way bed. Both of us agreed that it was by far the best sleep we have had in as long as either of us can remember. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, from the fresh flowers in the lobby to the Evian's before bed this hotel paid attention to every detail and was a truly amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classy”
Reviews.Author: Fortunateson
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, extremely well managed. The staff are bright, helpful, and well trained. Beautiful, tasteful rooms. We were upgraded to a suite for a night of our stay. Sofitel is obviously proud of their property and focused on the guest's comfort and having a positive experience. The location is very convenient (even if you choose the train from O'Hare there is a stop nearby) for shopping,restaurants, etc. They also have a terrific restaurant on the property. However, I don't think that they had a hand in the 70 degree temps we experienced during our visit in November 2010 (but I wouldn't be surprised!).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bitner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Sofitel and cannot speak highly enough about it. From the Valet to the front desk personnel to the servers in the restaurant, everyone was very nice and helpful. The rooms are very pleasant with very nice ammenities. The location of the property cannot be beat as it is located in the heart of the Gold Coast area. Le Bar, located off the lobby, is a great place to enjoy a pre restaurant cocktail. We found this to be a rather incredible hotel for the price we paid. We will most certainly be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spenney
Reviews.Content: We booked for four nights but missed connection and had three. Room was fantastic with robe and slippers, Perfect view of Hancock Tower and glimpses of lake. Wouldn't normally eat in hotel restaurants but we did and it was michelin class, together with muse bouche's etc. Breakfast couldn't fault. Brilliant location. Great bar. We've now stayed in Sofitel in Lisbon and I think it was Philadelphia always top class.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: My coworkers and I stayed at the Sofitel in Chicago for 3 nights while we were in town for business. I was able to negotiate an amazing rate with them since we were a larger group. This hotel is a great value for the comfort and luxury it provides. Check in was smooth and uneventful. Our rooms were all clean, well taken care of, and the beds were crazy comfortable. Part of our assignment while downtown was to do some research on retail during the holidays. The Sofitel was a perfect location for us. We were able to walk to Michigan Ave and hit all of the major shopping areas. High End, Department stores, boutiques, etc. Plus we had our choice of great restaurants. We didn't have to take a cab anywhere. A great place to see the sights of downtown Chicago! When we returned to the hotel at night, we regrouped in the lobby bar and it was a great place to unwind with a cocktail. Highly recommend. I'd definitely stay here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahtram56
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Hotel Sofitel one block from the magnificent mile in Chicago on New Years Eve. What a delight it was to walk into that beautiful lobby all decked out in soft sparkling lights and beautiful fresh flowers. The hotel was clean, the staff absolutely amazing and very helpful. The rooms are decorated beautiful and are clean with nice toiletries. The bed was magnificent and the hotel location is tough to beat! We were in town for a family wedding. Ate a wonderful dinner just across the street at McCormick and Schmicks upon arrival. We would highly recommend this hotel. Only downside was the pricey parking.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Worm16
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was nice and warm!! Always helpful. It was in the best area for walking and site seeing. I felt very safe!! The maids made sure that the room was spotless at times a bit over helpful not that it was a bad thing!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PlaidTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sofitel is located one block directly west of the John Hancock Building, and thus one block off the Magnificent Mile. We appreciated the location as it is close to great restaurants and shops, but not squarely in the middle of the crowds which frequent Michigan Avenue. The hotel lobby is contemporary, but not grand. The front desk staff was exceptionally courteous and friendly. The entire building is contemporary in design, and has some odd lines (think back to geometry class and the definition of a trapezoid). That being said, the odd lines are intriguing and add to the hotel's sophistication in a way. Our room, a suite at the end of the building, was lovely with good views of the city and parts of Lake Michigan. The floor plan was large with a lot of unused space (again, think trapezoid). Nevertheless, we enjoyed all of the space, and the quiet, 30 floors above the city. Unfortunately, I must echo the comments of another review who said their suite smelled of body odor. Ours did too, particularly the bed. The linens had definitely been washed, but I could not get past the b.o. smell, which is why I cannot give this hotel five stars. The nice Herme's soap, apparently reserved only for guests of the suites, helped me forget the b.o. though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katshorr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for two nights and couldn't have chosen a better hotel for our Chicago visit. Our room was on the 32nd Floor with a fantastic view of the city and glimpses of the lake! It was hard to leave the room as it was so well appointed along with the above mentioned views. Staff is standard Sofitel style- professional and extremely accommodating. Location could not have been better. Only drawback and this applies to all of Chicago is the costs for parking your car. Overnight parking was $35. and if you valet it is $50! Apparently the parking rights for the streets of Chicago were bought by a private company. Meters on the street are $3.00 per hour/ 7 days a week and even valeting at restaurants is $12 and up. It's not a great city for a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, my alternative to the four seasons when I bring the kids.”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninNZ
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. I like being close to oak and rush streets. Close to the boutiques, barneys, the lounges and restaurants on rush/division. I statyed in a junior suite with my wife and two kids. The sofa bed was great, believe it or not. It had a down feather top, etc. Kids loved it. The price was okay as I prefer the Four Seasons down the street, which is more. But with kids in tow, the Sofitel seemed more kid friendly. Of course, the Sofitel is a notch down, but it's still nice. I would go back again. The service was okay, not fantastic. I had to call housekeeping to make up the sofa bed. While it was worth it, it did take a little while. The restaurant had an awesome butternut squash soup but my Madagascar shrimp salad was just so-so. The shrimp was not fresh but the flavor was good. I avoided the shrimp after the first bite. The room was clean and new. Bed was comfortable as mentioned in other posts. A very nice stay. I would suggest the hotel improve it's workout facility. It was cramped and not well ventilated. I expect more from a four star hotel. Sadly for the kids, mo pool! Overall, we would go back again. Price point below Four Seasons and location is just as good. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities, classic service”
Reviews.Author: Stacy823
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a last-minute trip to Chicago for a holiday change of pace. I searched Hotels.com and found the Sofitel. The price was great. We've never stayed there before, so we rolled the dice. It was really great. The room was spacious, modern and comfortable. The staff was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel with wonderfully appointed rooms. The concierge was very helpful in directing me to a store where I could finish up my holiday shopping. A couple negative things were not getting my wake-up call (desk clerk apparently didn't get it entered) and a small housekeeping issue. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Exellence”
Reviews.Author: FitToLive
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a 4 day, 3 night stay at the Sofitel and will definitely be back. This hotel is in a wonderful location just 2 blocks from Water Tower Place as well as 3 blocks from Oak Steet AND it's right on Rush! We arrived to a somewhat rocky start - I had requested rooms next to (or very close to) each other as we had our two teenage daughters with us; request was noted however rooms were on two different floors..unacceptable. They immediately rectified the situation and our rooms ended up just down the hall from each other..Oh did I mention that since we were staying 3 nights our rooms were upgraded to Jr. Suites?? Nice touch as they were much more spacious - our room was a corner room and quite large with floor-to-ceiling windows on one side. Had lunch at the restaurant while waiting for rooms and it was delicious! Also had breakfast another day with another couple, we all loved it. They really try to go above the normal level of service ... ie, my husband ordered a special juice blend for breakfast which was offered however they were out of it that day. The chef actually put together another special blend of juices just for our table. Love the French coffee presses too! We enjoyed the bar a couple of nights and found that again the service was friendly, not stuffy but attentive. Friday and Saturday nights the bar was very busy! NIce fireplace to sit by if you are fortunate enough to get a seat there. Our room was very comfortable and had robes and slippers as well as Hermes bath soaps/shampoos. Bed was great!! As others have noted, I too noticed there was no top sheet, just a wonderful down comforter to sleep under.. not sure if this is a French custom??? Didn't matter, we slept great. We will definitely come back to the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: winnetka
Reviews.Content: This one is not to be missed. Great design, staff, rooms, bathrooms, room service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: freddy h
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a great hotel in one of the best cities in the country. Great service; ask for a room with a view of the John Hancock building.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at Sofitel Chicago and had a wonderful stay. Our stay was very comfortable and the room was well priced. The room, bed and service were of great standard and as expected of Sofitel hotels. The staff were exceptional - they were both friendly and offered great travel advice. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel if price is not a factor”
Reviews.Author: InspireMI
Reviews.Content: This hotel has plenty of 5 star qualities at a slighlt better price. The views are amazing and the rooms are well appointed. The staff is very helpful and willing do help you in any way they can. Clean atmosphere and a nice lounge area make it a great spot for a martini and piano nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in the best part of town”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_Chris
Reviews.Content: Still a very nice place to stay. Good rooms and very good bathrooms. Friendly staff. Great restaurant. Super location. Only problem - the closets are tiny!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Vicki000
Reviews.Content: I go to Chicago quite often but this is the first time for me to stay at the Sofitel. I booked it primarily for the location. The room was clean and comfortable. I felt welcome and had a great view. The icing on the cake was the 40% off promotion they ran during my stay. Usually I stay at the Ritz Carleton down the street but the rates were double what I usually pay there. I had my daughter with me and booked a room with a pull out sofa. The sofa was made up with a feather topper and was just as comfortable as the bed I slept in. My daughter lives in the area so I am sure I will be back often. Highly recommend! I also would like to mention the fabulous Hermes bathroom products. Love love love the scent!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: downstate401 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Sofitel and it has never disappointed. The hotel is convenient to a lot of great restaurants and shopping. Instead of valet parking we park in the parking deck just a block north of the hotel. It is about $15 less than valet.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: TraveltogetherDallas
Reviews.Content: Although the location is very good, this property is lacking in several areas. The finish-out is most definitely not high-end...cheap fixtures, carpet, and other furnishings are noticeable, especially when compared to other newer Sofitel properties in Europe (including the fabulous new Sofitel at T5 at Heathrow). The mattresses are low-end (and the down duvet used as a mattress pad can't cover that up). I like the fact that the shower and tub are separate, but the shower stall is so tiny that it is almost not worth the effort. The plumbing fixtures are low-end American Standard that could have been purchased 10 years ago at Lowes. The "luxury" rooms are very small (even for Chicago standards) and their layout is not well-designed. Plus, the rooms were very hot. I set the thermostat to 65 and was still hot while sleeping. The decor is terrible. Maroon paint and carpet...really? They were trying for a warm contemporary style but failed miserably. The entire hotel feels dark and unwelcoming. Service is not bad, but not great either. My sense was that the staff had a "ho-hum" attitude...not surly, but certainly not outgoing or guest service oriented. One wonders why Sofitel compromised on brand standards given the high-profile nature of this particular property and the fact that they are trying to compete in the competitive luxury segment in this part of Chicago. Overall, if you can get a low rate (I wouldn't pay more than $180/nt or so) and don't plan to be in the room much, this is an OK place to sleep, but don't expect much room and don't come here if you are looking for an aesthetically pleasing interior (to be fair, the exterior architecture is striking...just wish they would have carried that through inside).

Reviews.Title: “best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: svuhmed
Reviews.Content: the good - the beds in sofitel are fantastically comfortable - the room and bathroom are beautifully designed and a good size - very close to madison ave - cool looking building - fruit provided in gym friendly staff without being in your face (everything about this hotel is great - just a few nitpicking niggles) the less good. - charging for internet (I wish hotels would just add a couple of bucks to the room rate and provide free internet). at least the internet you paid for worked well - unlike other places. - the picture hanging over the bed came down too low - so you could not sit up comfortably on the bed - newspaper provided was usa today - the wait for the elevators was slow - but this might be unfair on my part - it is a tall building

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in the Chi”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: Every time i stay here i have such a great experience. The hotel is beautiful in a great part of Chicago and the staff and service is impeccable. I cut my foot out boating and requested some first aid and bandages when i got back to the hotel. The next morning a fruit basket was delivered with a card wishing me a speedy recovery. This place just goes above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, dated decor but otherwise good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BtwBlackandWhite
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel and decent choice to stay, particularly if you have a good discount. However, if you are paying full price, you might want to reevaluate your other options first. Pros: - Location: steps away from the Mile and right in the area with a good mix of nice restaurants and boutique shops. Taxi stand is right next to the building, making catching a cab at an inconvenience hour very early morning a breeze. - Soaker tub and separate shower in a 4 star, i guess that's a plus? Cons: - A bit dated decor in the room and in the hotel hallways. - The soaker tub is a bit small in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Only one place to stay in Chi-Town!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn1960
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is perfect. Smart, snazzy, great bar and restaurant. Bernard, at the Concierge Desk is the best. And the lobby smells wonderful! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jkbeasley
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Chicago is the best hotel we have ever stayed in overall. The bathrooms are completely functional but luxurious, the beds are great, and the service is accomodating but not overwhelming. It is perfectly located and has a fabulous bar and lobby space. A great place to stay, especially at holiday season for shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We've had to return to Chicago several times recently for business meetings. Often we plan our meetings on a Friday or Monday to enjoy a weekend away in Chicago. After a few bad choices of hotels, we decided to stay at a newer hotel (slightly pricier)and we chose the Sofitel after walking by on several occasions in past visits. The hotel is new, very clean, and well located. With meetings downtown, it is close to walk anywhere. The hotel is also in a safe area close to many excellent restaurants. Our room was smaller than some other hotels we've stayed at nearby but definitely big enough for our needs and full of amenities. I'm sure there are larger rooms available at a higher price. The service at this hotel is good, but not fantastic. With that said there is nothing really to complain about specifically. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Chicago Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First off, the reason that we chose Sofitel was because we fell in love with Sofitel after a week's stay in Moorea, French Polynesia. They really seem to know how to pamper their guests. Our stay at the Sofitel in Chicago was for a Bears game and we only were there for a weekend. Cleanliness: The hotel is exceptionally clean throughout the lobby and common areas. The room was no different. We had a bathroom that we felt safe enough not to use shower shoes and carpets vacuumed and room cleaned seemingly twice a day. The second cleaning of the day, the staff closed the blinds and turned on some music on the bose alarm clock. The first night that they did this, we were a little confused but we figured out what was going on lol. Location: Awesome location, close to shopping, restaurants and a small tavern that I managed to close down on one of my nights. One thing though....Chicago is my home town so I am used to it but downtown near Michigan Ave gets very busy and sometimes violent. While we were out shopping, we passed by two fights and then one at the tavern. So just be mindful and be safe. Room Service: Sofitel breakfast in Moorea was good and pricey to the tune of $120 per morning. Sofitel American breakfast in Chicago was even more AWESOME and much better value. We ordered fried egg whites one morning and scrambled egg whites the next....guess what...they did it right each time. Every meal was fantastic! Sleep Quality: Beds were soft and pillows were stiff....for me. My wife slept like a baby that was drugged. Me, I tossed and turned and woke up with a stiff neck and a headache. Preference really. I wouldn't knock the Sofitel for my weird sleeping needs though. Overall: In comparison with the W in downtown Chicago, Sofitel was right there in every category if not better. My next visit home will be difficult to choose my next stay. I intend to try most, if not all of the luxury downtown Chicago hotels but I feel like I may be compelled to return back to Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location for visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at an excellent downtown location for visit to Chicago. It has nice, clean rooms and a good restaurant. The atmoshere is french, and may be felt a bit posh. Surprising lack of free internet/Wi-Fi may convince you to choose a cheaper down-town hotel.

Reviews.Title: “delightful stay in a very chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennisorbust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel recently to celebrate my friend's Mother's birthday. The hotel was absolutely beautiful and I highly recommend it. I look forward to a future stay. Our suite was very spacious and they even filled our bathroom with luxurious Hermes soaps and lotions. The hotel is very well appointed and the staff is very helpful. I would even say it is comparable to the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Incedible Bed”
Reviews.Author: Samantha R
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I'm in Chicago for business. It's a beautiful hotel with a georgoeus lobby. The rooms are very spacious and very clean and I never sleep better than I do when I stay at the Sofitel. My only issue is with the cost of their internet service. It's really quite expensive and don't understand why it isn't free as it is at so many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the heart of the shopping district. Wonderful service, attentive but not intrusive. Great food, especially the desserts (James Beard winner). Elegant to look at, But a bit pricey, especially the breakfast. The croissants are not as good as they are in France.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Stayed in junior suite. Package included valet parking and breakfast for two, which they made for three for my 11 year old son. Very attentive staff, friendly and accommodating. Very nice room with amazing bedding even for the sofa bed that they personally made up for my son. Will make this our "go to" hotel in Chicago. Bob in West Bloomfield, Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “great service, exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: OtisTilly
Reviews.Content: The staff is really top-notch. No request was scoffed. Room was very, very nice. Sofitel's have amazing beds. Bathroom one of the nicest, most spacious for a hotel. Lounge is lovely. Room service really good. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “High standard, large, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: JCB_222
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Sofitel in all aspects. We had a room on the 31st floor with a fantastic view of the Hancock Tower. Hotel is in an excellent location and was very quiet despite being busy over the weekend we were there. Staff were friendly and helpful. The floral displays in the lobby were beautiful and the complimentary coffee and croissants were great. We didn't want to leave! Only gripe is charge for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: simonnike
Reviews.Content: Don't think i have anything negative to say about the Sofitel Water Tower. Really liked the location, convenient walk to so many restaurants (and Walgreens, coffee, etc if you need it) and Michigan Ave. Valet is $49 overnight, but that seems to be the norm for Chicago. The bar was quite busy Friday night. I was pleasantly surprised with the $5 beer and my more expensive drink was worth it, quite tasty. We didn't try the restaurant, but the Nutella pancakes made me think about it. Room was good sized, clean, nice bed. The bathroom was clean, updated, and i liked the toiletries stocked in the shower and on the counter. The service was great, the concierge called the drugstore for me to ensure it was open early in the morning. The gym was busy at 7 am, but well appointed. I think there were 7 treadmills, 5 ellipticals, and a weight machine. Loved the banana and apples offered there! Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would definitely return next time i'm in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: threecedars
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and quiet. My room was on the 30th floor next to the elevator but I never heard it or anyone else coming and going. The location isn't as convenient to Magnificent Mile and Millenium Park as some hotels, but it's still easy to walk there if you're in good condition. It's close to plenty of shops, restaurants and nightlife, and is just a couple of blocks from the Red Line. The lobby is cozy at night and dimly lit with candles and has comfortable furniture and elegant floral arrangements. Le Bar has a snug library spot with a fireplace that adds to the ambience. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. My only complaint was the bathroom - the doors were noisy to close and there was a two inch space beneath the door and the floor, and the hard, cold floors could use a soft, fluffy bathmat or two.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was superb but the service made the stay outstanding. Everyone there seemed to take a personal stake in making the stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Simply elegant”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: Here on a business trip. Was immediately taken with the chic style of the lobby and rooms, the great 'local flavor' neighborhood, and the attentive staff who seemed genuinely concerned that I was enjoying my stay. A bit pricier than I like to pay, but that may simply be the going rate in Chicago these days. Would love to come back and explore the Water Tower district on foot when not distracted by tending to business! Reminded me of the Chelsea area of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mismanagement
Reviews.Content: Spot on!! Close to everything, stayed 3 nights, very clean , bright room. Very comfortable bed.. seemed strange without the Weims!! Very well run hotel, all service staff very pleasant and welcoming. Loved the danish / croissants at breakfast. Complimented a super weekend in Chicago... we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: avery755
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and inviting. The room was nice and the bathroom was very large. The location was great. We were able to walk to most shopping areas without a problem. It was our anniversary and the concierge helped my husband book a very wonderal and quaint italian restaurant for dinner. We will definitely return. I can't think of anything negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just off Michigan Avenue in a beautiful, modern building. We had a Junior Suite on the 18th floor (1 King, 1 sofabed), 4 nights for the price of 3. The room was a good size for 2 people, quiet, well decorated, and the king bed excellent (very soft). As for the bathroom - I'm a very simple guy, but really, this place could spoil you. Huge bathroom, with a tub and separate shower not to mention comp bathrobes. Easily the best quality for the price in Chicago! You're basically on the Magnificent Mile here, within walking distance or a short cab ride from most attractions. There's a great breakfast place around the corner and a new ING cafe across the street. Gibson's, a fantastic steakhouse, is a few blocks away. Also, a large, comfortable patio area just outside the hotel lobby where you can relax with a drink, have breakfast (see my comment below on prices), etc. The service was great, everything very clean (spotless) and the concierge very helpful. You really can't go wrong with this hotel. As far as short-comings - and these are really minor: the fitness center is tiny, the prices for add-ons (such as laundry) are high and the hotel restaurant seemed over-priced (but who eats in the hotel anyway?). Also, Wi-Fi is $10 a day - not a big deal. The hotel bar is quite nice, with a fireplace, etc., again, perhaps a little pricey. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants nearby, as well as a dry-cleaner, if you find the hotel too pricey. If you like a clean, modern look, you will love this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lacunar
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel, and it is very clean. Its location can't be beat: a couple of blocks west of the John Hancock building. I stayed in a "city view suite." My view wasn't as impressive as I would have liked, but it was still pretty decent. The room was very large, including the largest bathroom I've ever had in a hotel room. The toiletries included a nice brand of soaps/lotions and a body scrubber. The bed was fairly comfortable. The only odd thing was that there were no blankets; the bed contained a sheet over the mattress and a comforter. I thought that was odd, but it wasn't a problem. I ordered breakfast via the room service menu, and it was enjoyable. Even though the hotel is 30 plus stories tall, there are several elevators, and I never had to wait more than 30 seconds for one. You won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Timeisatrain
Reviews.Content: Chicago, the Vibrand City at the end of the American leg of our tour. As with all other hotels, we searched tripadvisor before making any choices. If you are reading this, and not yet sure about the choice of your destination: stop doubting! Look no futher: you've come the right place! This hotel is almost never gonna disappoint anyone we think. It's beautiful, and clean, no noise problems, within easy reach of restaurants, around the corner of The Magnificent Mile! Beautiful architecture on the outside. There' s a nice gym. Good quality concierge service. Rooms are spacious, they are noice free at night, good quality bedding. Good looking bathroom, luxurious and clean. Maybe the shower is a little tiny, but this is only a minor thing. There is wifi throughout the hotel, though reception was not great in our room. When we mentioned this, our fee was redeemed immediately. Basically: no real negatives to mention, a good location in the city, at the right price. Maybe the Sofitel just lacks a wow factor on some level. That's why our maine conclusion about this hotel is a 4 in 5 on the scale of TA!

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: scoutdog2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in a suite at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower with our 3 kids. First, check the address, it's not in or next to the Water Tower (the shops or the actual water tower) despite being called the Sofitel Water Tower. The location, however, is really nice. Just a quick walk (2 short blocks) to Michigan Avenue keeps you close to everything, but not right in it. The hotel is cool modern with a great lobby. Our suite was very nice & well equipped. They had a very comfortable air mattress they delivered to our room for our 3rd child (after requesting it on the phone with our reservation, at the front desk when we checked in and a call again when we got to our room & it wasn't there). Our suite had an amazing view, comfortable beds, large bathroom with shower and separate tub. The TV in our living room wasn't working, but after a couple calls to the front desk, they sent somebody to fix it. Overall, we enjoyed our experience at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: NMYankeeGal
Reviews.Content: Amazing amazing amazing - that means from the staff to the ambiance, the room, the meals, the service, and location. I would give it 10 stars if I could!

Reviews.Title: “The Wedding Present”
Reviews.Author: Ffatso
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Watertower is just behind the Magnificent Mile near the Watertower Plaza. It's a great location for shopping, but there are often weddings at the weekends which can feel a bit strange as a guest. Brilliant diner on the same block!

Reviews.Title: “France comes to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: primorski
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 wonderful nights here staying in a junior suite. In keeping with the architectural heritage of Chicago the Sofitel is a distinctive building in the Chicago skyline. The interior design continues the post-modernist theme. Our room was one of the best hotel rooms we have ever stayed in. It was very stylish, modern and spacious. In keeping with our previous stays in Sofitel hotels the beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was state-of-art. Meals in the onsite restaurant are expensive. Instead we found cheaper alternatives offsite and/or used the bar for moreish snacks. Great bar, cool atmosphere, wide range of drinks and good place to do some people-watching. Hotel cultivates a French ambiance which pervades all operations in the hotel. Centrally located hotel, close to major transportation nodes. Would in a heartbeat stay here again. bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “What a town - and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neptune75
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay whilst in town to see a music festival. The room was wonderfully appointed, incredibly clean, excellent amenities, helpful staff, great food, fantastic location and genuinely comfortable beds. My wife and I travel a lot and find the bed and pillow combination can really effect our sleep and our trip. The Sofitel have got it blissfully right! After a day in the sun, walking around the city sites or simply walking off another excellent meal from the hotel or any of the surrounding restaurants it was a welcome haven for rest and we will be staying there again next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago contentment”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Had a blissful six days in September here staying in a junior suite. Was a little disappointed on entering the room to find that unlike the New York Sofitel the junior suite did not have separate sleeping and seating areas - just one (very) large room with both areas within it. However on experiencing the room over a few days found the sheer space a joy - no bumping into bed corners or having to move stuff to access other stuff - recommended. As many have said before the bed is amazingly comfortable - I know the Sofitel bed is a common corporate selling point - but it does seem particularly well executed here. The house keeping was very good - efficient and unobstrusive - and everything in the room worked. The loaction of the hotel is very central and we found that we rarely had to spend more than 6-10 dollars on the few cabs home our aching feet demanded we take. Only downpoints were the impersonal nature of the staff - difficult to be anything else in a place this size I guess and my personal beef in that they charge for wireless access - bit of a cheek in this day and age and at these rates. With the range of Chicago restaurants available didn't use the inhouse dining facilities - but the menus looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort away from home”
Reviews.Author: 393Maria
Reviews.Content: The beds are soo comfortable. Travel quite often and I count these beds as one of only two hotels I have stayed in that have had beds this comfy. Couldn't beat the view either. Looking right at the Hancock building out our window. Didn't interact with staff much but the little we did was helpful. They even provided bandaids for my poor feet after buying new sandals :) Very clean, very quiet. Have recommended this hotel to family members already. Only downside was that the breakfast options were a bit pricey for us, but plenty of options just a stroll down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sexy, comfortable & convenient.”
Reviews.Author: TXGrlAustin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August, after missing a flight due to unbelievable traffic. I had been driving in from Wisconsin, and even though I allowed myself an extra couple of hours leeway, there had been an accident on the highway where gasoline spilled, the Air & Water Show was happening on the lakefront, and there was a Cubs game. After a horrendously long time spent in the car, at the airport, then a cab, it was such a relief to walk into the beautiful lobby with some of the most artistic flower arrangements I've seen. The staff were completely courteous and helpful, and the room was incredibly comfortable. I loved the L'Occitane bath products!! We had dinner in the bar - they provided full service, and were even more than happy to accommodate a member of our party who was on a restricted diet. The food was delicious, and the servers and bartender were friendly and efficient. The workout facility was also super nice. What was most unbelievable to me, however, was the excellent price of the room. I've paid close to the same amount to stay in some of the middle-of-the-road chain motels that can't even be considered in the same league- I don't know how they do it!! I would 100% recommend this hotel and will most definitely stay here next time in in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ernierad
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite for $100. per night. The staff was great and a great location for the magnificent mile plus Rush street.

Reviews.Title: “Fun vibe, nice location”
Reviews.Author: SarahDallas222
Reviews.Content: Great service, really convenient location. It's literally less than a block from the Magnificent Mile and another block to the Lakefront Trail. The room was on the smaller side, but everything was modern and clean. We were on the 11th floor, and we had a really nice view of the city. We also had some great drinks at the bar one night, and the bar had a nice crowd without being too crowded. The lobby had a fun Bloomingdales exhibit in the lobby, and overall, a really great energy about it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pikachu014
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a friend's wedding. She reserved a block of rooms at this hotel because it was a short walk to where the reception restaurant was... Location-wise, it is a short walk to everything you could need. Great restaurants - about 2 blocks away. Shopping on the Magnificent Mile - about 2 blocks away. The "L" station - about 2 blocks away. Service here was great, although sometimes a little spotty with the door-men (sometimes they are there, sometimes they are not). I thought the rooms were typical hotel rooms... nothing to special about them. Although they did have a few nice things like the flat screen TV and separate shower/tub in the bathroom. They also have turn-down service. If I had to pay full price for the room though, I most likely wouldn't stay here. Also note that cell phone service is pretty bad in this location.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at Sofitel / Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Tim W
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago on a business trip and the hotel was booked for me. I had never heard of Sofitel before but after staying there, I will probably never forget the name. What a wonderful place! The lobby was absolutely gorgeous, the room was very nice, bathroom was amazing, workout facilities were great, staff couldn't have been better and the view from my room (702 I believe) was great! Oh, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in! There is plenty of shopping and restaurants in the area too. A very nice place to stay and I hope to stay there again soon...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service - will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Youngkeems
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to EL train, 24 hour diner on the corner (which helped since my flight was delayed and didn't get in until 130am and i was starvin marvin). Service was impeccable, great lobby, lobby bar was fantastic. Needed a roll away bed and was there within minutes. Will def stay here again. Top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluizgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Sofitel and it was as enjoyable as the first time. The person at the reception desk told us about a great pizza place and he was right, it was the best deep dish pizza we had ever had. When it was time for dinner the concierge made reservations for us. The rooms are quite nice. I especially like the bathtub, when a lot of Chicago hotels are so small. My only slight complaint was no top sheet, just the duvet (must be a French thing?) Great customer service right down to offering guests umbrellas during a downpour. I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of Sofitels and Chicagos Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: DCeventjunkie
Reviews.Content: As a loyal fan of Sofitel I have stayed in several of their US properties and found the Chicago location to be one of my favorites -- with LA a very close second! With attentive staff from the valet and doorman to the regular presence of management in the lobby you always arrive to a genuine welcome. Nothing beats a Sofitel bed and this location is no different with attention to every detail and pride evident in the upkeep across the property. A pricey drink in Le Bar but with a luxurious touch it's a nice cocktail or date spot. I haven't dined in the restaurant lately and hear there's a new Chef, so I'll save that review for next trip -- as I'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Chicago stay at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower”
Reviews.Author: corlette43
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Chicago and as usual we did not know where to stay in the city and which hotel would suit us. As we had stayed in Sofitel Hotels around the world we selected the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower. It was the best decision we made, the staff were so helpful and as we were caught in Chicago due to Hurricane Irene they went out of their way to assist us. They provided us with valuable suggestions for activities and locations to visit and at the same time provided us additional nights in the same room without moving us to another room. The location of the hotel meant that we could walk everywhere and when we wanted to use the subway there was a station just around the next corner. My advice, if you are unsure of where to stay in Chicago, stay at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the most comfortable beds we ever slept on!”
Reviews.Author: skarfaceny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the Labor day weekend. The location is great-2 blocks from Michigan Ave (aka The Magnificent Mile) and walking distance from numerous restaurants, bars, and lounges on Rush Street. Avoid the breakfast at the hotel and head to "Temple" on the corner for a terrific breakfast (the locals flock to this place, we waited 15 min to get seated-well worth the wait). Our room was a "Luxury Room" on the 30th Floor. The bed was so comfortable that upon returning home we purchased the same featherbed and pillows from the hotel. The room also featured a large and spacious bathroom with a separate bathtub and glass shower. When booking make sure to search directly on the hotels website as they offer frequent specials, sometimes up to 33% off prices offered on those major travel sites. You can also find similar deals on suites on their site. I was lucky to find a deal for our room over a holiday weekend which made it a great value for the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and service”
Reviews.Author: BushResident
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant week in Chicago. Highly recommend the Sofitel. Great Gold Coast location - very convenient for the shops and Oak St beach. There was a slight mix up with our booking, but the desk staff sorted it all out without any fuss - very impressive. Concierge was full of great recommendations, and the rooms were spotless. Amazing lake and Hancock Centre views from our room. About the most comfortable bed going. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but rough around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: Katie D
Reviews.Content: The great: Temperature control. Walking into the dim, chill lobby on a sweltering summer day is an excellent feeling - it is cavernous and modern and the perfect counterpoint to heat and glare outside. It even smells amazing. Also, the blackberry margarita at the hotel bar was very memorable. The gross: Hideous magenta carpets in the rooms that seemed crusty with several years' (at least) worth of your room's previous tenants' skin cells and god only knows what else. In general, the furnishings seemed dated and in a questionable state of repair. The weird: The suites are huge but awkwardly arranged -- there seems to be more space than they know how to make use of. The Hermes soaps make one feel fancy schmancy but are unpleasant to actually use. Overall, it is a nice hotel but a bit shabby in the rooms - pretty typical of an older luxury hotel in a big city. I had a substantial discount off the listed rates through a Jetsetter deal and felt like I had paid exactly what the room was worth - would have felt overcharged paying the normal rate.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stefania_P_11_11
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, modern and neat hotel in a perfect location to discover Chicago. Near the Magnificent Mile, right in the Middle of the beautiful Gold Coast neighborood and the best reatil experience in town, we think this is the perfect choice to have great value for money too. We booked a luxury king room which had an amazing view on the city, light wood paneling and an heavenly bed. Everything was brand new: furniture, TV, bathroom with shower and bathtub. There's toileteries from L'Occitane en Provence and luxurious linen, plus the rooms are super clean and super quite. The gym is very nice too and there is a convenient 24hrs business center. The only disappointment was the concierge as it did not meet the standard of the other services. But we would definitely recommend Sofitel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl32655
Reviews.Content: After staying at other Sofitel hotels, this hotel was a disappointment. The rooms are extremely small (even compared to European hotel rooms). The decor looks dated, especially the red carpets. But, most importantly, the rooms were noisy. As soon as I arrived I heard the people next door, which means the walls were extra thin. Then I was woken at 6 AM by loud water pipe noises in my room. I am not sure if it was a water heater, bad pipes, or just someone taking a shower, but it was loud enough to wake me and keep me awake. This was terrible, since I was on Pacific time, so it was like being woken at 4 AM. When I spoke to someone at the front desk, he was extremely rude and said that no one had ever complained about noise in the hotel. This is the most ridiculous and unsympathetic response. I was given a quieter room after speaking to the manager, who was very nice. However, the next morning at 8 AM, housekeeping banged on my door wanting to clean my room. This was extremely odd. It seems that they don't want their hotel guests to sleep in or relax, at least I never was able to. Also, although Sofitels are famous for their comfortable beds, the mattress in the first room felt old and worn. They just add a pillow top to it, which actually didn't even fit well. Not to mention that the bedding had a strange cologne like odor. The only aspect of the hotel that I liked was the restaurant. The food was wonderful and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: TVT_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel-Chicago in downtown Chicago from August 22nd-August 26th. We loved everything about the Sofitel Hotel-Chicago. The room was clean, spacious and attractice. We had a very nice view of the lake and downtown Chicago from our 32nd floor room #3216. Sofitel staff were extremely professional, prompt and courteous. From the reception staff, to Concierge staff, to Housekeeping staff , to Doormen and to Room Service staff, everyone was very professional and respectful! The bottom line is Sofitel Chicago is by far the best hotel that we have stayed at ever! We will definitely be staying at the Sofitel - Chicago again and will only be staying at other Sofitel hotels for our travels. Forget about the other big 5 star hotels. This is by far the best 5-star hotel that we have stayed. We highly recommend Sofitel-Chicago and the Sofitel brand.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: chrisbrooks1
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff and it's location is perfect for walking the Magnificent Mile. We have nothing we didn;t like about this hotel. Easy access to great Chicago restaurants, too.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: BarryFromTheMountain
Reviews.Content: Pretty average hotel for me. Good points first: - Soft bed with pillow top mattress was comfortable - Bose radio in the room - large separate cubicle shower-good shower - great location next to MM - great cafe for breakfast if breakfast not included Points why I rated the hotel average overall - luggage was left on a trolley at the check in desk no offer to bring it up to the room-poor - the room didn't have the wow factor just a standard room in beige with standard hotel type furniture - door men hit and miss sometimes they were there to open the doors sometimes not. Sometimes there but didn't open the door. - no assistance with luggage on check out (except for the guy who hails the taxis outside who was excellent) - pillows were lumpy shame as they spoilt a good bed - air conditioning too noisy Worst of all I filled in the feedback form that was sent by email and had an email from the director of customer services (I think) asking if everything was ok. I spent a long while giving some very comprehensive feedback and it wasn't even acknowledged and no thank you. It'll be the last time I do that! -

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Hotwire during a very busy weekend in Chicago. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Location is wonderful. Check-in was very welcoming. The hotel lobby is stylish and modern. The room was impeccable. It was pristine, clean and tastefully decorated. The whole place felt like new construction although it has been around for years. Nice touches of convenience for the guest all over the room. Turndown service was great. Bathroom was very spacious with lots of counter space. We ordered room service. First time I've ever had room service where the pancakes were so good and so warm upon arrival. 25 minutes service! I will definitely aim to stay here as often as possible. LOVED it!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: 123thomas
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean hotel. A big plus was we were upgraded to a corner suite. Staff very nice and professional. Nice gym. Did not eat at restaurant. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at a perfect price”
Reviews.Author: Brendanmclarke
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel and it comes at an always wonderful value. The location is prime if you are wanting to visit Chicago and view the many sights it has to offer. You are a 1 mile walk from the Lincoln Park Zoo (which is free!), a few blocks from the beach and only steps away from the shopping on Michigan Avenue. If you are going to Chicago, you should give this hotel a serious look.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TruthfulCritic85
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect being only one block off of Michigan Avenue and in the Gold Coast area. There is plenty of shopping and dining in the area within walking distance, plus Navy Pier is probably only a 1 mile walk. The hotel itself is very modern including the rooms. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was nice, but small for a suite...guess that's why they call it "Junior". For the price ($400 a night) the room was a decent size with a mini bar and seating area. The bed was extremely comfortable. The view was kind of disappointing because it didn't have a lake view, but what can one expect when the hotel isn't directly on the lake. The room was quite and never heard anyone in the hallway or adjacent rooms. The reception staff was friendly, but the valet and door staff wasn't. The door staff only opened the door half of the time and hardly said a word. I've stayed at many upscale hotels, all of which had door staff that opened the doors and had warm welcomes. I don't want to say I expect that, but when the hotel is trying to hold it's status in the 4 to 5 star category range, these are the little things that mean a lot. Bottom line, this hotel is nice and modern with a good price for the area and part of the city it is located in.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that did not disappoint again on our second stay there”
Reviews.Author: widows_weeds
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Chicago in a year and we decided to stay at this hotel once again. If it were possible, this stay was even better than our first one.
