I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, from the best communal rest rooms off the main lobby that I have ever seen to a high standard of housekeeping twice a day. The location is second to none having the Magnificent Mile and State Street but a two minute walk away in opposite directions as one leaves through the main entrance. All in all, worth every cent of what a first may seem an expensive hotel. However, you do get what you pay for in every respect. My only small criticism is the price of beverages in the hotel bar which to my mind were excessive even by Downtown standards. But having said that, there are plenty of restaurants and bars within a stone's throw to avoid this unfortunate hotel management miscalculation of their guests tolerance to overpricing.

Reviews.Title: “All over the globe Sofitel will always be my number one choice.”
Reviews.Author: JackcatSydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2011. When I got out of the car a fine gentleman introduced himself to me and welcomed me with a kind smile. He gladly held my bags for me. When you walk in the lobby you feel so welcome. The lobby is beautiful lots of soft seats around. The front desk staff were very helpful and always welcome you by your last name. I was kindly upgraded to a suite. The hotel provides guests with a business centere located on level 2 with free Internet. If you want WiFi you have to pay a small fee. The room I was given was very large with all the trimmings. Such as a fully stocked mini bar and refreshment center. Complementary Evian water by my bed every day. Large windows with a great view of the John Hancock building. Blinds and curtains that are controled by a switch. 2 large plasmas one in my room the other in the lounge room. Housekeeping knew I was the only male staying in the suite so they stocked my bathroom amenities with male products by Herems Paris. Bathroom was beautiful large anti fog mirror bathtub was a bit small. However the handheld shower was very luxurious. Marble bathroom can't go wrong. The room came with slippers and a oversize bathrobe. Sofitel are known for there amazing beds and Chicago water tower did not go wrong here. The beds were amazing so soft and luxurious make for a fantasic way to get over jet lag. The rooms were cleaned everyday re stocked and newspapers left outside. I would give this hotel a 9 out of 10 the location is great the staff are great the hotel itself is unlike another. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WPK1911
Reviews.Content: Weekend getaway with the wife. Excellent service. Great location. Very nice all the way around. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Found the perfect hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jbbmke
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at dozens of hotels in dowtown Chicago and have never been completely satisfied until now. The Sofitel absolutely lived up to my expectations. I received a complimentary room upgrade to a Luxury Room and found the room large enough and comfortable. Overall I recommend the hotel because: -spacious room and bathroom -quiet -architectually interesting -excellent breakfast (the only meal I ate) -friendly, helpful service -luxurious amenities (Frette linens and towels, Hermes bath products, Bose, etc) -nice location-walking distance to shopping, attractions and restaurants yet quiet street -decent value for the quality of hotel -comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: comps535
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in quite a few hotels, all suites, etc. I will hae to say the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower is one of my favorite places. Great rooms, the lounge downstairs has a nice atmosphere. This hotel is also in a GREAT location. Short walk to carmines, merlot on maple, the underground, shopping, you name it. Everytime I want to stay downtown, I make sure its at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretend we are in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ParisgalChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: We took a "Staycation" and chose the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower. From the complementary croissant, cafe and Le Figaro in the lobby bar before 7 am to the cheerful "Bon Jour" or "Bon Soir" from the reception staff, it was a perfect " pretend we are in Paris!" Loved the fitness center and the beautiful view of Chicago from our well appointed contemporary room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sink-me
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business and loved it. Great proximity to restaurants, shopping, and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem”
Reviews.Author: tcufaude
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel, many, many times. It is in a great location. Trendy. I highly recommend this hotel. Has a lot of good energy...and a delicious restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mfoursdca
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a lovely hotel in the Gold Coast area of Chicago. It is just a block from Michigan Avenue and is in the midst of great shopping and sight seeing. The staff are very helpful even providing a picnic for my husband and I to enjoy in one of Chicago's many beautiful parks. We loved it and will stay there again when we return to the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SasiPenarth
Reviews.Content: Having just got married in Tuscany my husband had to fly to the states for a month, travelling from city to city with work so I went with him, along with our then 18 month old son. We stayed in the Sofitel and had the best stay ever. The hotel was very modern and clean and bright. The staff were amazing especially with our son and would take him for a walk around the restaurant or sit and play with him so that we could eat!! The rooms were perfectly spaced, not huge but just what we wanted/needed. The location was great, we Were just slightly off the MAIN drag but it was nice as it was a more Kitch area with lots of little boutiques and was right in the middle of a triangle of Starbucks! There is a supermarket around the corner as well as a basement car park. All in all, for what was a very short honeymoon, our stay at the Sofitel was perfect and we can't wait to go back, this time hopefully alone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippair
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Chicago -- a wonderful city, and we had a great experience which started when we booked our reservation at Sofitel Chicago. The phone service was exceptional, and when we arrived, we found the staff to be very warm and welcoming. From the fabulous exterior to the lobby, the Sofitel is modern and fresh looking -- real flowers everywhere, and smiling faces from the valet to the front desk and concierge, who gives helpful tips about what to see and how to best get there. Our room was fantastic, spacious and very clean. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. Gorgeous view from our 27th floor windows. This hotel is located near the Magnificent Mile and lots of other attractions -- close to subway and trolley stops too. We loved absolutely everything here and were very sad to leave after our 3 night stay. We will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic! Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: cstrickln
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 28th floor was Exquisite! Views! Comfort! Fabulous Bathroom! Romantic! The Service/Staff were exceptional. The outdoor breakfast area is wonderful, and the breakfast itself was beyond delicious. Great location and you can walk to almost anything your heart desires. Try their picnic basket luncheon package - fun! Also being a business couple, there is everything there you need to operate your business. Romantic perfection... What's to complain about? NOT A THING!

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: stephb6
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel and is in a good location close to Michigan ave, food and shopping. The lobby is very modern with fresh flowers every day. The rooms were nice and clean. There is a nice bar area and the workout room was one of the nicest I have been in. It was updated and had everything you would need. I think my only complaint was that the elevators were a little slow sometimes, but it didn't bother us very much. It was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: northernersun
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, located in the perfect spot to reach all the major attractions and just far enough from the noise. Room is the perfect size, large bathroom and the best bed ever. Staff was very professional and very willing to assist with any request. We were able to find a pkg that fit our budget and room requirements. Sofitel sends you a survey prior to your arrival confirming your needs and follow up after you leave. We will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled61
Reviews.Content: Overall great location, good service and perfect location for a short walk to Michigan ave or even the goldcoast neighbourhood. Had a tasty breakfast via room service one morning and went to the little cupcake store around the corner, which was amazing. Well worth the little money it was to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Expect more from The Sofitel Water Tower”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my first night, while in Chicago and at first what seemed to be a promising experience turned in total disappointment. Highlights: â€¢ Fantastic location in the heart of the Gold Cost neighbourhood with great shopping and dining nearby, all within easy walking distance â€¢ Wonderful lobby area with cool floral arrangements and lighting effects at night â€¢ Very friendly and effective service from everyone who was all willing to help me out with my issue â€¢ Amazing comfy beds, (thou for some it might be too soft) but I loved them â€¢ Views from my suite (on 27th floor) was very nice and scenic Disappointments: â€¢ The prestige suite was a disappointment for such a luxury hotel (which claims to be 4.5 stars), as it was dated, stingy order and overall had no â€œwowâ€� or really any luxury factor â€¢ Bathrooms where clean, however they were small, and dated looking and no real deep soaking tub or a spacious shower (which had no rain fall shower head, just a basic one). â€¢ Wear and tear on many places in the room with faded carpets â€¢ The biggest issue was the order from the blinds used in the suite, it created a horrible musty, mould-like order and there was no way to escape the order. Even when housekeeping tried very hard to mask the order, added fans to the room, it was still no help. I even asked to see other rooms and that was no help either â€¢ The mangerâ€™s response was not much better to my situation (maybe since they were fully booked?) he was not very apologetic and didnâ€™t do much to help the situation. I found his attitude was not very empathetic All in all, it wasnâ€™t a bad hotel, but it could have been better. Maybe my expectations where to high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front of House Staff, Location but needs better Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Karkman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have used this Hotel for weekends in Chicago and love the Location and the front of the house staff is Great and the prices via the web are great. The rooms are clean and roomy but it seems when they have a maintenance issue not brought to their attention by a guest it is not handled. Once a guest mentions a room maintenance issue it is addressed and fixed ASAP. The housekeeping staff cleans the rooms great but we walked into a room with a broken bed frame that should have been noticed by the cleaning staff and fixed. I called the front desk to complain and they were at my door in 5 minutes with keys and a bellman to take us to another room. Should have been fixed before I called, but addressed it ASAP and my wife and I were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Michiganmom45
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Terrific service and a very short walk to the 900 shops and restaurants. The desk service was terrific and it had a great gym. Rooms were very comfortable and quite spacious for Chicago. Huge bathroom with great toiletries. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Perhaps the Best Beds ever.”
Reviews.Author: kkeyser27
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is perfectly located for a trip to Chicago- just blocks from the Lake, Barney's, and tons of restaurants in the area. I have stayed there four times now and each experience has been great. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the beds are just about the best beds I have experienced. They also seem to keep the rooms amazingly clean. The architecture of the hotel is also fitting for such and architecturally unique city. Ask for a room on an upper floor with a view of the Hancock building.

Reviews.Title: “Always books our guest at this Sofitel and stay ourselves!!”
Reviews.Author: VictoryMin
Reviews.Content: We are a church in the downtown area and always book our guest ministers to stay at this hotel. The staff are very courteous, dependable, and accomodating. The rooms are a good size and well maintained. There is a restaurant on site and the hotel is well located with many other restaurants, shops, and parks/lake nearby. The valet parking is also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: aksnorth
Reviews.Content: Super well located, easy and safe walk to everywhere I wanted to go - all of the Michigan Avenue shopping, Rush Street, Looking Glass Theater, Museum of Contemporary Art, Art Institute, etc. I reserved a "low" floor room, and upon arrival was assigned Room 1709 (17th Floor) which had a fabulous city view looking straight east down Chestnut Street to the John Hancock Building two blocks away. My room was quiet - just far enough off busy North Michigan Avenue and high enough off the street to not be bothered. I also noticed very little noise transfer from adjacent rooms or the hallway. Both the food and service in the hotel restaurant, Cafe des Architectes, were excellent. The meals were on the pricey side, but as a treat I felt they were worth it. I was dining by myself, and was made to feel very comfortable - when you're travelling solo, this is not something that you take for granted. Loved being greeted in French/English and hearing French being spoken by some of the other guests. All of the reception desk, valet, bellman, restaurant staff appeared to be bi-lingual. As a money saver tip, if you're going to park your car for the visit and walk or use local transport while in Chicago, try self parking next door in the 24/7 public parking deck. It's $35/day if you self-park versus $49/day plus tip(s) if you use hotel valet.

Reviews.Title: “Chic decor with ultimate service”
Reviews.Author: Jundec
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights during a business convention and July 4th holiday. Never had to worry about a thing, meaning service, travel info, leisure time, etc. Great location for a variety of restaurants and nightlife. It was great to sit outside among the arts and craft space heaters with a drink or read the morning news. The hotel's lobby display of flower foliage is breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: mickib
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. What we loved about the hotel was the sleek, modern look, the clean spacious rooms and the great location. Another highlight is the breakfast, which has to ob one of the best in Chicago. Without being asked, they gave us a great room upgrade to a large suite -- that was a huge bonus! The bed was very comfortable. The downside was that we couldn't get in touch with the front desk when we tried to get a wake up call in the evening, and we couldn't get anyone on the phone in the morning either. Also, there were long waits to get to the reception desk. There were a couple of large groups and I think the staff was overwhelmed. But I would have expected better from a hotel of this caliber. I would still go back because the overall experience was very

Reviews.Title: “Heaven loved it”
Reviews.Author: Coutchi
Reviews.Content: Great stay right before business week. Just perfect. A bit jetlagged? enjoy the room, order some appetizers, good chardonnay, as I said heaven. Great deal thx to booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: Linespy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered this hotel, we felt pampered! Valet service was waiting outside to assist us with our luggage and 2 staff people were standing post to open the front doors for us each time we re-entered the building. All the staff were amazing in fact - from the front desk to the concierge to even the maid service! Beautiful lobby!! For us, the location couldn't be better. We were visiting Chicago to see all the normal tourist attractions and were able to walk to many of them from the hotel! Many wonderful restaurants also within walking distance and the hotel has, both, indoor and outdoor restaurants as well! The room was incredible.....VERY clean....with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Fantastic view of Chicago....heated bathroom floors....seperate luxury bath and HUGE tiled shower....and a Bose sound system. The only thing we wished we could have changed was that you had to pay for wi-fi service. 110% happy with our stay and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic People”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at Sofitel Chicago Water Tower. It was the people there that made the biggent impression on me. I was treated as if I were the only guest in the hotel and that everyone was there just to help me. No questions asked other than whether they could do more for me. From the receptionist to the concierge, from the door man to the bell hops, everyone was universally friendly and helpful. Definitely the place to stay when you aren't royalty, but want to be treated like one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a couple issues”
Reviews.Author: kern2d
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location, services and rating on TA. All expectations were met but for a couple of issues. Booked on their web site for a great rate, when I called the hotel to make an adjustment to the booking they actually found me a lower rate with more perks. Great! Somehow those perks didn't make it to the front desk and I had to remind them of the picnic and late check-out included in our rate. They made it happen with no issues, but I had to have the charge removed at check out, because again, they didn't enter it correctly into their system. To be sure the front desk happily took care of all the issues, but it would be best to not have to double check every detail. Beautiful room with an amazing view of the Hancock Tower. In room service was spectacular. We both found the bed to be too soft for comfortable sleeping. I got used to it, but my wife never did. This will probably have us looking for a different place to stay next time. Another irksome quirk that I can't blame on the hotel is that we had virtually no service from AT&T in our room on the 21st floor. I can't understand it as the hotel isn't surrounded by huge stone buildings to block reception. It was just another unfortunate negative of our stay. Lastly I am always offended to stay at a hotel of this caliber and be charged for in room internet access. I know most hotels charge for this service, but really, what year is this? A better hotel should offer this as part of its services. To sum up, this is a very nice hotel with an amazing location. Some people will find the beds to be like sleeping in a cloud. Those people will love their experience. If you need more support you might want to check with the front desk and see if they can accommodate you. The staff was always happy to help and made any issues disappear quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel, one of the best hotel chains in the world, delivers!”
Reviews.Author: freiburg13
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in Sofitel Chicago. Sleek design, great location, wonderful service, modern and elegant rooms, super all around. Had a great diiner in Cafe des Architectes, but that is for another review. Sofitel is simply one of the best options anywhere you go: I stayed in Sofitel NY, Paris, two cities in China, and was never disappointed. As a SPG.com Gold Member, I can only wonder when any of SPG numerous brands can beat Sofitel... at least once. Stay in Sofitel Chicago, at least once, for a special occasion, and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Tatiana and Nikolai from Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Chicago is a beautiful city and Sofitel is a modern and very well located hotel . The staff is excellent and the hotel is very clean . We did not like that it was a sealed building and smell in the room was not pleasant . I would not stay next time in the hotel where you can not open a window . I also advice them to change coffee bins in the restaurant . When you are staing in the French hotel you are expecting French quality coffee in the morning .

Reviews.Title: “What a bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu10
Reviews.Content: With its sleek, modern decor and super congenial staff, it's hard to go wrong staying at the Sofitel when visiting Chicago. The location is perfect for shopping and restaurants. The room was definitely designed with the guest in mind. The enormous marble tiled bathroom had a separate shower and tub. There is plenty of room in the closet to store all your stuff for a long stay. The only downside to this hotel is that it does not have free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marad12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower many times on business in Chicago. The location is wonderful -- everything in this exciting city is nearby. The rooms are clean and spacious, the beds unbelievably comfortable and the food and staff are appealing. I rent a car and appreciate the fact that the hotel is easy to find from O'Hare and secluded enough that when you arrive, you are not fighting traffic on the street. Business or pleasure, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Hotel....what a pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: s.g.toronto
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower, Chicago, and I cannot begin to express what a fabulous stay we had at this superb hotel! The location is excellent-central to great shopping and dining, as well as popular tourist spots. The lobby is lovely and inviting, the rooms are luxurious and spacious with fabulous, modern bathrooms with great amenities. Free internet and a nice outdoor lounge for reading and chatting located at the entrance to the hotel make for a hip, fun and elegant ambiance. I love this hotel and I can't wait to come back soon. One other note....Chicagoans are the NICEST, most friendly and warm people! What a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: accto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful amenities, restaurant & bar. Will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “European Class”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location within walking distance to virtually everything. While we had a little wobble with our picnic lunch order getting lost, the staff, especially the concierge was wonderful. Great attention to detail and subtleties that enhance the experience. A very international clientele sets this hotel apart from the others in the area - and there are many great hotels close by. Their restaurant gets high marks as well - we ate better meals here than at the surrounding tourist oriented places, like DeVons. Bottom line - it is not inexpensive, but as far as luxury hotels go, it is value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Chicago, Modern, Clean, Cool. A "jazz" hotel. But where are the outlets?”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: Right near Michigan, walking distance to Rosebuds on Rush (yum!). Was ugraded to a junior suite. Great check in, welcoming service. Room has that uber cool environment that some love. I like the clean lines, but it is a bit too modern to convey warmth. But the quality and service make up for all that. One major drawback...in these high tech times, a shocking lack of outlets in the room. I was moving furniture to find ways to hook up my Ipad and blackberry. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: “First Class !!!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-60653
Reviews.Content: I lived in Chicago for 15 years, but moved away 2 years ago. I decided to return for a long 4 day weekend to visit friends. I knew I wanted to stay near the Water Tower for its shopping and restaurants. Thus, I picked the Sofitel Water Tower for my stay. I was able to find the best rate on the hotelâ€™s website (www.sofitel.com) .The location of this hotel cannot be beat. The hotel sits on a quiet block but is only about 2 blocks to Water Tower. I was impressed the moment I pulled into the entrance for valet parking. I was greeted and offered assistance with my luggage immediately. During check-in I was also greeted with a warm and friendly smile. I was fortunate enough to have a Prestige Suite on the 29th floor. The suite is 700 square feet and is definitely worth the extra money. The view on the 29th floor was amazing. You could view the Hancock Building and Lake Michigan. Then there was the bed. You will feel like you are floating on a cloud. This was the softest bed I have ever experienced. If you don't like soft beds, then you may want to request a firmer bed type before arrival. Next was the living space which feels like a cozy and comfortable apartment. There were 2 hd tv's and a great working area for 2 people. I really feel in love with the bath products----Hermes. This hotel has everything going for it: location, great service, outstanding rooms. I could not ask for anything more. I have stayed at other hotels in the area, but this is now my favorite place in Chicago. I highly recommend the Sofitel Water Tower. I will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoInnsbruck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during a trip through the USA with my fiancÃ©e and I have to say that it was certainly one of the best hotels I ever had the chance to stay. Modern spacious rooms with a great view over the city and a lot of facilities, a fantastic breakfast and all that combined with staff which knows what you want before you even have the chance to say it. I hope to be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property, great service, wonderful room, a tiny bit pricey but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Londoner048
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower after nearly three weeks on the road for business. After a series of so-so hotels, the Sofitel was like sinking into a soft cushion of luxury. From the friendly greeting of the doorman to the smiles and warm welcome when I checked in (they made me feel like an old and treasured friend) to the excellent service in the bar and restaurant to exceptionally helpful concierge to the superb location in the heart of the Magnificent Mile to the lovely and spotless rooms, my entire experience was totally five-star. I would definitely return and highly recommend this hotel to any traveler looking for luxury accommodation in downtown Chicago. A bit pricey, but absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “great reservation experience...can't wait to go there”
Reviews.Author: savvyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I found out about this hotel from friends who had stayed there in May and highly recommended it. So I decided to call them as I am celebrating my 25th anniversay in August and wanted something special. Special it is......the reservation person at this hotel has gone above and beyond with thier service...arranged a limo to pick us up from the airport, organized a nice romantic city tour, a nice dinner at the Architects cafÃ© and has given me some great insights into the city........I am looking forward to this experience

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOM AND GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: hopeful29
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in a junior suite. The hotel is well located and the staff was very helpful. Everything combined to make our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jwbn
Reviews.Content: Excellent service-- the staff are all wonderful. Lovely rooms and comfortable beds. Very quiet. Great location. I would definitely stay there again for either business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: LVETOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, impeccable service and a group of people who go out of their way to ensure a fantastic visit by all... Their rooms are exactly as described and their location perfect for a stroll down Michigan avenue. If you are coming to Chicago, I would highly recommend the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience at Sofitel Chicago Water Tower”
Reviews.Author: Ros051
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower over the Memorial Day Weekend and were delighted with every aspect. We had Junior Suite which was stunning, modern, clean and spacious. Lovely huge bathroom. The breakfasts which were all included were so delicious and it was a pleasure to sit each morning in the beautiful restuarant served by the most gracious staff. The highlight however was the exceptional concioerge service who arranged sporting tickets, restaurants, sightseeing, jazz clubs and directions to everything. This was our first time to Chicago and it was made truly memorable due to the guidance and service of the Concierge staff. Thank you to the Sofitel for a wonderful experience which we considered to be the best value we have experienced at any hotel in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Sofitel...We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieF212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for four nights over Memorial Weekend. From check in to check out the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean with a lot of closet and drawer space. The bathrooms at the Sofitel were perfect! Very spacious with a good sized tub. The bed was perfection..we both slept so well! Extremely comfortable mattress and pillows...not mentioned that much when rating a hotel..but extremely important!! We used the concierge service a few times throughout our stay and they were extremely informed on what to see and do in Chicago. She was able to book the restaurants we wished to try during our visit to Chicago. We used the gym facilities a few times and found it very clean and equipped with the latest equipment. Fruit, water and towels were all provided by the door. We had lunch at the restaurant in the hotel and found the food and service great!! The restaurant had an outdoor patio, perfect for taking some sun and people watching. I can't say enough about the location of this hotel! It is is in walking distance from all the best shopping and restaurants. Bloomingdales and Barney's are right around the corner!! I had a wonderful lunch at Fred's in Barney's and then made my way down Oak street were numerous boutiques are located. Overall our stay was really great! Good food, nice room, professional and friendly staff! We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, disappointing view and breakfast, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: MrArno
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a beautiful, modern building, well located close to Michigan ave and a 10 min walk from the lake. Clean, comfortable rooms (excellent bed), with disappointing views though : we paid extra for a higher floor room, ended up on 16th floor (out of 33) with no lake view, not worth the extra money in my opinion. No buffet breakfast unfortunately, good food though, very fresh, but too expensive provided the absence of buffet. Plus we were overcharged or information on accorhotels website not updated : our reservation said breakfast costs $20 pp but we were charged $57 for two. Didn't pay attention at checkout, sent an email 2 days later, still waiting for a reply a week after. Concierge very helpful and friendly, gave us a brilliant recommendation for a restaurant (Province, 161 North Jefferson Street, excellent food).

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Gordoncrowley
Reviews.Content: One story summed up our stay ... On our final day we shared a lift with a janitor. He asked us how our stay was. We told him about out very enjoyable stay. He said "we are very proud of OUR hotel". It demonstrated the staff's dedication to the sofitel Chicago experience. Everyone contributed from the check in staff who got us an early available room to the bar staff who gave us shopping recommendations. Exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lee0072
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago with eleven women who are part of an Investment Club. We stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for 4 nights and could not have been pleased more. Initially, I made the reservations with the group in house person who was wonderful to work with. The rooms were well appointed with marble baths, comfortable beds, good views, good restaurant, centrally located. The staff was just delightful - always friendly and helpful. They all made a big difference in our stay in Chicago. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS ALL AROUND !”
Reviews.Author: 1moreoffthelist
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a absolutely wonderful 5 days in your lovely city. Would also like to mention that all the staff, accommodations, service and cleanliness at your hotel is unsurpassed. An example of this is when we checked in we were provided with a lovely room on the 18th flr (1804). On my last trip to your hotel I had a room on the East side and preferred that view and being my wifeâ€™s first trip to Chicago coupled with our Wedding Anniversaryâ€¦so I thought I would run down to the front desk as see if there was a possibility of switching to the opposite site. The gentleman (his name escapes me) that helped me after I explained my wish, immediately provided me with an alternate room (2817) that offered a view of the lake and apologized that the hotel was not aware of our anniversary. I explained to him that I had not mentioned it as I was originally slated to be there over Easter. My wife and I were delighted with the new room and to top it off, upon arriving back to our room after dinner we were surprised with a lovely bottle of Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. I again would like to thank you and your entire staff for a wonderful and memorable anniversary/weekend in Chicago (we canâ€™t wait to return)!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent four days in the Chicago Sofitel. Found the staff especially attentive. The restaurant is very good. The room was luxurious. A great place to stay for a few days. Parking is expensive in that area. A great place to stay and walk Michigan Avenue- the Magnificent Mile. The hotel is just far enough off the boulevard to be quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit and still just as wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel in downtown chicago, just a few blocks off Michigan avenue and close to everything. I try to stay here once a year on business and it's just as good as before. The rooms are comfortable, clean and in wonderful condition. But my favorite is the crepes for breakfast! Service is still outstanding throughout the hotel. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, I'll come and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Magiscule
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here while visiting Chicago to attend the restaurant show. We normally stay at the Marriott because it's what we know. The restaurant show offers special rates for attendees but by the time we made a reservation the Marriott was sold out. We decided to try the Sofitel instead. Now I'm so grateful for the turn of events. The Sofitel is far superior in every way. It's in a great location! Many good restaurants nearby and lots of shopping. It's in the trendy Gold Coast neighborhood. I highly suggest talking a walk through the streets and view the beautiful landscape and amazing buildings. My only complaint would be that our king sized bed was two twins stuck together. I could feel the break in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel”
Reviews.Author: baysidegirl55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and wished it was longer. From the moment we walked in everything was wonderful. Check in staff were efficient and friendly. Bags were taken to my room instantly and the bellhop even looked a little surprised I tipped him. Any request was met with an immediate solution and in a very friendly manner. Room was spacious, modern, super clean and very comfortable. Great large bathrooms with lovely amenities. The bed was just amazing - soft yet firm - if that makes sense. The best night's sleep I have ever had. Chambermaids efficient and nothing was too much trouble. The added bonus for me was a view of the Hancock centre from my window. The location is great, close to all the good shopping and easy to get cabs and around Chicago. Great intimate cocktail bar too. Only downside was paying for internet access which still seems to be the go with the large international chain hotels. Go over the road to ING have a coffee and get free access. I would go back to Chicago just to stay there again, although I did love Chicago too.

Reviews.Title: “I chose to stay again : Great location, trendy, French , sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: Location is right next to Hancock observatory. Very trendy and sophisticated. Nice fireplace in the bar. Staff is always willing to help and call a cab. Rooms are nice. Not sure why there was so much static in the room and on the sheets. that was the only negative. I asked to switch rooms because the original had the new carperting smell and they did it instantly. No problem. Someone came up to my room to help me move rooms. Loved the French sophistication and style. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “It could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: nycp76
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the shopping , as well as the Pier 39. The Sofitel is very beautiful, I liked the atmosphere of the Lobby, the very high ceilling, the small light on the floor, it 's very fancy. The Front desk was excellent, very professional, grooming was top notch, and tehy were very friendly, and I love the french touch! The room was great we were on the 31st floor, very nice view of the lake, the bed was extremly confortable, they do have the MY BED, this ultra cozy bed with feather and down duvet and top-mattress. We loved it! The restaurant was very nice we had breakfast, the portion were large, a lot's of smoke salmon :) They do have a patio as well, that you can have lunch and dinner. One of my favorite place was the bar, loved the fire place a t the netrance, it is small very intimate, the cocktail were amazing, and the staff very friendly, we went two day in a row, and the staff recognized us, they remembered our drink from the previous day, it was very impressive, I felt very special. Just to finalize my comment, I will definitely go back, and it will be my hotel of choice in Chicago, the french flavour is a plus, great job to the management! Life is Magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Sofitel Chicago & it was really amazing. I received a beautiful upgrade to a Jr. Suite that was super nice.....amazing shower & I loved the Hermes bath products (really subtle masculine scent). Very friendly check-in by Suzanna at the Front Desk...she was very kind & came around from the desk to hand me my key card- great bellmen team-all friendly, always opened doors, got a cab for me very easily! Alex at the Front Desk was also awesome- very nice at check-out! Great room service food! Justin at the Concierge desk rocks! he's so sweet & incredibly knowledgeable on the city! Stunning floral arrangements, amazing bed......everything was top notch! Thanks for an amazing stay! Best Wishes, Patrick Winkler --

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: backpackerlars
Reviews.Content: Sofitel water tower was indeed an excellent choice as it lived up to its high ratings. The central location ensured that you were only a few blocks away from the happening places. The observatory is just a stone-throw away. The staff is courteous, the rooms are well maintained, the food is well presented, tasty and high quality. Got a good discount since I was travelling on business. All in all, definitely recommended to anyone who is on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced not worth it”
Reviews.Author: redlips24065
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing it was rated as 4 star. Very confined small non personable rooms. Staff very friendly. Too many rude guests. Would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: MochiShiro
Reviews.Content: had a very good experience at the sofitel. here 2 nights for business meeting. location is convenient - 2 blocks from the john hancock tower and michigan ave. room is what you would expect from sofitel - no surprises. appreciated the shower w very good water pressure... brian the concierge had great suggestions and was very helpful with assistance. highly recommended, and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, an absolute delight”
Reviews.Author: Breedo
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights and really enjoyed the hotel. Very contemporary design, nice lobby, friendly and helpful staff. The room while not large was a good size, and the best part was the amazing bed! Such a comfortable nights sleep, I did not want to get out of bed! The bathroom was equally good, a nice large shower and separate bath tub. Bose alarm clock with aux cable next to the bed, which is turned on with soothing music put on as part of the turn down service. Nice to come back to the room with some subtle music playing. My only criticisms of the overall excellent hotel would be the valet parking and the towel quality. The valet parking is $50 a night, which is expensive anywhere, but retrieving the cars took so long. One morning I was stood outside waiting for my car for over 15 mins. Not really acceptable when they're charging that much for parking. And the towels in the bathroom, while plentiful, were slightly too starchy and bleached for my liking - a big pet hate.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeetp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for two nights. Our room was small but had a good view of the city. The window could not be opened so it could get stuffy. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was luxurious and big.The staff was friendly and helpful. The housecleaning staff did a great job coming in twice a day to clean. The Sofitel Chicago Water Tower is a comfortable place to stay if a bit minimalist and charmless in decor. The location is excellent for shopping, restaurants and tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AF270769
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower recently. Very nice hotel in excellent location. Rooms were good size, service was fantastic. If I had one small gripe though, it was that they charge for room internet access. Not overly expensive mind you ($10 per day from memory) but we found the majority of hotels we visited on this trip to the US had room wi-fi as complimentary. Didn't deter from the overall stay....we plan to head back to Chicago in the future and this hotel will be top of our list. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Super Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and it is only a one minute stroll to Michigan Avenue which was great. The staff were lovely and helpful, special thanks to the breakfast crew. The rooms are fab and spacious and very comfortable. We got a good rate on their website so the room was a nice surprise as usually the offer rooms anywhere can be hit or miss, but no we had a great room, lovely breakfast and a great time in Chicago. thanks Sofitel Chicago

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: timminn49
Reviews.Content: An elegant, reasonably-priced hotel (with my company's corporate rates, VERY reasonable) in a great part of town, this is my favorite place to stay when I visit Chicago on business. The staff is always very helpful, the hotel's design in the common areas and rooms is upscale and elegant. There is very little to criticize here, except perhaps that the duvets are so warm I have a standing request to replace them with a blanket. The restaurant is typically overpriced (with great service and food - except for the French Toast) but there is a breakfast/lunch place on the other end of the block and there is a small grocery store just around the corner. There is a wide variety of excellent quality restaurants within 5 minutes' walk and Michican Avenue, just 2-3 blocks away is a great venue for high-end shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: wilhornis
Reviews.Content: Need to say more? Good service, including concierge and turndown, large room, separate shower and tub, no noise at all. Ok, I prefer a more modern decor and a breakfast buffet included, but for the special congress price of only 150 incl wifi I paid, I shouldnt complain!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of France in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: Exquisite hotel with French charm in the heart of Chicago. Only steps away from the Mag Mile and the Hancock Observatory. Trendy spacious rooms, bathroom was a stand-out. Service was exceptional, especially our waiter in the restaurant, who gave us complimentary drinks and sides when our meals took a little while to come out (only about 20 minutes in between entree and main, which was not a big issue for us!). Not cheap, but you definitely get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago our kind of stay”
Reviews.Author: seamac Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Mini road trip-drove fr NYC and arrived 8:30AM. They took our car and stored luggage. Had a terrific time and arrived back around 4pm and luggage came up within 5 minutes of us in room. Sofitel always has nice touches such as answering a call by mentioning yr name,slippers and bathrobes, wonderful toiletries,great beds and dark drapes . On premises doors held for you, use of a umbrella when needed . Our deal included valet parking and full breakfast with a suite that when compared to other similiar hotels ended up as if breakfast and parking were free.

Reviews.Title: “The Windy City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: DPand I stayed at this property over the weekend of April 29 - May 1. Great location and close to State Street , Michigan Avenue and lots of high end and every day folks ( Macy's, Filenes, etc.,) shopping. Check out Bistronomic Restaraunt very close to the Sofitel - the food is awesome but make your reservation at least 2 weeks in advance unless you want to eat at 5:15 pm.... The staff are nice and the hotel has a great fragrance in the lobby - don't ask to take it home as it's not for sale, it's made in France and is exclusive to this property - nice touch. Careful if you upgrade to a better suite - we booked a junior suite which was adequate but upgraded one night to a Prestige suite - save your money - it's just a bigger room with no more amenities than the Junior Suite - booked the breakfast and parking "package deal" and considered it a fair price as 24 hr parking is $50 USD per night and breakfast for two ( american breakfast) will run $50 with tip. The basket of pastries alone is worth it! Loved the Hermes bath amenities - nice touch. The hotel has a modern lobby and a lively bar - overall, I would recommend it and plan to return. This is not the Ritz Carlton, so don't expect them to know your name when you walk through the lobby or refer to you as Ladies and Gentleman.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: icephere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 31 floor. It has a smell in the room (due to recent renovation?). the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Water Tower Experience - Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: hildy_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Easter weekend at this relaxing hotel. We had a wonderful experince for the second time and enjoyed meeting up with old friends for a relaxing dinner. The front desk staff was very helpful with recommendations to restaurants and theaters. The "turn down" bed service was over the top with special treats left both nights on our pillows. As we were enjoying "catching up" with our friends, the restaurant manager sent over a complimentary dish of treats. We had an extremely satisfying experience at the Sofitel Water Tower. The views are magical and location is perfect for a weekend in Chicago. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: LizHutton1980
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and perfect for exploring the city. We requested an upper floor room which had fantastic views over the city. We were in the city as the first part of our honeymoon which had been noted to the staff prior to our arrival. I had the booking confirmation document with me but despite thie we were told straight away thet they couldn't find our names and we weren't booked in. This conversation went on for approx 10 mins of searching and phone calls (and a printed booking number in front of them) until eventually we were given a room. No apology offered and no acknowledgement that we were there for a special occasion. I absolutely understand that all these big hotels run on a completely electronic system however, i find poor customer service and flat out rudeness difficult to forgive, especially after a very long flight! I actually filled in comment card at the hotel to the same effect and was e-mailed by a member of staff asking for more details. I replied straight away but have yet to have a reply. At check-out our bill was produced with 10 lots of mini bar drinks on it. Be careful as we hadn't realised if you move any of the cans, even for a few seconds you are automatically charged so don't make the mistake we did and try and fit your left over pizza in there that you just couldn't finish at the restaurant (Deep dish double crust pizza is an absolute must to try in the city!) Overall very pleasant stay, just felt the poor customer service lets it down at the beginning and end.

Reviews.Title: “4 hight Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being A club Platinum certainly has it's rewards We were upgraded to a very nice suite On Easter Sunday, along with every other guest, we requested late checkout, which was granted Historically, we have chosen Four Seasons properties, we now prefer Sofitel if available

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsRickie
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my overnight stay at the hotel. It was beautiful. The decor was beautiul. The bathroom was gorgeous and the bed was so comfortable. I really enjoyed the room. Even the room service was outstanding. I would definitely stay here again. The rooms was expensive, but the company paid for it. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, lovely and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: nowthisdir
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel three times and it is always a delightful experience. The staff makes every guest feel important and welcome. The rooms are lovely and the location, just off the Magnificent Mile, is terrific. Right now, the rooms are very affordable, though they have been expensive in the past. I paid $139 a night. Since the price was so low, I indulged in room service. I highly recommend the assortment of French cheeses and the Mojitos.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WASlovesWAS
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful business trip thanks to the Sofitel. I was happily upgraded to a Suite. The room was spectacular and I was sad that I didn't get to spend more time there. The staff has always been warm and welcoming. I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel, Water Tower”
Reviews.Author: 73Buckeye Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After several tears traveling to Chicago for both business and pleasure, we stayed at the Sofitel, Water Tower for the first time in many years. Besides it's very convenient location to Michigan Avenue, the staff was warm and friendly, the rooms very clean and comfortable. A somewhat noisy air conditioning/heating unit in our room, but not severe enough to complain. Generally one of the pricier hotels in the area, but an on line "special" , paid in full at the time of booking, enticed us back to the hotel. No regrets. Will look for additional "offers" to return at a future date . Nice toiletries in the room and would recommend if the price were right anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by by great stay”
Reviews.Author: mtoguchi12
Reviews.Content: Just finished a four day, three night swing through Chicago, and the Sofitel at Water Tower Place exceeded my expectations in almost every way. And I'm not naturally predisposed to like things marketed as having "a French Touch". We booked our rooms through Hotwire and were very please with the rate for three nights in the heart of downtown. You've got walking distance access to all of the shopping, eating and drinking places you'd ever want. I arrived almost three hours early on our check-in day, and was just hoping to stash my stuff at the hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, plush, dark but inviting. When I got to the front desk, I was informed that the rooms were actually ready, which was a huge bonus. The room decor isn't really my style - definitely European influenced - but objectively speaking it's very nice. The TV is a new HD flatscreen, the bed was soft, clean and comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Bathroom had a separate shower and tub, and pretty soft towels considering what you normally get. Not really sure what else I could ask for. Though oddly laid out, the gym has all of the machines and weights you'd want, and they had fresh fruit there all three days. Really nice touch. Wish it was 24 hour. I found the service a bit perplexing; for the most part they were extremely friendly and helpful. A woman happily offered me an extra complimentary water when I asked, and the doormen recognized and greeted us with a smile every day. The only thing I found odd was the daily service. In the process of fixing up the room, they often re-arranged, folded or straightened my stuff. Felt sort of like my Mom came in and was scolding me for leaving a shirt out or not organizing my toiletries. Still not quite sure how I feel about it, but it sort of made me laugh. The bar & restaurant seemed fine, though I was looking for more Italian beef sandwiches, deep dish pizza and cheap beer than sweetbreads and the high class fare served here. Anyway, I would definitely recommend this property for anyone here on business or pleasure. They made me a believer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a few very minor letdowns”
Reviews.Author: zuperzigy
Reviews.Content: For me it was the first time in Chicago - a blend of business and sightseeing - this hotel was a blessing. Recommeded by a friend I can only strongly recommend it. It was within a 15 Minute Cab Ride from my business appointements the shoping and sightseeing within walking distance - marvellous. Rooms are for US Standards smallish but the views from the room were breathtaking. The Concierge and everybody else very helpful and friendly. Only Letdowns my room servive never materialised , no probs I went out instead and the gym is very very small and not well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven, I'm in Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: GoddessDivine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a busy (and noisy) area of the city, but as soon as you step instead a hush descends over the lobby area. The decor and the service at check-in are soothing and efficient; the rooms are ultra-deluxe with any amenity you could wish for: robe, slippers, mini-bar, L'Occitane toiletries, the list goes on and on. I was here three nights and was so delighted at being able to get a good night's sleep I wanted to stay three nights more. Room service was exquisite - the food was outstanding (mais oui, it's French so how could it be any less?) During my entire stay I felt like staff made sure they were helpful but not intrusive, and it was so lovely to see such exquisite manners. This was truly a fantastic experience and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel for a high class of guest”
Reviews.Author: Mlabar
Reviews.Content: For the high end business traveler, this is a fabulous place. As a casual traveler, I felt out of place. The room was gorgeous, the service was fabulous, but I wouldn't call anyone there "friendly." We enjoyed the beautiful furnishings and the classy vibe of LeBar (the his and hers cocktail list is phenomenal). But this isn't the place for the young trendsetter crowd. Everything they do, they do well. Our room was clean and well-stocked daily with linens and toiletries (I particularly enjoyed the L-Occitane toiletries), and room service breakfast was wonderful (we ordered one meal and had plenty for both of us).

Reviews.Title: “Chicago on the way”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent except we always only select Hotels with free Internet access, so it was actually a misunderstanding. The confirmation said "High Speed Internet" was included, but it appeared that it referred to 3 PC's on second floor (which were occupied when we checked) or on 3rd, but we need to use our own. So we had breakfast and did our (free) internet business all 3 mornings of the stay on Starbucks next door (there were 4 Starbucks within a blocks distance, maybe that's why?). Next time we'll find and Accor Hotel with Internet included, or a Starwood, or Marriott, if possible?

Reviews.Title: “Dark Elegance”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: Why This Hotel? I selected the Sofitel in downtown Chicago after comparing prices amongst all of the upscale hotels. The Elysian was very expensive, as well as the Trump. I probably would have picked the Palomar, based on positive past experience with that property in Philadelphia and #3 ranking, but they were completely booked. I wanted a hotel that was (1) Upscale (2) Ranked high on Trip Advisor and (3) Close to the Water Tower. The Sofitel is a 4 Â½ star hotel, and ranked 8 on trip advisor, with an acceptable / competitve price point. It was a 5-8 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile, close to the Water Tower and John Handcock building, making it the winner. Booking: I personally have had good experience booking on hotels.com, and use that site. However, in this case, after I had booked, I realized that you get a better deal on this property booking directly on the hotel website, rather than a 3rd party. I did read from another reviewer this same experience, and that reviewer regretted not booking directly from Sofitel, because you do get a better deal. Bottom line? If you are going to book this hotel, book on Sofitel.com. Check In: When we arrived, we were greeted with a prompt bellman, friendly and professional. Our check-in was seamless, zero wait and accurate information on their records. The female that handled our check in was very kind. I asked whether she had any rooms with double beds, and she said that they did, and for the exact same room, and features, it would be $40 more per night X 3 nights. It seemed unfair to charge more money for the same room, and square footage for double beds, so we declined. Parking: Parking is at cost, which we used. I did ask if there was a way to get parking waived with a coupon, or an online deal to join their newsletter, but she said that there was no way. Although disappointing, it is understandable, and we proceeded to our room. Hotel Vibe: This hotel has a dark and sexy feel to it. The lobby is dimly lit, and has a sensual feel. There are candles burning throughout the property, with tall, glass containers and vases. The hotel is trendy, modern, sophisticated, and has sort of a â€œdark and mysteriousâ€� kind of a feel about it. Room: The rooms here are a lot nicer than the pictures, which did the property no justice. Everything is chrome, and all fixtures are buffed to a high polish shine. It has all clean lines of modern dÃ©cor, a white bathroom, and a bed to die for. It is a featherbed that is literally one of the nicest beds I have ever slept in; it was incredible. You do have a nice flat screen TV, although I felt like the channels took a long time to load. There is plenty of space for all of your things, and closet space. It has 2 bathrobes, a hairdryer, 2 pairs of slippers, and huge makeup mirror. We were pleased. I will say, I was also glad that I didnâ€™t pay more for a better view. Once we saw the view from the room, we were happy we didnâ€™t upgrade. Extras: As described by a different reviewer, I also liked the Evian water delivered to the room at night. They do nightly turndown service, like most hotels of this star rating. What I LOVED and appreciated were the umbrellas provided at this hotel. It did rain on the Friday night that we were here and it was amazing to have 2 free umbrellas to use on our night out. My hair didnâ€™t get wrecked, so thank you! Drawbacks: The rooms, although lovely, are not spacious. The hotel is not super warm and inviting, but rather, chic, sleek, upscale and sophisticatedâ€¦bordering on cold? I am not sure. It was my style, personally, but I can see how this wouldnâ€™t be for everyone. Also, donâ€™t touch anything in the fridge because it is sensor monitored. If something moves, you will be charged. It did appear on my bill from just touching an item, but checkout went smoothly and they happily took it off the bill without issue. Value: I think the value is great, for a nice Chicago hotel. It is less expensive than its competitors and does deliver. I wouldnâ€™t say you are going to find a ton of extras and perks here, nor special touches that you would find at the Palomar property, but it does the job, and you can bet on a good experience. Points of Interest: They have the nicest, little library that is very chic and cool. If I had been traveling alone, I probably would have gone down and enjoyed it. This hotel is perfect for: Young couples, romance, trendsetters, jetsetters, business, and solos. This hotel is not great for: Families, those looking for giant rooms / kitchens / amenities and extras.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel with luxury service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night at Sofitel and was impressed with the service from beginning to end. Valet and bell hop very friendly and talkative. Beautiful lobby and ultra modern design. The room was about average size but the excellent bed and top notch bathroom made up for it (Separate soaking tub and good size glass shower). Ordered room service and the concierge stated it would be a half hour to forty-five minutes yet the food arrived in about 15 min. Every staff member we spoke to knew my name and were considerate and polite. The hotel was packed when we arrived and left yet we never heard a single noise from the hallway or another room so if you are looking for a romantic stay or quiet relaxation this is a great option. You definitely get what you pay for at Sofitel. Overall a great luxury hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MGreulich
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Chicago is a great hotel .... clean, upscale, etc. We stayed just one night in February, and it is in a perfect location for shopping on both Rush St. and Michigan Ave. The room is a nice size with good views, a large bathroom and comfy bed. There is nothing to complain about at this hotel. And, we asked for a late check out, and they allowed us to stay two extra hours with no extra fees. We also requested an early check in, and it was honored with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerrell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and reasonably priced. We stayed in junior suite and really enjoyed our stay. The location is ideal, the concierge wonderful and the service great. The only small thing as mentioned in some other reviews is a strong smell in the lobby and hallways of the hotel. Not exactly sure what it is but it is strong. It would be nice if they did something to tone that down,as I can see why it would annoy some people. I am a big fan of the Sofitel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that met expectations”
Reviews.Author: love-2-travel_2820
Reviews.Content: Nice stay with my 6 year old daughter in February 2011. Everybody in Chicago is a lot kinder and more helpful then New York â€“ this also shows at the Sofitel. I booked a Junior Suite and we stayed in room 708. Nice big, very clean room. Leather lookalike plastic sofa was rather sad and needs replacement, carpet very faded by the sun. Breakfast room-service was rather sad (sweet and fast service) but the fresh fruit was missing on both plates, and only two small slices of toast â€“ all in all it was boring and not worth the money (I did no complain or mention the missing fruit â€“ I am sure they would have made up for it â€“ but by then it would be too late) went out for breakfast the other days â€œTempo cafÃ©â€� next door was super for breakfast! After asking several times and different people, they granted me a 2 pm â€œlateâ€� check-out, by paying 50 % of the daily rate I could keep the room till 5 pm (we checked out 1:30) Excellent location and kind, polite and helpful staff in general. Would like to stay here again. NB! VERY annoying â€œknockingâ€� sound from the bathroom pipes when using the warm water (so do not wash your hands if you visit the toilet during the night) as itâ€™s not easy falling asleep again until it stops knocking 20 minutes later! hhmmmmâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katedahl
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I'd stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower, and I wasn't disappointed. With it being winter (not the high travel season for Chicago), I get a great deal for a four-night stay. My room was on the 30th floor, looking east towards the Hancock Tower and Lake Michigan. All the staff members are kind and helpful. I love the small bottles of Evian given out during turn-down service (especially because a bottle of water for the minibar is $6). Room service is prompt and delicious. The bed is heavenly -- I think I slept better during my stay than I had in months. My room was quiet (only occasionally hearing the doors to other rooms closing). The only things that would make the stay even better would be free in-room wi-fi and a microwave (which many cheaper hotels seem to provide these days). I will definitely stay here again when I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NZhivago Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay in windy Chicago. Location is very convinient to everything, 2 min to nearest subway station Chicago-Red. Hotel was not overcrowded, due to low season, but service was on very professional level. We have got an upgrade to Junior Suite - room was not very spacy, but very comfy and nicely decorated, with great view and amazing bed. French touch in every detail. Merci Sofitel! PS: Tip: If you are looking for a good American breakfast - better to visit Tempo Cafe (next to hotel) with their great selection of scrabbled eggs and sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Dry and Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hosum
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to take a 3 night stay in Chicago for fun. Looking through reviews, we figured that the Sofitel would be a nice place to relax. It turned out to be very disappointing. Rooms: Our room was unbearably dry! I could not breathe properly during the entire stay. Granted, it was winter... but I had no problems breathing the outdoor Chicago air. I would wake up in the middle of the night because the air in the room was too dry. I ended up placing wet tissues under my nose just to help me breathe. I am very picky about cleanliness, so this may be acceptable to some people. When we first arrived, the beds had what looked like other people's hair (perhaps pubic), maybe 5-6 strands scattered around that I could find. At first, I questioned whether or not the sheets were cleaned, but I realized that the sheets and bedding had a lot of static--- so I'm guessing that they were washed, but some hairs were never able to come off in the wash. Another issue was that on two different mornings, starting around 9AM, we would hear small hammering sounds from nearby. It sounded like it came from an adjacent room next to us (maybe some sort of construction or renovation?). Definitely not what I want to be hearing when I want to sleep in and relax! Location: Probably the only thing I liked about the hotel. It was in a good location -right next to Michigan Avenue, and about a 15 minute walk to Navy Pier- one afternoon we had a pleasant walk from Navy Pier back to the hotel. Service: When I needed to resolve an issue over the phone about my reservation, I was told to leave a voice message for the reservations manager. I'm always hesitant about leaving voice mails, but I was reassured that she was "good at checking her voice mails", but after leaving a detailed message, I never received a callback. Though, front desk was friendly and polite. Overall, staying in this hotel pretty much ruined our planned-to-be relaxing Chicago visit. The one thing this hotel was successful at was denting my wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Solid luxury with a great price”
Reviews.Author: ptgt20
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled here to celebrate our engagement in January 2011. The hotel is in a perfect location, right by most of the big Chicago destinations and restaurants. The hotel is very sleek and cool, with very nice bathrooms. Brian, the concierge, was amazing in consistently coming through with great recommendations. Every night the hotel does a turndown service, which is very nice as well. The highlight of the hotel for us was the bed, which had to be the most comfortable bed my fiance and I have ever slept in, at least in recent memory. There were only a few slight negatives but they were easily overlooked: the water from our sink wasn't clear, and our television's sync was off by a frame. Before you book be sure to look around online for better prices, I was able to score a Junior Suite at a simply awesome price. This hotel is very nice, beautiful, and highly recommended. Also recommended: the Signature Lounge at the top of the Hancock Building, the Drawing Room for drinks, the Coq D'Or in the Drake hotel, and Topolbampo for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fancy hotel, luxury rooms for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: Unique architecture from the outside. My room was a deluxe which had a view of the Hancock tower (the best view of Chicago by the way is from the bar at the top of this building). The Hotel is in the heart of the action and next to designer shops and restaurants. The rooms are large,clean, fancy and modern. Bathroom comes with all the extras (slippers, TV) great bed and desk. Staff is very good and even says "bonjour " in French to keep the Sofitel theme although no one really speaks french. Bottom line, this hotel has a very expensive feel to it at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, not the quality I expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_SF
Reviews.Content: I had one Sofitel stay prior to the Chicago Water Tower facility (Bangkok) and it was excellent. So, my expectations were high. Wish I could have something nicer to write... First off, it was soo expensive. We wanted centrally located so were willing to pay for the convenience. The Sofitel Water Tower location can't be beat, it was perfect, within walking distance of so much stuff. When we checked in, they only had a smoking room left for that night (even though we had reservations) and would move us to another room the next day. The smoking room was BAD, chipped furniture, stained area rugs, pieces of gum on the coffee table, all for a low price of $350! We were compensated by 3 drink tickets for the bar. The next day, they moved our stuff to the room we actually reserved. Luckily it was cleaner. The thing that ticked me off most was that we had a junior suite, which is basically a larger room with a king size bed and sofa bed. Our party was for three (myself, husband and teenage son), so you would think the hotel staff would know one of us would be sleeping on the sofa bed? Wrong. Not only did they not make up the sofa bed or ask, there were no sheets/blankets/pillows for it either. So I had to call room service, and they brought up one flat sheet, a small thin blanket and pillow. I said I would like two sheets, and maybe another blanket...all in all, a pain in the butt.. I don't recommend this hotel at all, unless you get a deal for like $150 or something. and no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not as nice as the Sofitel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Onthegofam4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel earlier this month and was upgraded to a suite. The room was huge with lots of windows, two televisions, etc. The room was very clean with the exception of the carpet, which contained a number of stains. The bathroom was a good size and the lotions and soaps were great. The room was comfortable, although with a high temp of 17 degrees in Chicago that day, the room never really seemed to get warm. The location of the hotel is great and when it's warm enough there are several great restaurants within walking distance. The biggest issue I encountered was with room service. I ordered dinner and was told it would be up within 30 minutes. The food arrived after 45 minutes, but it wasn't my food. The server was very apologetic and promised to be right back with my order. After 30 more minutes, my food still hadn't arrived. When I called down I was told my food was on the way and the dinner would be "taken care of." My food finally arrived 15 minutes later. When I checked out the next morning, the food was still on my bill and the front desk clerk didn't seem to know what to do. She asked me to whom I had spoken and the department of the person with whom I spoke. After about ten minutes, she managed to figure out the problem and correct my bill. Overall this is a very nice hotel, but not as nice as the Sofitel in New York City. The room was very nice and the location of the hotel is very good, but the service could be improved a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of the Gold Coast.”
Reviews.Author: Spartan55
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Chicago over the Thanksgiving holiday and stayed in a prestige suite. I received the room for a very reasonable $200 per night, which in this location of the city is a great deal. Unlike some of the other luxury hotels in the area, the Sofitel rooms are very large and comfortable. The finish of the rooms are very luxurious, from the marble bathrooms to the soft bed. The bath products are Hermes and are fantastic. The room was very clean and offered great views with the floor to ceiling windows. There was both a bedroom area and a living area connected by a long corridor with one wall being solid windows. The decor is very modern and sleek. It reminds me of a European style hotel in the middle of Chicago. The hotel staff was very attentive to all of our requests, and called us to ask if we wanted a turn down service since the maid arrived while we were getting ready to go to dinner. The front desk offered great suggestions for restaurants in the surrounding area. I would recommend going to Feast for breakfast. It is right down the block from the hotel and offers fantastic eggs benedict. There is much to do and see in the area. Michigan Avenue is but 2 blocks away. There are several restaurants within a walking radius, including, Ditka's, Feast, Giordano's, Rosebud on Rush, etc. This hotel is a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent hotel in a great location.. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge desk was excellent in assisting with information on the city and obtaining reservations.The room was very comfortable and clean. If I had to pick one minor thing to complain about we found the quality of the toilet paper not very good for a hotel of this standard. It may have something to do with the hotel or city plumbing.. Apart from that a great Chicago experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteZinfandel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a staying at this hotel for a long weekend. We have visited chicago 3 times now and this hotel is by far in the best location being so close to shopping on michigan avenue. We also found the service at the hotel very good with friendly and polite staff who opened the door and greeted us everytime we entered or left the hotel. I also enjoyed a few well made cocktails in Le Bar especially the Peppermint Snowflake! Overall I would definately reccommend this hotel because of the location, service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mimilarue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located steps away from the best shopping Chicago has to offer. Our room on the 16th floor was super clean, comfortable and very quiet. I do not know how anyone could hear the L train 2 blocks away and underground as one reviewer has suggested. I found the front desk people, the doormen and room service all to be very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the unpleasant potpourri smell in the lobby and the bar. I couldn't stand being in the bar for more than one drink, it was so overpowering.

Reviews.Title: “Very Underwhelmed and Exhausted”
Reviews.Author: smoosh619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Sofitel while in Chicago for a romantic winter getaway. We wanted to be close to the action since it would be cold outside, the location turned out to be just OK, not as close as I thought. Walking into the lobby I was overwhelmed by scent. It was obnoxious and neither of us ever got used to it. I have asthma and couldn't get out of there fast enough. The reception staff and doormen were extremely standoffish, we didn't even get a glance when we walked in and the receptionist didn't say hello, she simply said "Name?" We had been up early that morning and the flight wore us out so the first thing we wanted to do was take a quick nap. We had booked at Deluxe High Floor room because we wanted to avoid street noise.
