We had a room on the 18th floor but it may as well have been the first because it sounded like we were right on the street. We even heard the subway going by. I went to the desk to ask if they had a fan and she was defensive right away and asked what I would need that for. I told her the noise from the street was louder than we expected but hopefully a fan would take care of that. She said she didn't know if they had a fan but if they did it would be sent up. Fine, awhile later the fan showed up. Didn't help, but at least we tried. Not only was the noise a problem but the bed was atrocious. It was beyond horrible. There was a feather topper on it apparently to try to conceal the lumpy, awfulness of the actual mattress. My husband had never had a back problem but woke up with one the next morning. I didn't sleep more than a couple hours our entire stay. The second night after they did the turn down service there was a brochure for purchasing the SoBed....we got quite a laugh out of that. The only friendly face we encountered during our stay was the bellman hailing us a taxi to the airport. The redeeming quality for the hotel was the bathroom - it was amazing. I believe there are good views in the hotel, we did not receive one but we went to the 34th floor and you could see the lake - beautiful. Overall the hotel was pretty & clean but I wouldn't receommend it because of the bed and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel should be #1 rated in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Coffee4Kate
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience!! My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel on our first leg of a 3-week US holiday. We checked in on my birthday after a long 20hour journey from Australia. My husband had informed the hotel at the time of booking that it was my birthday and I was greeted with a "happy birthday" at check in and discovered a fabulous dessert and personal message when we arrived in our room. The room had generous proportions, was beautifully presented and immaculate. The location was less than 2 (small) blocks from The Magnificent Mile, making it convenient to shopping & restaurants AND quiet. This Sofitel had everything we were looking for on our holiday - great personalised service, quiet rooms presented at a high standard and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Usually best high end value in town.”
Reviews.Author: amateurdevoyage Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not quite as nice as Sofitel Philly (smaller rooms) but still very very nice. Restaurant and Bar much better! Great beds (but ask for an extra sheet - otherwise you are caught between roasting under the comforter or freezing without it). Great marble bathrooms with separate tub and shower. Everything suffused with French elegance and taste. And very accommodating to requests, like all Sofitels. That's why we have gradually transferred our loyalty from Westin and Starwood. If only they had more hotels in US! Rates vary with demand but occasionally great bargains. I always compare prices with the downtown Westins, but this is worth a premium for quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location. Clean, no in room coffee or tea facility but complimentary coffee and croissants in the morning at the restaurant. Fruit and water fountain dispensing UV treated water in the gym are pluses. Nice comfy bed and good toiletry. Friendly and honest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed frequently at this hotel when in Chicago and absolutely love it. The staff and rooms are always more than I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect at the Sofitel and it is in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Randiesel
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at this Hotel. It is extremely clean, great service and beautiful rooms. The Hotel is right in the middle of all the great restaurants and shopping in Chicago. Do not hesitate to book at this Hotel, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return After 25 plus Visits”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Chicago Water Tower is our favorite Chicago hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are immaculate, beds are extremely comfortable, and service is attentive. Restaurant food is excellent, especially breakfast with fresh French pastries. Lobby creative flower arrangements are sufficient reason to visit the Sofitel. The only slight negative is that it's time for refurbishment and word is that's happening early next year.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations for this family with young children”
Reviews.Author: cityscaped1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Sofitel Water Tower in Chicago. This was a fantastic hotel, very central to the Mag Mile. Very close to Macy's, H&M, Zara and a host of other shops on Nth Michigan Ave. We found the staff to be wonderful, especially the doormen who were all delightful. Having three young children, we spent most evenings in the hotel - room service was excellent, quick and the food quality was particularly good. Good Kids menu too. Jenny (or similar name?) in Room Service was very accomodating. I found the housekeeping staff excellent and room amenities were very good. Excellent storage in our corner suite. We had to pay $9.95 for daily internet (24 hours) but I think there was a weekly package at $40 which would have worked out cheaper. We enjoyed the Haute Cuisine package very much and would def. stay at the Sofitel again. My husband and I both travel for business regularly and agree on our experiences at the hotel - the staff did whatever they could to assist us in making our trip memorable. Thank you to all at the Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem - great value, location, and as nice as any 5 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MOTraveler010
Reviews.Content: What a great find! My wife and I stayed for two nights after finding a great rate on their website. Between the two of us, we've stayed at just about every 4-5 start hotel in this area with the exception of the Park Hyatt and Peninsula, and this one stands out! First off, you can't beat the location - two blocks off Michigan, in the heart of some great shoppting along Rush street and Oak street. The best part - you are steps away from all the action but don't have to deal with noisy Michigan Avenue! We were AMAZED at how quiet the room was throughout the night! The service is outstanding - certainly better than we expected - on par with a Four Seasons. Everyone is attentive, pleasant, and helpful. What a cool design! Modern, but still warm and inviting. They have some sort of fragrance piped into the lobby and it is intoxicating! We would stand there and take deep breaths - it's great! The room was perfect for our needs, good size, upscale furniture, and a dynamite all marble bathroom with seperate tub and shower. It would have been nice to have 2 sinks, but not totally needed. All in all, we make several trips to Chicago each year, and this will be our top choice from here on in! Great hotel, great value - save the $$ you would spend on the Four Seasons or Ritz and go to a nice dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osnab
Reviews.Content: I so enjoy staying at Sofitel hotels ~ and this one was no exception. The location is great! It's about a 2 minute walk to the Water Tower Place Mall. It's very close to the 800 block of N. Michigan, which is a very active area. The bed was great! One night I didn't want to be disturbed, so I left my DND sign up, and later, I noticed my message light on my phone. I called to find out it was housekeeping, wanting to know if I wanted turndown service. It rained one day and they had umbrellas out for everyone. The only weird thing about this hotel is no gift shop. I needed some cold medicine and procrastinated getting it while I was out, thinking I could get some later.....only to find out no gift shop. I had to walk a couple of blocks to the nearest Walgreens. Of course, the concierge offered to get it for me - just typical of the service here. Food in the hotel (I had only breakfast) was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lttraveler32
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Chicago Water Tower is a beautiful hotel and all of the staff are extremely helpful, professional and kind. Our room had a beautiful view of the city, and the beds were very comfortable. The only downside is that a taxi from/to the airport will run you close to $40. Also, you need to give yourself at least 1 hr to get to the airport due to the traffic. Aside from this - a lovely place to stay. I look forward to coming here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous modern luxury, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jillboo
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay of 2 nights for a business conference. Extremely comfortable beds, very quite room, and L'occitane products. Quality of food excellent with healthful options. Location is perfect for shopping and dining. Beautiful and aromatic floral arrangements. Will definitely return for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place! Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: shellejustine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sofitel last Thanksgiving and it was great. Good accommodations, great location and a comfy bed! I really enjoyed my time there and look forward to going back. The staff was very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sufusimz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely brilliant. Only stayed here one night, but everything was spot on. They had a courtyard outside of the hotel so you could relax in the cool September air and soak in the "hustle and bustle" of Chicago. It was great!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a nice and upscale place to stay. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JessiDoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting in December for a friends wedding. We figured we'd spend a few extra days in Chicago since my husband was deploying in January. I contacted the hotel to ask about a military rate and they gave us an AMAZING deal. Let me just say this, we contacted several hotels in Chicago and no one else came close. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded and that our room was on the top floor, which was a nice surprise. Once settled in there was a knock at the door. The Hotel Manager and Staff sent up a tray of chocolates and drinks with a note thanking my husband for his service and wishing him a safe deployment. Aside of the personal treatment, the room was clean and comfortable, and they really do have the best beds in the world. This hotel went above and beyond what was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and French base in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BuonCuore01
Reviews.Content: Modern French hotel distinguishes itself from all the other chain-hotels in Chicago. Luxury rooms and no need to get outside for diner. French cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: deirdrecm76
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on location and its high ratings from other travellers and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is perfectly situated in the Rush Street area and close to the Magnificent Mile - the room was comfortable and clean and the bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The bathroom was large with an awesome shower. Hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - all in all a fabulous experience - and as someone who travels a lot for work and pleasure I could find nothing to fault at all. I will stay there again next time I am in Chicago. Would prefer free internet and cheaper parking, but these were minor downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 57businesstraveler
Reviews.Content: I visit this hotel several time each year, and every time I am satisfied with the immaculate service and cleanliness of this hotel. Granted, some staff may come across as dismissive, yet one thing that this hotel guarantees is efficient service. The operators are courteous, helpful and efficient. The best are the housekeeping people- I have never seen such professional, courteous, and expedient housekeeping in all of the hotels I frequent. (I wish they had such service at every hotel.) The location is near the John Hancock Tower, the 700 Shops, and the Water Tower Shopping Mall-- decent shopping places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a City Oasis”
Reviews.Author: hfla
Reviews.Content: Everything was as I expected - the room was very clean, the bathroom was large, and everything was very comfortable. The location is ideal, right in the Gold Coast. I had a room right by the elevator and was concerned about noise, but it was not a problem at all with the room's fan on. I also did not hear any city/street noise. I had a little problem with room service only sending me half of my order so that is the only area in which they might need a little improvement. Although the person who delivered my order was nice and offered to have the error fixed, that's not something you want to deal with when it's late and you're tired. So, that is why my rating is not 5/5 on the service. Other than that, the stay was very nice and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Old World servic, New Age Amenities”
Reviews.Author: GaRE75
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for a business conference. The service was impressive, from check-in through check-out. When I arrived I was told that the conference materials I had shipped were there and would be delivered to my room. They nearly beat me to my room. The room was immaculate, light and inviting. I turned up the Bose radio as soon as I discovered it in the corner. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom was sparkling and spacious. The Sofitel Chicago Water Tower is close to everything- shopping along the Magnificent Mile, Loyola, Northwestern, many outstanding restaurants and more. The staff was very friendly and accomodating and the food that was served during our conference was excellent. I highly recommend a stay here- for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel to hold a business workshop”
Reviews.Author: jcskyla
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Chicago was a fantastic venue for our group of 30. The Hotel was responsive, and friendly negotiating our conference space, menu's and rooms. They took the time to make sure our needs were attended to through out the process, during our stay and have followed up after the stay, very professional. The location is excellent. The concierge managed to make dining reservations for a number of our people, multiple groups with little notice.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel. Excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: Rays317
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary hotel. Excellent location in Chicago. Staff is attentive, responsive and efficient. All our needs were met and we felt well taken care of. Restaurant was excellent and we enjoyed having wonderful breakfast before we left. The hotel is comfortable and beautifully maintained. We have stayed several times and are always pleaded with the experience

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but extras expensive”
Reviews.Author: Merv1955
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location just off the Magnificent Mile with lots of shopping & dining options within a few blocks. Staff were really helpful, especially the Concierge who we tasked with "What would you do in Chicago if you only had a day ?. He came up with some excellent suggestions which fortunately matched the weather, which was great. Definitely stay again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: widows_weeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The hotel is another good example of the Sofitel chain with tasteful contemporary decor and great service for the most part being provided by friendly staff. There are some nice little extra touches too, but given the rates, this is to be expected. The location is second to none being on the north end of Michigan Avenue. We do not have any real criticism of our stay at Sofitel Chicago Water Tower other than to advise travelers to check their bill closely before settlement. Also, our booking was made on-line but staff at reception did not seem familiar with the process which resulted in a double booking and some confusion which was eventually sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jfkdeuce
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower a number of times, always found the rooms, staff, food, lounge, and general ambiance to be outstanding. My number one choice when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: d75angel
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is absolutely beautiful. Fantastic hotel in the perfect location for visiting Chicago. Great restaurants nearby and subway is around the corner. Beds are sooo comfortable and bathrooms are the nicest I've seen anywhere. Loved one of the signature drinks at Le Bar, called Backyard Blackberry Margarita. Didn't eat at hotel restaurant, Cafe De Architects, but the menu looked great. Loved Chicago and Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel - Great Place in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DennyC0001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel on September 3rd to celebrate birthdays. Will definitely consider for future return trip. Decore is modern with a French flair. Front desk staff were very pleasant and respectful. Bar and wait staff were quick and listened attentively to our order. Housekeeping staff greeted us as we passed in the hall. The room was great with a good view of the Chicago area. It's in a great location and within walking distance to everything: For the guys: 1. Mike Ditka's restaurant down the block was excellent with reasonably priced American cuisine. 2. Goldcoast Bentley and Lamborghini 1-2 blocks away. For the gals: 1. A couple of blocks from the Magnificent Mile and all of the shopping. 2. Hershey's store and Giradelli's within 1-2 blocks. For everyone: Grocery store on State St west of Sofitel Open top bus Sightseeing at McCormick Plaza - John Hancock Center (2 blocks east of Sofitel on Chestnut). Walgreens 2-3 blocks away for incidentals and souveniers. Breakfast options: Starbucks 1 block east on Chestnut or restauraunt 1/2 block west on Chestnut. Lunch options: Potbelly Sandwiches in Bloomingdales (reasonably priced sandwiches and chips), Pizarro's Pizza to the west on State St, other Pizza places 2 blocks south on Wabash. Dinner options: 1. Signature Room restauraunt on top of John Hancock Tower provides breathtaking views. Wait staff are knowledgable about menu and provide great suggestions. 2. French restaurant in Sofitel Parking was next door. Be aware that you exist the parking garage on State St, and need to take a left on State, and left on Chestnut to get to the Sofitel Hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chig312
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for my wife's birthday and for our anniversary. Staff were very pleasant, the room (a deluxe suite) was BEAUTIFUL. It's in a great location, just a couple blocks from Mag Mile and a bunch of restaurants, bars, etc. You can't go wrong with the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: hmr220
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff. Excellent location. Clean. Comfortable bed. A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful over experience at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: rodeo2244
Reviews.Content: I had a one day meeting in Chicago on a Friday, and flew in Thursday, then stayed through the weekend. I had purchased a 3 night package which included a bottle of champagne, full breakfast for two each morning, and a 3 course dinner one night. The package also included a junior suite, which was a great room with lots of space, full living room area, big bathroom, and on the corner of the building with lots of light and views. The staff was great, and very responsive. Location is perfect if you like to walk to Michigan Ave, nearby restaurants, and great shopping. I have stayed here before, but this trip was a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: freyaNsw
Reviews.Content: The sofitel Chicago is pretty good in all aspects. Good location : Near magnificent mile and some nice restaurants. the concierge recommended Le colonial which was a great Vietnamese place. The rooms: We had two junior suites which had a nice view and they were nice and spacious. Overall this hotel is great for sightseeing and exploring chicago

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Chicago and as Sofitel/Accor Favourite guest members we chose to stay at this property. We booked a Luxury room with a king bed on an upper floor and were upgraded to a Junior Suite which was wonderful. The hotel is very impressive from the outside and the staff the the front counter could not have been more helpful, Marie thank you and also Jackie the Concierge. Our room was not ready but they stored our luggage as we went to explore the city armed with maps and information provided by Jackie. Upon our return to the hotel we were delighted with our Junior Suite, the views from the room were unbelievable and there was so much space. The desk area was a two sided one so great for both of us to work at. Large comfortable bed and the standard Sofitel linens, doonas and bathroom products. Good size bathroom with separate shower and bath. Had room service one night and it was very good. Turndown service provided complimentary water each night and there was also free internet. Only issues we had was with the bar staff, after our wonderful experience with the restaurant staff and bar staff at the Sofitel in Washington DC we were disappointed with the service in the bar. Very slow and this was put down not to the waitress but the barman who was supposed to be making the drinks, he seemed to be more concerned with chatting to the single ladies at the bar than attending to his duties, also he was quiet noisy. The bar area was a little dark for drinks early in the evening, but after such poor service here we decided not to eat in the restaurant and instead went over the road to the seafood restaurant which was exceptionally good, McCormack and Something (I think it was called). Also tried the little diner/cafe down the road from the hotel, turn right as you go outside the hotel door, for breakfast as another trip adviser writer had suggested, lovely little place and great food but HUGE portions so you may only want to order a shared portion. Would I say here again - not sure, great location though

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, brilliant room, good location”
Reviews.Author: AntonyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite for 4 nights and the room was great. So much space, BOSE sound system (although we couldn't get it to work!), comfortable lounge area and amazing bed. Their SoBed concept is really good - the best hotel bed we've stayed in for a very long time. Hotel in good location, 5 mins from Lake Michigan and Mag. Mile shopping. Staff friendly. Clearly a main conference hotel as seemed to be mainly full of conference guests rather than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful mother-daughter trip at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: sunandfog
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I took advantage of a package that allows you to book three nights, get a fourth night free, plus a picnic packed by the hotel on the day of your choice. The location of this hotel is outstanding. Just steps away from the hustle and bustle of Mag Mile, yet those few blocks make all the difference in terms of a peaceful retreat at the end of the day. Also, every restaurant and shop you could imagine was in the neighborhood. We had excellent meals at Feast (down the block) Eve, and Petterino's (in the theatre district before Billy Elliot). Room service breakfast excellent, as well. Rooms are very nicely appointed, beds sooo comfortable, and the hotel honored our request for a high floor, quiet room (we were on the 27th floor). This is an excellent location to enjoy all that the beautiful and friendly city of Chicago has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - close to the action”
Reviews.Author: gjnbln
Reviews.Content: We found a great bargain here on one of the travel sites, and decided to book it for a night out on the town. This hotel was more than we could ask for - especially for the price. It was close to all the action. In addition, the lobby and bar were modern looking and attractive. The rooms were updated and had flat screens. If we can find this hotel at a similar rate again, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sgsilva
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I travel to Chicago every year for a convention. Last year we stayed at the Ritz Carlton and it was very nice, if not a bit stodgy. We had walked by the Sofitel and I thought I'd give it a try. The hotel is very modern and beautiful. Even though I'm 40 years old now, I can at least pretend that I am young and hip. We booked 2 junior suites for about the same as we would've paid at the Ritz. My partner got a awesome corner room. I ended up in a 'disabled' junior suite. While I would've preferred my partner's room, my room was still very nice. Being that it was for disabled guests it had 2 seperate showers and a seperate tub in the bathroom. It also had these really cool automatic curtains that my partner's room didn't have. Anyway, stil a really cool room. There are two bars downstairs both pouring great French Champagne by the glass. We ordered room service a couple of times and it was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay. Wish it couldve been longer.”
Reviews.Author: msky123
Reviews.Content: I was in chicaco for a job interview and did not book this hotel. I guess thats why I was upgraded to the 5th floor corner suite. The suite was very big, with a nice flat screen TV, nice desk and a confortable king size bed. Because this was a corner room, the windows were full length and made the room feel must larger than it really was. The hotel was very good. The lobby is spacious and well kept. The staff are very polite and helpful. The only problem I experienced in the morning. Dont really know why this hotel dooes not have a better taxi rank. This being a mostly business hotel, they know that mornings are the busiest time for people. Its not fun trying to wait for a taxi for 30 minutes in the rain. They must fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hollyol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for 4 nights with my mother. Great staff who are attentive, whilst remaining unobtrusive. We loved the view, the bar and the ambience. Superb bathrooms and the hotel is spotlessly clean. The location is excellent and it really cannot be beaten. We simply loved it! I would not think twice about staying here again or recommending it to others. It beats the Intercontinential where we spent the first 2 nights of our trip. It really was a fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times and always found it to be an excellent choice..Great location near shopping and the lake. Rooms are nice with good natural light. Also nice to have a glass of wine outside in nice weather. Outstanding value for a high quality hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoehc
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay on the 6th floor of this hotel. Rooms were larger than most, elegant and comfy bed. My only two complaints was the blocking of cell phone calls - I think to make money on their own phone. Also the maintenance personnel were poewer washing the breakfast area with an loud air compressor during the breakfast time. Other than that the breakfast was very delicious and the hotel was in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- just a few improvements would make it superior”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. The rooms are good-sized, with fantastic -- far better than Westin, etc., which are quite fine -- bedding, and the bathrooms are large and really just about perfect in all ways. The food is fantastic -- bar fare (cheese course and perfect drinks) and breakfast (not sure how to get it, but the little basket of breads is outstanding -- I didn't get it on this trip, but instead got a few slices of untoasted sourdough, er, no, thanks) is excellent and served in an indulgent, even excessive, way (little dishes for everything, an entire set of stuff to support a single cup of tea). The doormen are friendly and helpful. The front desk was much warmer than on previous trips, almost as if they knew I had corresponded with management about this topic -- maybe they did. But I take some points off for not very good service at breakfast (my reference to indulgent was about the quality of the food, presentation, and nice touches), and because I was a little irked that despite having the 2d highest A Club status, I still got a low floor room with a dud view. Still, this is the best hotel I've stayed at in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel for a weekend in July and had a fantastic experience. The location is unbeatable. The service was very good. Our flight arrived early morning and we did not expect to get into our room upon arrival, but the staff was checked us into our room at 10am. They also gave us a late check out and printed our boarding passes upon request. Everything was perfect and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sofitel Rocks! Sexy, attractive and modern. What else is there to say?!”
Reviews.Author: terrence_clayton
Reviews.Content: Well, my girlfriend surprised me for my birthday with a trip to Chicago. I had never been there, and since I travel for work extensively , she asked me for the names of my top 3 hotels. Of course, Hotel Sofitel was one of them. Once we arrived, she was in awe. She fell in love with the lobby. And of all things the business center lol , (don't ask me) since we needed to print our boarding passes for our return flight. Once the representative Alex at the front desk found out it was my birthday he send a delicious chocolate mousse up to my room, and that was special. We stayed in the king suite, and it was beautiful. My original room was on the 16th floor, I asked to be higher, and without skipping a beat Alex changed my suite to the 22nd floor. WONDERFUL! The bathroom was huge and most importantly, CLEAN!. Valet was timely, and the exercise room was fabulous. So, I can go on and on but I will end it with numbers in stead of words, the Hotel Sofitel is Chicago is a perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: SAH2469
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel - not only is the decor throughout the hotel fantastic but the hotel is centrally located amongst some of Chicago's famous restaurants and shopping areas. The entire hotel is decorated with fresh, exotic flowers posed in the most artistic arrangements. The rooms are modern, very clean and the beds are soooo comfortable (in fact we found it hard to get up every morning because it was so cozy). The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel comfortable all the way from being available to hail a cab, open the door for you or bring up an extra pillow or blanket (we requested an extra pillow and a vase for flowers and they brought it up within minutes of our call). I highly suggest having a drink at the bar in the evening - great drink selection (if you can, take advantage of having a glass of French champagne) and the atmosphere is upscale without feeling stuffy. The clock in the bar area is really neat! The restaurant food is fantastic, neat creations on the menu. Room service had the same quality - the order was in our room within 10 minutes of us placing the order. We have stayed at this hotel numerous times, in fact, we had our wedding reception there. We have never had a bad experience from a room, food or staff perspective. When we leave the hotel, our first thought is when we are going to be able to get back!

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Deipnon
Reviews.Content: We had a four-nigth stay there and everything was in line with our expectations. We reserved a deluxe suite, very well designed, furnished, clean and with a valuable view, though to be honest not the best that one can enjoy in Chicago. Staff is extremely polite and ready to give us help for any need. Prices are absolutely fair.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, friendliness and comfort combined -- excellent”
Reviews.Author: USchile
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Spring. The hotel is luxurious, its architecture is appealing, our room was ample and practical, great bathroom, location made it easy to visit and see a lot of downtown. Staff was very friendly all around, both bar and restaurants are trendy and very good. What else to say, all that at accessible prices, although not cheap. We've stayed at many luxury chains, this is our pick from now on.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding way to visit Chicago”
Reviews.Author: wildbillfl
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations, outstanding restaurant, helpful concierge, and perfectly located for all travel desires. A touch of Europe in the USA. We will always return to the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dekell
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and I wanted to do a girls trip to Chicago for shopping and leisure, etc. My daughter LOVED this hotel. The room was awesome with a great view. The hotel is located just off of the Magnificent Mile, so we could go shopping easily and then come back to our room to hang out for a bit before going back out. The staff was courteous and friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: dd220786
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is very modern and very close to downtown and all of the major shops. The lobby is decorated with some stunning vases and flowerbouquets. The check-inn desk is supereffective. From the moment we got out of our car into the lobby the knew our name. We still wonder how they did this but it made us feel more than welcome. The bellboy who brought our luggage to the room was superfriendly. We enjoyed our stay very much and if we ever should go to Chicago again we would definitely stay at the Sofitel again. The rooms are wellappointed and of a good size. As pointed out by another guest the overnight parking is rather expensive but then it seems quite normal because you are in a big city. .

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: AshleyFamilyVacation
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 nights with my husband and coworkers for business and a little pleasure and I must say the hospitality that I received was first class!! Even when I had an issue with my debit card (the $125 a night deposit was a shocker), the hotel staff was very helpful and offered a quick solution to rectify the issue. The rooms are checked and cleaned twice daily and they all speak French!! They respect the Do Not Disturb sign even when I requested more towels, they called instead of knocking because of the sign that I forgot to remove. The BOSE system in the room is a plus and my room had a view of Lake Michigan and the John Handcock Observatory. I was just minutes away from Michigan Avenue was i loved!! I would highly recommend this hotel if you are ever in the Chicago Area!! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel, EXcellent”
Reviews.Author: youthinrevolt
Reviews.Content: Stay here over the 4th of July weekend for Wedding, Hotel is beautiful, very modern, close to Mighigan Ave, and Rush St. Close to churches, Wondeful location. Room, was a little small, but emaculate, great service staff, while the front desk staff was friendly but not very helpful. Had a very pleasant experience. Only concerns would be: overnight valet parking is way to expensive, while the value of the room price was ok for the 5 star hotel. Would highly recommend this hotle for stays, but would not drive nor park a car here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Adaptation
Reviews.Content: We asked for late checkout on July 4th and got it easily. Evening bed turn down included bottled water from cleaning staff which was a nice touch. Concierge was helpful in booking theatre tickets. Concierge also booked a architecture but not they seemed not to offer the one from Chicago Architecture Foundation raved about NYTimes. We still enjoyed the one they booked. The patio seemed to be lively all the time and bar was busy whenever we visited if that is your thing. Hotel is close to Mag mile shopping but a little further from museums if you have preferences on what you want to do. This may be a nitpick but 11pm Saturday room service was a little slow taking over 30 minutes for fruit and chocolate cake but perhaps we were a little antsy. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kalib159
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was beautiful. It was conviently located to everything and anything you would want to do in Chicago. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel experience to aspire to”
Reviews.Author: lizmatsil
Reviews.Content: The staff and service at the hotel were outstanding. Considering the time of year we went, the price value was unheard of. The rooms were spotless, the concierge services could not have been better, and the location is perfect. It is right in the heart of the magnificent mile, but is an easy walk to Lincoln Park, and many residential areas. The doormen did an excellent job of getting taxis to wherever we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but NOT a 4 1/2 star!?”
Reviews.Author: kmduna01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Chicago for our 3rd anniversary and stayed at Sofitel. The only reason we stayed here was b/c we took a gamble through Hotwire on a 4 1/2 star property. Sofitel is where we ended up. In my opinion, this was in no way a 4 1/2 star hotel, and not at all worth what we paid ($225 a night). However, it wasn't an overall bad property. Here's the breakdown: Negatives: The room decor and style is very random. They attempted to provide a contemporary/urban style... I believe. Instead it appears very outdated and cold. The lobby is nice, but does not have the grand/classic/elegant feel that a lot of downtown Chicago hotels provide. The lobby is very dark and on the small side. Front desk staff not willing to provide any complementary upgrades of any sorts. Location not as centrally located as I would have liked. Rooms do not have free wi-fi. Positives: Room is very clean. The beds are heavenly!! You'll feel as though you're sleeping on a cloud! Bathrooms are beautifully done and include both a shower and soaking tub. Robes and slippers were a nice touch. Views are okay. Our room had a perfect view of the John Hancock building. Self parking garage is available right next to hotel if you want to save a few bucks. Small eateries are available behind hotel on both corners that made grabbing a coffee and small breakfast sandwich very convenient! Doorman, bellhop, concierge and housekeeping were all top notch. Cabs are always plentiful and waiting outside the hotel. Overall, just not my style! If I'm spending a romantic weekend away in Chicago, I want a classic, elegant, beautiful hotel! Sofitel is more business/contemporary-ish (rooms appears more dated then contemporary) type of property. Definitely not worth the price. Feel free to contact me with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Not so much...”
Reviews.Author: hotasatoaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location, but so are many others surrounding it. And, yes, it's very stylish and sleek, however, the service does not match the price. At $47 a day for parking, we were shocked to have to wait more than 20 minutes for our car three times. Also, while the rooms were clean, they are very small, and they didn't include a top sheet, which I found strange. There's no in-room coffee maker (there's too chic for such conviences, I suppose, but I'm not). They also charge for wi-fi, which I don't expect to pay extra for at a 4-star hotel. Also, the staff is hit and miss. Sometimes a doorperson was there to greet you, mostly not. Some were friendly and helpful, some were not. All and all, I would spend my money, time and vacation at another hotel. A

Reviews.Title: “NOT hospitable”
Reviews.Author: PPotts
Reviews.Content: My experience with guest services has been so marred, that I will never return to this Sofitel, nor any other Sofitel property ever again. Yes, the location is convenient, but the location does not make up for the poor customer service. The neighborhood offers better alternatives that are worthy of your time and money. There is no excuse for inept service and unsuitable treatment at a hotel that claims to be of high caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: CruzmamooseKentucky
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Sofitel in Chicago. I stay in hotels on a weekly basis for business/leisure. Upon entering our room I was greatly disappointed, there was an odor very similar to body odor, stale linens. The room was stuffy and we adjusted the theromstat before going shopping. Also noticed the mini-frig was hot and non-functioning. Upon return we dressed for dinner and I called the front desk to let them know about the stuffiness in the room that had not improved with the thermostat adjustment and the refrig. Upon return from dinner neither the refrig or air in the room was working. I called the front desk and was immediately moved to another room per our request. The location is fabulous, very near Michigan ave, many delicious restaurants and Rush street, the mattress/pillows were above average and comfortable and the bathroom is a perfect size. Try the Goddess market on the North side of the block for a quick/delicious breakfast/lunch. Would most likely not stay at this facility again due to the smell/air issues, too much trouble to deal with these type issues in a supposedly 4-star facility.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: RTMray
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their best suite to celebrate wife's birthday. It was an excellent, modern 1-bedroom corner suite, about 500 sq feet. Large king bed, 2 high-end 40" TV's. One in the LR, one in the BR. It also had a mini bar w/ all the overpriced treats (didn't try any). Instead, we walked to a small neighborhood market around the corner from the hotel and brought back soft drinks and my own snacks at normal pricing. The hotel was even kind enough to bring up a small fridge to store the snacks. That's was cool. The concierge was helpful as well with some sightseeing recommendations and also assisted with dinner reservations in the area which is some of the best in downtown Chicago. The restaurants in Chicago really are excellent. My only complaint which was solved immediatyely was the suite's ridiculous lack of closet space. So, I called room service and they immediately brought up a metal clothes rack and wood hangers which put a band aid over a bigger problem. (a hotel room, especially a suite should have enough closet space for 2 persons to hang up clothes for a few nights). Would I stay there again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MissSunshine_NG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of May during Memorial Day weekend and had a perfect stay - we didn't want to leave! The hotel is in a perfect location - it is centrally located surrounded by restaurants, shops, sights etc. The service at the hotel was fantastic and the rooms were lovely and very clean. I would definitely stay here again. Also, the restaurant was fantastic and the room service was amazing too. We had a truly wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Micht123
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in you feel a calmness, like everything will be taken care of. It was our anniversary and they had chocolate covered strawberries in our room. We were on the 30th floor and the views were very nice and the bed was so comfy. I love the bathroom, very large with a seperate shower and tub. The breakfast was gourmet and do not miss the pastries basket. The service was great and they attended to our every need. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, amenities and service ensured we mixed pleasure w/our business”
Reviews.Author: lid222
Reviews.Content: In Chicago on business, but couldn't help but feel we were in the city for pleasure trip because of the great location (close to Rush St., shops of Michigan Ave., and simply the feeling of being in a quaint neighborhood w/in the city), the hotel style and amenities (great lobby & patio lounge, comfortable/modern decor, fantastic rooms w/ great beds, separate soaking tub and shower in roomy bathroom, great bath amenities), and very efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “European in America”
Reviews.Author: Greenish
Reviews.Content: Great value, good location - residential, leafy, quiet road yet walking distance to main shopping centre; lovely restaurant/breakfast room. Don't use the landlines - cost an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee, but bars are nearby”
Reviews.Author: McHenryDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for a business meeting. Walking distance to Rush St. bars, but no in-room coffee pots, so morning can be difficult. Flatscreen TV, 2 phones, desk, reading chair, dresser, 2 end tables. Bose CD/Alarm clock. Very nice closet, and a terrific, comfortable King-sized bed. Dial thermostat worked fine; standard smoke detector and sprinkler. Beautiful well-lit closet. Seperate tub and shower with good height, well-lit mirror, and plenty of hot water. No great view from the southwest side. I parked in the parking garage next door which is not affiliated with the hotel and had no issues. Internet is an extra $10 per day which I did not pay for. Check in was a 15 minute wait to find out they had no rooms ready (at noon), I returned at 5:30 and waited another 5 minutes for my key. At checkout I had to revisit the desk and waited about 15 minutes for by bill to checkout (just before 8am). Also, no newspaper at the door during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel continues to deliver”
Reviews.Author: Davooda
Reviews.Content: The Davoodas stayed at Sofitel Water Tower Memorial Day weekend in a junior suite. It was our 4th stay at this marvelous hotel that we have come to think of as "home" more so than any of the other upscale hotels where we've stated. The staff are most professional and friendly, the accommodations high-quality and the location is hard to beat. We arrived about 12:30 pm, left the car with the valet and the luggage with the bellman. However, Mrs. D wanted to put her jewelry in the hotel safe. Alas, since the Sofitel has safes in each room, it does not have a lobby safe. But, the Director of Security offered the use of his personal lockbox behind the lobby of the hotel, which we gladly used. We spent the remainder of the day shopping. The Front Desk staff called me on my cell when our room was ready to occupy. They had fulfilled our request for a high-floor room with a view of the city. While the rooms are still easy on the eyes, I think it's time for a rehab/redecoration. There were some small stains on the carpet in our room and some marks on the trim and walls, and the piping on the edge of the black leather lounge chair in our suite was worn white - nothing to be upset about but at a four-star hotel, I expect better. We had loved the Sofitel beds in past visits but the one in this room has seen better days. We both awakened with sore backs due to the soft bedding and lack of support. Also, I found it odd the bed lacked a top sheet - I would have sworn there were top sheets on our prior visits. We liked being able to Le Bar - what can one say...excellent drinks (generous pours) in pleasant surroundings and a tray of marinated olives and crisps to nibble while imbibing! We sat outside because the weather was so nice and service was excellent inside our out. We did not dine at Cafe des Architects, but did enjoy a room -service breakfast that was very good and delivered on time and hot. I really liked the Sofitel coffee, but was disappointed when the croissants served to us were too dry. Mrs. D liked her omelet and my yogurt/berry parfait was delicious and cold. Check-out was seamless and our car was awaiting delivery of our luggage and shopping bags. Merci beaucoup, Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: DonaldE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in downtown Chicago May 22-25, 2010, and they delivered a great product once again. Our room was ready upon our arrival, the front desk personnel was very friendly and efficient. The lobby and outside dining complements the contemporary hotel, and the beautiful people were out in full force! The room itself met all expectations -- comfortable bed, efficient layout, nice flat-panel tv, generous bathroom with separate tub & shower. The pillows weren't all that comfortable (only one style), and our view (room #904) was a parking lot & condo building -- these are the only negative things I can say about our stay. We did not eat at the restaurant, or use any other facilities. However, the hotel was perfect for our business trip. The hotel is well located just two blocks from Michigan Avenue, Starbucks (one block), Urban Outfitters, Anthropologie, and many other great retail options nearby. The red line elevated train stops just two blocks from the hotel (Chicago Avenue stop), so easy to get here from the airports.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: One night stay for meeting. It was close to perfect. Comfortable, excellent food via room service, though expensive. Meeting support excellent. Food excellent. Hotel staff certainly superior . A lady (Rocio) serving lunch managed to stop a colleague inadvertently slinging salad dressing across the room when a dressing clad leaf got stuck in his sleeve buttons on his jacket. She sort of smothered his arm with a napkin, without even embarrassing him. You cant train people to do that. All comes at a price but excellent. Pennisula standard with a French moderne twist.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Suite- World Class Style and Service”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboi
Reviews.Content: On a fairly recent trip to Chicago, I split my time between the Sofitel and Dana Hotels. The Sofitel is a polished, modern, hip, yet comfortable hotel. More sophisticated and grown up than a W or the Dana. I stayed 3 nights in a very nice suite. I appreciated the great windows/light, comfortable furniture and best designed and functional storage/luggage areas I may have ever seen in a hotel. The bathroom was also very spacious and featured Hermes toiletries. (Overall the rooms/hotel were not as plush or refined as a Four Seasons, but perhaps equal to Park Hyatt or similar.) Standard rooms though very nice, are certainly less impressive and I actually would probably select the Dana Hotel for their excellent basic amenities/rooms, if my budget did not allow for a suite. The best and most unexpected feature of the Sofitel to me was the wonderful lobby restaurant. Daily breakfast was included in my package and to my delight, it was impressive and delicious. We also enjoyed an amazing 5 course dinner, thank to the very talented and charming French head chef that went out of his way to make us an incredible meal. (I apologize for forgetting his name!) Service and food all around was fantastic but if you eat one meal there, I have to say the breakfasts really stood out. It's worth a special trip even if you are not a guest of the hotel. One of the best I have had in Chicago! On the weak side, the fitness facilities are limited and there is no on-site spa/pool. Also, I never received a chocolate tray that was supposed to be included in my package, but the over-the-top meal provided by the chef more than made up for it. I am extremely picky and a self proclaimed hotel snob. Overall, I was very impressed with the Sofitel and will be glad to return. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fair value in a stylish, luxurious, sophisticated hotel in a great location- as long as you are ok with the limited amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKevin07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at the Sofitel . We found the hotel to be first rate and deserving of the positive reviews given by other visitors. It is in a great location close to good restaurants live music and an easy walk to most of the sights. A minor crticism I found the was that the breakfast rates were excessive and would recommend a visit to nearby cafes for a better value alternative. The staff were professional and helpful and I would recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but some niggles”
Reviews.Author: Baskingseal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with wife and friends. We had 2 junior suites which were stylish, reasonably sized, had super bathrooms and fantastic large super-comfortable beds. The area is first class, spotless chewing-gum free streets with plenty to do and see locally. Some reservations however - 1 rooms not ready for check in and no offer of a drink or coffee while we waited (maybe we should have asked) 2 no hot water for 12 hours in one room. When resolved a compensation offer of a 50% reduction in phone calls from room was turned down (costs were $120 for 3 five minute calls to England. Eventually accepted waiving of costs plus free breakfast for the four of us. 3 We were not told there was complimentary morning coffee until we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: madubo
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable. The bathroom probably one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel. It is spacious, well equipped, and clean. The room was attended to twice a day. Computer access is free - very unusual for an upmarket hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location if you're into shopping :)”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my guy for a shopping trip. The location is great, on a relatively quiet street but just blocks away great shopping (and my favourite lingerie shoppe :) & a very busy Michigan st! The guy at the front desk was friendly and check in was quick - we were able to get a room about an hour before the official check-in time (and got a coupon for $30 off our next stay too :) He made great recommendations for bars and joked that my guy should keep an eye on me while we're out since the area is known as "the viagra triangle" lol The room is a bit small for two people but good for a nights stay. The bathroom is pretty big - separate tub, shower, plenty of counter space, and a makeup mirror that came in handy. my one issue with the rooms - our mobiles had terrible service unless we stood just next to the window - but i guess the hotel cant really help that! the bar is very, well, sexy and chic and great for an aperitif and the bartender makes a mean dirty martini. or in my case, several mean dirty martinis.. didnt have a chance to scope out the wine list or anything Overall this is a great hotel, really up to par with other Sofitels I've stayed at. Good, friendly service, comfortable rooms/bathrooms, and an amazing location just steps away from world class shopping. I will definitely be back.. and putting that coupon to good use, lol

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Okay Value”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a better location in Chicago: on a quiet street just a block and a half off Michigan Avenue near Water Tower and Water Tower Place. The hotel runs lots of specials so we were able to get a room for what amounted to about $170 a night including taxes. It was billed as a "junior suite" and while the bathroom was huge and even better than the Penninsula around the corner, the room itself wasn't that large. The fold-out sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable as was the king bed. The hotel's website talks about its WI-FI access, but it's an extra charge. The hallways are my biggest complaint... odd pictures and very dark, like many W Hotels in the early 2000s... My Mom was convinced the artwork showed people jumping to their deaths from skyscrapers - It was all a bit funky and not in a good way. The best tip is to avoid the $20 fee for breakfast and walk down to the end of Chestnut for a great breakfast at The Tempo Cafe, a diner that serves all the egg dishes in skillets right to your table. There's an authentic and less touristy Pizza place around the corner on State Street, Pizano's. Whatever you do, DON'T plan to park your car at the hotel - it's a whopping 47 bucks a night!!! The biggest complaint is that they have a tiny gym and no connected spa or pool, but the location and price make up for it. And they were sticklers for not surrenduring the room 'til exactly 3pm - we got there at 2:30 and were told to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - from a Sofitel A-Club Platinum Member”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock104
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights as a top tier Sofitel A-Club Platinum member. This was the only reason I selected this hotel - out of loyalty to Sofitel, however I was left bitterly dissapointed. I travel to Chicago often and usually stay at the Swissotel and have never had a problem. When I arrived I asked for an upgrade, something which I am entitled to and have never been refused at a Sofitel property, however I was advised this was not availiable as they were booked out. Next to me however another guest was checking in and the receptionist offered her a paid upgrade to a suite - right in front of me - unbelievable! I was then told that I was given late check out and a complimentary drink (in a tone that I should be grateful). The staff were quite arrogant. Not happy about this I complained however never heard anything except when I filled out the survey. I was then fobbed off with an excuse that maybe the suite was only availiable for 1 night, then why wasn't I offered it? If Sofitel Chicago want to treat their premium guests like this - it's put me right off using Sofitel again - i'll stick to InterContinental or Swissotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel stay - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: waldorf579
Reviews.Content: On a business trip in early December, 2007, I had the pleasure of staying at Sofitel Hotel in Chicago Water Tower. The stay in it self was a pleasure in every consievable way. The rooms were great, and the setup was well thought through. Sofitel also has some of the best beds in the world (and they know it - they is why they also provide you with info about where to buy them if you dig around for a bit). I could rave about the interior design, the great lobby and many other things, but there is one thing in particular that stands out. I had lunch and an early dinner on the 6th of December in the hotel restaurant, and had the delight of being waited upon by a gentleman named Michael. Without extensive detail, I can assure you that I have never received a better and more heartfelt service in my life. The food was also great, and they had a deal where you got a 4 piece sample menu at lunch for around $30 - great deal! I have not had a chance to return to Sofitel since then, but I will make sure to stop by next time I am in the Chicago area on business.

Reviews.Title: “A magical time at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: KariSlc
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay for the second time at the Sofitel, this time in one of their one bedroom suites. The value was incredible this time of year, the suite was about the same price as a King room would normally be. I can't express how nice it was to have the luxury and space traveling with a grown son and visiting family in Chicago. We had a living room to hang out in, have wine, listen to music and visit before hitting the (wonderful!) city. The views were incredible, the service excellent. At one point we unexpectedly needed the couch made up into a bed in addition to needing one of their inflatable beds brought up. They were made with the same sheets, mattress toppers pillows and comforters as our King bed. I call that going above and beyond! The lobby is grand and modern and you feel pampered just hanging around in it. Whomever does the flowers is incredibly talented! Lastly, the breakfasts are sublime, if you have an opportunity, include them in your package. Overall, a delightful stay, in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la!”
Reviews.Author: AfricanDivaFromKenya
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I was amazed at the comfort and elegance of this hotel. As described by many others, the rooms are elegant with excellent finishings. My room was huge with a wonderful view of downtown Chicago. What I really want to know is where do they get there beds and pillows. I thought I'd died and gone to sleep heaven! Amazing. The bathrooms are spacious and put together elegantly. I loved the orchids. Cafe des Architects is the in house restaurant and deserves every rave review it recieves. I had dinner on my first night in Chicago and it was amazing flavours. A simple gnocchi was bursting with flavour and beautifully laid out. I decided to have breakfast there every morning for my 7 day stay. And every morning it was perfect. My all time favourite was the crab cake.

Reviews.Title: “Good (not the greatest, but good)”
Reviews.Author: revengeofaone
Reviews.Content: Great location about 3 blocks to water tower. Great shopping around hotel (Lululemon, Urban Outfitters, American Apparel etc.) Right next to "Viagra Triangle" dining. $47 valet park per night, but average for Chicago. Easy checkin. First room had damp smell. Asked to be relocated immediately. Next room much better. Noted puddle of water from under sink. However was not enormous, and didnt want to complain a second time, so accepted room. Bed very comfortable. Great HDTV. Robes, slippers, sewing kit, soap, loofa, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, nail filer thing, qtips etc included in marble bath. Toilet speakerphone. Shower water temperature either an extremely long delay or mind of its own. Would start out cold, then lukewarm, then cooler again, then extremely hot even after turning temp down it would stay hot, then get cold. Free coffee and newspapers in the restaurant in the morning. The French theme was fine. I found everyone to be very friendly and aside from saying Bonjour to you, they would answer in English with zero atttude. Overall, would recommend if looking for a hotel in this area, if you get at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again anytime”
Reviews.Author: GettinErDun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of March for a get-away with my wife. Booked online thru the hotel website and got a deal ... stay two nights get one free .. we opted for the Junior suite. (The cost boiled down to $165/night) The hotel itslef is nicely appointed. Staff at the valet, check-in and conceirge were all friendly and courteous. We got a room on the 30th, floor and it was vey quiet. View was nice, I liked the city view at night not having one myself at home. Bed was super comfy. I dreamed the room was going to be larger somehow, altho it was a perfect size. Had a decent LG LCD TV which swiveled to the bed. The bathroom was very big and elegant, decent towels. The tub was nice but lacking tho as it was not large enough for 2 people unfortunately, glass shower was great. Room was cleaned well everyday and turned down at night with water provided. The stay was not without its faults altho somewhat minor in my opionion: the toilet flusher was broken (but promptly fixed) and I did notice the couch and parts of the rug had questionable stains .... and knowing what goes on in a hotel room, didn't leave me many guesses (not that I've never left a stain.... ) Didn't affect my stay at all, but honestly a steam cleaning every so often wouldn't hurt would it? Anyway, location is PERFECT for access to magnificent mile shopping and the Rush street dining. The bus is also 2 blocks off in any direction which will take u down the loop in about 10 minutes. We didn't eat in the restuarant so I can't comment on the bar or food there, nor did I touch the mini bar. All in all a great stay, there are few other places I'd stay in the city after having such a pleasent 3 days at Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Kiki2014
Reviews.Content: Our trip into the city was tough with a few canceled flights. We couldn't have been happier to get to the Sofitel. Check-in was efficient and warm. Our suite was ready early, which helped ease our minds. I was starving, so after putting our luggage in the room we went directly to the concierge desk. Katie was great! It was our first time in the city and she carefully explained the city layout and pointed out some great attractions. We decided on Pizano's for lunch and loved it! It was a great recommendation. She also made dinner recommendations and seemed to be available day and night, whenever we called the desk! Our room turned out great too. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was so large and luxurious! Overall, the staff seemed to be on point at all times. Valet was quick, Le Bar was really relaxing, but fun too! We will definitely look forward to staying at Sofitel again!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: IMATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience! The hotel (room, lobby, bar, restaurant) was beautiful and the hotel staff were very friendly and polite. Upon check-in we asked for and received a complimentary upgrade and we were treated to a lovely room on the 30th floor with an awesome view of the Hancock tower. The location was great - right near Michigan Avenue and the red line "el" station. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ladymacb29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was gorgeous and very clean. The staff was very friendly. The bathroom was the highlight - it's larger than mine at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: riin88
Reviews.Content: That was a great hotel, good service and very nice rooms! I wanna go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Sofitel for our 3 year wedding anniversary and could not have asked for a better location, nicer room or better staff! Everything is top notch at this hotel; the front desk staff, housekeeping and valets were all wonderful. The bathroom is lovely, the bed is comfy and the rooms are huge; closets are a bit tiny if you pack as much as I do though! This hotel is a must in Chicago, it is perfection!!!

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for anymore.”
Reviews.Author: j4041
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fantastic. I travel approx. ten times per year throughout Canada and the US. This hotel exceeded every expectation. The location is fantastic and the rooms are beautiful. The staff are the friendliest I've ever experienced and they really go the extra mile for their patrons. I can't wait for my next trip to the Sofitel Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: mytravelinsight
Reviews.Content: Since Valentine's day landed on a Sunday, I surprised my wife for a 1 night stay at the Sofitel. We stayed in a Prestige Suite and took part in their Air of Romance package. I usually stay in Marriotts, SPG hotels when I get a chance so I had debated over getting a suite at the W. Based on the reviews from TripAdvisor, I decided to go to the Sofitel for the luxury experience. I'm glad I listened to the community because the reviews are consistent with the quality of the rooms, service and overall experience. Every time you contacted either the front desk or room service or any other place, they were attentive and prompt with your needs. So the service is great and I would highly recommend it. As for the rooms, the suite was simple modern European elegance (that was my initial reaction to the room) which was very nice and what I was hoping for. It wasn't a darker modern look, but more neutral colors so it made us feel more lively (I think the color of the room makes a difference). Anyways, the standout of the room were 2 things...the bathroom was "gianormous" with it's marble floor, deep tub and it's clear glass doors leading to the toilet and stand up shower (i'm not sure why they have a glass door to the toilet...perhaps it was a conversation piece). The 2nd point was a vanity desk for my wife...she enjoyed it because it made it easier for her to get ready in the evening. As for the view, it wasn't anything spectacular, but it also wasn't something that I was looking for...again, the room was key for our night. As part of our day, we had a masseuse recommended by the Concierge at the Sofitel. They provided one from Windy City Massage and one of the packages they sold was a 75 minute massage where they would show the couple how to give a massage to each other. The experience to do that was worth the price for our romantic Valentine's day. If you ask me if I would pay for that service again, probably not as it was a one time thing to make the experience unique. I bring it up in this review because the Sofitel had suggested it and I was pleased with the unique experience. Afterwards, we had dinner at Cafe Des Architects. The decor was definitely remarkable and eye-catching. The food itself (it was fixed price menu) was definitely flavorful and I was surprised it was of high quality even at a hotel. In the morning we had room service, again, I enjoyed breakfast in bed. The quality of the food is very good and I would recommend eating room service breakfast. Granted there's a price to pay, but i think as once-in-a-while splurge (especially for a Valentine's day event) it's worth the experience. Overall, if you are looking for a refined luxury experience with attentive service, then check out this hotel especially for a romantic relaxing night (or weekend).

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable bed i've ever slept in...”
Reviews.Author: SungirlFlorida
Reviews.Content: I lived in Chicago for 7 years before moving to Florida 2 years ago. There are many amazing hotels to choose from but we chose the Sofitel for the location. We were not disappointed. As mentioned, the location is AMAZING... close to everything. The hotel is beautiful and the staff could not have been more hospitable. I have to say that the very best part of the trip was the SoBed... Sofitel's double feather bed. It is amazing!!! The only minor issue we had during our stay is that the hot water went out - I say this was minor as a maintenance man was sent up immediately on a Sunday and took care of it. We visit Chicago frequently as many of our friends and family are there. We can't wait to get another night's sleep in the SoBed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Girls' weekend”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided to stay here for a girlsâ€™ weekend in Chicago and absolutely loved the hotel. We got a good rate for a Superior room off there site approx. $129/night. The room was super clean and comfortable for the both of us. The bathroom was huge with Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The location was perfect too and we were able to walk every where. Two blocks from Magnificent Mile and 4 from the John Hancock building where you can pick up the double decker bus. Concierge was friendly and helped us with the purchase of our Sears Towers tickets and bus tour. We ended our nights with a nightcap at the hotel bar. Martinis were a little pricey but the bar atmosphere had a good vibe. There an old school diner right next door for breakfastâ€¦the omelets were delicious. Overall, if I were to return to Chicago, I would stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Luxury Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: julie h
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old daughter and I stayed at Sofitel just before Christmas on the "I love Chocolate" special. Full breakfast came with the room as well as a fancy chocolate experience, which I will describe in a bit. The hotel is fabulous and pristine. The rooms are unparalleled. The beds with their thick feather duvets are fantastic. There is a marble bathroom with soaking tub and shower. The staff was so helpful and pleasant! Breakfast was delicious and gorgeous and we could order whatever we wished from the breakfast menu. And there is French Press coffee! The chocolate experience was a tray of mini desserts of different types which was brought to our room upon our request. I almost half expected to see some type of extra charge upon departure, but no, I was pleasantly surprised by a zero balance on the bill. I can't say enough good things about the Sofitel. If I had anything bad to say or any improvement to suggest, it is that there is no coffee maker in room. Therefore you must get dressed and ready and leave the room for coffee or get room service (either way you sort of have to face the world before coffee). Certainly not a major complaint though. Also, the location of this hotel is just by water tower and rush street. Plenty of fabulous restaurants and shopping just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful corner of France in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Gurnee
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this great hotel was just as pleasant as the first one. This time, we decided to take advantage of the â€œI love chocolateâ€� package, which entitled us to a free third night, breakfast for two at CafÃ© des Architectes for all three days, a chocolate treat one afternoon, and a late check-out (4 pm) on the last day. This really was a great deal. 1. The hotel: Check-in was fast, efficient, and friendly. Our room (we decided to upgrade to a luxury room on an upper floor) was located on the 27th floor and had a gorgeous view of the Hancock Tower with a little sliver of lake next to it and a larger view of the lake above the 900 North parking garage when we looked to the left. One of the walls of the bedroom is a wall of windows, so a nice view makes a real difference. Our bedroom was decorated in very neutral tones: Lots of beiges and off-whites with a few touches of rust, and a modern painting in pastel colors. The furniture is modern and made of light wood. The bed is comfortable: The King size mattress has a very fluffy mattress topper that makes it feel like you are sleeping on a cloud. The duvet is warm and the sheets are a high thread count cotton. There is a light on each side of the bed and a Bose radio-alarm clock on one side. The flat-screen TV is large, and the Francophone station TV5 is one of the channels available. The large closet with mirrored doors lights up automatically when you open it. There is a safe in there, and a fridge in the cabinet under the TV (with very little room for storage). Two robes, two pairs of slippers, an ironing board and iron are also provided. There is no coffee-maker in the room, but when we asked for an electric tea-kettle, it was delivered within minutes. Similarly, no wine glasses were provided, but they were brought when we requested them. We were even asked to specify whether we wanted white or red wine glasses. Nice touch. Two bottles of Evian water are brought to your room at night. One more detail: Although USA Today is always available on each floor next to the elevators, it is possible to request delivery of a different paper. Many choices are provided. The bathroom is large and luxurious: large shower, separate tub, single sink with lit-up mirror and plenty of storage below it, magnifying mirror on the side. Lâ€™Occitane products are provided, the towels are thick, and a quality hairdryer can be found under the sink. Be forewarned that the unusual bathroom doors do not lock (but provide complete privacy nonetheless). Everything is in good repair and impeccably clean. The rooms are well insulated and very quiet. This all makes for a very relaxing stay. 2. The restaurant and bar. Breakfast at CafÃ© des Architectes is pretty amazing. The creativity of the chef shows in the presentation as well as the taste of the food. I ordered the cherry wood-smoked salmon and sesame bagel with chive and lime cream cheese twice, and the crabcake Benedict once. The crabcake Benedict was a bit of a disappointment (I missed the smokiness of Canadian bacon and did not much care for the fishiness of the crab in this dish), but the smoked salmon breakfast was a delight both to the eyes and the palate (See picture). My husband ordered the ham and gruyÃ¨re crÃªpes one morning and found them excellent. He had the egg cocotte provenÃ§ale the following day and was less thrilled. On the third morning, he chose the Ã€ votre santÃ© breakfast, an egg white, mushroom and spinach concoction with a light tomato coulis (See picture), and really enjoyed it. I should mention that all the egg dishes also come with a basket filled with croissants, pains au chocolat, breads and apricot pastries, and that the coffee and tea are excellent and nicely presented. These are all very hearty breakfasts indeed. We also had lunch at the restaurant on the last day. We both took the â€œExecutive lunchâ€�, which is a combination plate with four little serving plates on it (See picture). Our choice was tuna tartare (excellent), a salade lyonnaise with poached egg, bacon and croutons, a small beef filet with a single pomme dauphine, and two little dessert bites on the last plate. It was perfect. Our experience at the bar was a mixed one. We went there one afternoon to take advantage of the chocolate â€œgoÃ»terâ€� that came with the â€œI love chocolateâ€� package. The bar is a very pleasant space, which made the long wait for our treat a non-issue. The treat, however, was a disappointment: 6 bite-size chocolate pastries (so three bites per person), served with three espresso cups filled with three different kinds of chocolate milk to be shared. It just seemed stingy. Tasty but ridiculously small. We decided to stay in the bar and have drinks. They were served with olives and bacon-flavored crackers. Glasses of wine start at $12, and cocktails are $13. To summarize: All in all, I strongly recommend this hotel. The location is wonderful: A two-minute walk takes you to Water Tower and 900 North. If you are looking for deals, Fileneâ€™s Basement and Marshallâ€™s are not far. The Museum of Contemporary Art is close. Oak Street Beach is 10 minutes away. Holy Name Cathedral is 5 minutes away. There are lots of wonderful restaurants and numerous bars in the vicinity. There is a parking garage right behind the hotel ($32 a day) which is a slightly cheaper option than the parking provided by the hotel, I believe.
