The bed was Good. When we arrived there was a box of LenÃ´tre Chocolates. And every nigh they gave us free bottle of Evian. The bathroom was also nice, in marble, with bathrobes from Frette and bath amentities from Roger et Gallet which is common in France. The only bad point on this suite was the closet which was very small (smaller than in the Deluxe Room). But when we told that to the front desk they bring us a mobile rack to hang the clothes. We come from France with Rebecca (our little Shih-tzu) and there was a "Queen" Bowl of water waiting for her in the room (look at the photos...) and sweets for dogs. It's just a pity that there is no pool in a new hotel like this one. The bar of the Hotel was very cool and it was the place to meet the Chicagoans. The Breakfast at CafÃ© des Architectes was also top. The pastries were like the best in France And nothing to say also about: -the eggs benedict with bacon or crab cakes or just simple -the omelettes -the Belgian waffle -the fruits Just perfect! The deco of the Sofitel is breathtaking. The location is just one block from the magnificient mile (Water Tower Place, Bloomingdale's, Tiffany & co, Ralph Lauren, Armani Exchange, Saks, Neiman Marcus, Apple Store, Nike Town, Nordstrom...) and two blocks from Oak Street (Prada, Tod's, HermÃ¨s, Diesel...) ...and walk away from the major interesting sites of the city. The Check-in/out was with no wait. The information of the Concierge (especially of Heather who spoke French) were very good for all sightseeings and restaurants. The staff of the Sofitel is always with smile and ready for a lot of little attentions that makes your stay the most pleasant as it can be. To End, if you go to the Sofitel you won't regret your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Perfect Location, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: halogen9
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel for two nights, October 6-7, during the very busy Marathon weekend. No marathon for me :) and I would not have picked a high priced weekend if I had known, but I had booked my airfare first to accomadate a work schedule. I don't mind the crowd so much as the high rate of $275/night, and that was WITH a corporate discount, else rack was over $350. Anyway, I did think it was worth the higher rate because some of the other 2-3* hotels were at least $200. I traveled alone, for a pleasure trip away. FROM AIRPORT: Booked a car service called American Chauffeurs for $42 with tax, one way, about 30 minutes. Taxi would have been about the same. Checked shuttle in advance which would have been about $25 one way but was worried about the longer wait time and drop offs at various hotels. CHECK-IN: The bellmen were quick to bring my luggage in and wait for my check-in. It was right before the 3pm check in time and no issues. I had requested a higher floor which they gave me on 24th floor. The elevator was quick and quiet--ie did not hear rattling and movement if you had a room near it, because it is also setback a bit from the hallway, by design. Clean, sleek, dark, but you could tell right away it was new, modern, and sophisticated. Many of the guests were European (I could hear Dutch, French) and I think there were a few conferences that day from the posting in hotel lobby, but this did not interfere--you could hardly notice because those areas were well concealed. HOTEL LOCATION: Perfect, a block from John Hancock Observatory and the north end of Michigan Mag Mile. I shopped at Filene's, H&M, Marshall's, MaxMara, etc. Some designer bargains to be had at Filene's so look thoroughly. DINING: Loved breakfast there at Sofitel's only restaurant, L'Architecte. It was about $15 for a selection of eggs with meats, and the best basket of french pastries and breads (chocolate croissants, baguette mini, danish, muffin/scone, etc). Or you could get waffles, crepes. Came with fresh squeezed juice and coffee in your own karafe/pot brewed individually. Great service!!! Did not try room service though. I also ate at TEMPO's the diner a few doors down, which was ok, much cheaper (about $6-10). I had asparagus omelette there with coffee and toast for about $9 which was ok. But for $5 more, try Sofitel food! I did like the fact that Tempo is 24 hours so you can have much more there (sandwiches, etc) for cheap. BISTRO 110: Walked there, around corner from Michigan , and food was good, nothing spectacular, other than the bread being served with full roasted garlic cloves. Had oysters as an appetizer, Artichoke dish, and tried the creme brulee for dessert, which is average. Moderate pricing, about $35 total. GIORDANO's PIZZA: Ordered delivery to try a small deep dish, and calamari. Very good, very fast. About $20. BELLA BACINO'S: Ordered delivery when I was at in the loop at Hotel71 (right next door) and while the thin pizza was decent, it would have been better if HOT or a bit more warm. The service was horrible. They forgot my order, I had cold calamari, and the desserts creme brulee and tiramisu were melting away. Promised delivery of 30 minutes and it took 2 hours plus two phone calls with the manager to ask when they left (response was always--15 minutes ago). All this for $30 and I can't recommend unless you dine in there I guess. LE COLONIAL: Vietnamese, I thought, but it is definitely geared for Amer/French and if you are expecting the REAL deal, you will be disappointed. The salads were geared towards American tatses, like using lettuce greens vs. the true style of all julienned carrots and super thinly sliced cucumber mesh. Nice atmosphere--all business types when I was there and not a single Asian person except myself, so you know this is not home cooking when you don't see natives. The Pho was ok, missing the typical meat variation, and the thiet nhuong was served not in the typical rice noodle bowl fashion but on a plate on top of thin banh hoi. Very expensive at $50 for appetizer salad, main dish, and banana tapioca dessert. BACK TO HOTEL: BATHROOM, BED, ROOM: Clean, clean, clean! Spotless. Tub separate from shower. Nice water pressure. The bed has the greatest fluffy pad and feather down duvet. It turned cold that weekend, like 45F at night and 55F daytime, so I had the heater on and it worked wonderfully. Always as hot as I wanted --no limit setting, like with other hotels who give you Warm and Cool, this has actual temperature settings. Never heard much from anyone--the rooms were quiet, the doors didn't shut too loudly, and the views were good, with the large windows. The rooms seemed very small to me, but you don't expect so much space in a city. There was a separate lounge chair and desk area next to the king bed. Turndown service included Evian water and temperature card. Great modern safe to set your own code. I did not use the mini bar nor the internet this time. STAFF: Easy checkout. Very professional people. At times, it did appear there were a lot of bellmen who could have helped some of the folks open the doors as they carted in their luggage...this did not happen to me but I did notice that as I sat in the lounge/lobby waiting for a friend one evening. Mainly business people or those in their 30's and above. Everyone always smartly dressed. Few families here, or if they were here, I didn't notice any kids running around like you have at other hotels. BAR: It was vey popular and busy, even late! It seemed people who were not staying at the hotel, also frequented this spot so it must be a gathering place for friends to have drinks. Nice ambience, and I did not try any of the appetizers here. Other Attractions: I visited Art Institute, $12 admission and about $7 cab ride away. Also, Architectural boat tour with First Lady Co. for $25 and about $6 cab ride away. John Hancock was within walking distance of Sofitel, $10 admission and the best view!! In summary, I would stay here again in a heartbeat, if I could get a discounted rate. Nothing super special that is a MUST SEE in this hotel, but so comfortable and enjoyable that I have to give 5 stars. I hope my details helped and that you can get a better rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but nothing super special!”
Reviews.Author: MI2UK
Reviews.Content: Just 3 stars for this hotel which is "Neutral / Average" because compared to other hotels it's nothing really extra to write home about! We chose the Sofitel based on reviews here and being #1 in the popularity index. We weren't disappointed but we weren't "WOWed" by any means! Having said that, by Chicago prices this hotel isn't so bad for what you get. We chose the deluxe rooms where you pay a little extra for a higher floor and we were on the 28th. Good views over the city where we weren't overlooked by neighboring buildings. The room size was okay - I'm not sure how it compares with "non-deluxe", but we weren't in Chicago to spend all our time in the hotel! It had a chair with footrest so you could open up the blind on the very large window, sit back and look out over the views if you wanted to. There was also a desk where you could work, but unlike most hotels nowadays, internet connection was an additional $20 for the 3 nights we would be staying. This should be included in the price and not additional. There was enough hanging space, a safe, iron, TV etc, and of course the bed... One thing we were looking forward to was trying out the bed especially after reading all the reviews which mentioned the bed! So jumped onto the bed and.... what are all the reviews talking about!!!??? It may not seem like it but I'm not a hard critic but the bed was.... just a comfortable bed as I would expect in any hotel. No better, no worse. Bathroom was large and clean. If you're going to stay in the room with a non-spouse, beware that the two "French window" style doors to the bathroom have a gap in the middle and no lock! So you may want to sing or whistle to remind the other person(s) you're in the bathroom! Shower was great, didn't use the bath. There is a volume control in the bathroom too where you can hear what is on the TV from a speaker under the sink unit. Hotel was clean. Hotel valet parking was $37 a day additional - parking in Chicago is expensive wherever you go. Check in/out was quick and easy. Overall, a nice and clean hotel but not a place where I'd say "Oooh - you MUST stay at the Sofitel if you go to Chicago!" I've had the experience of staying there now and it was nothing extraordinary, but next time in Chicago I'll be trying somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service is exellent but not pretentious. Everyone has a smile for you and is extremely friendly. We paid the extra for a room upgrade and the room was faultless. The only problem that an eldrely couple coud have is getting out of the bath after a long soak! No problem use the exellent shower. The restaurant has to be one of the best in Chicago and consequently can get quire full but is probably geared more to European tastes than American. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but didn't appreciate it until later”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend on the front-end of a two-day business meeting in July (for which I stayed in another comparable Chicago hotel located very close by). After reading many of the reviews, I selected the Sofitel based on location, amenities, price, and the "hip" factor. After checking-in, I was initially a bit disappointed because the room seemed a bit smaller than what I was expecting based on the online photos and I was placed on a lower floor (after requesting an upper... I know, someone has to stay on the lower ones). Overall, the front-desk service was helpful (had one little communication issue with no resolution on the part of the hotel), the basic room was exceptionally clean (lovely bathroom was spotless), bed was very comfortable, and the rest of the hotel property was nice. During our stay, a window above the front entrance shattered and they had to divert people entering the building to a remote side entrance near the bar. No big deal, just inconvenient. Also, I noticed the "S" on the Sofitel sign at the top of building had burned out and it looked tacky to see "-ofitel". The bar was always hopping and there was a wedding party that added a little additional racousness. On the positive side, we really appreciated the close proximity to Mich Ave shopping, the 24 hour cafe and coffee shops around the corner, and the pleasantly surprising nice meal at Cafe Luciano which was just across the street. After relocating to the other hotel for my business meeting, I began to appreciate all that the Sofitel had to offer in comparison. I'd look forward to visiting Chicago and staying at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: OnMaberyRoad
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16-year-old daughter and I just returned from a 5-day stay in Chicago at the Sofitel Hotel and I'm already booking a return visit! The service was uniformly charming and professional, from the warm and friendly valet parking staff to the cheerful housekeepers. Our spacious suite on the 16th floor (which we paid less for than a single room in Manhattan!) had a sensational view of the city. But it was the inside of the place that thrilled me the most. Very modern, but warm, with fantastic lighting and tasteful fabrics and furnishings. And the bathroom! My daughter and I took turns bathing in the beautiful tub, which featured an array of lovely Roger & Gallet products. There is also a separate, enclosed shower stall and separate w.c. The location is great for walking to the Architectural Cruise that departs from Wacker St., to the lakeshore, to Millenium Park and the Art Institute. In the other direction are chic boutiques and neighborhood grocery stores. Two restaurants within walking distance: Le Colonial (Vietnamese) and Carmine's (Italian w/sidewalk dining). My husband hosted a business meeting one morning which required some additional audio video equipment. It was brought to the room immediately and at no extra charge. One slight snag: We moved some minibar items out of the refrigerator to replace with our own yogurt, fruit, etc. We were charged for all the items we'd removed for each day of our stay. The desk promptly corrected our bill and told us that next time, they'd be happy to send up a fridge for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: pkeenan
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Sofitel in Chicago for business was excellent. Nice room, terrific staff and a great location. Laundry comes back with ribbons and special wrapping. Restaurant had delicious food and great service and the LeBar was very comfortable. Class act. Only recommendation would be to order up your car from the valet a 1/2 hour before you need it. Otherwise I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Some Customer Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: chapter1012
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because had heard so much about it. We called before we left to see if the room was ready & they assured us it was...upon arrival, however, we were told it would be at least an hour before the room was clean. They were not nice about it and their tone was not what we expected from an expensive hotel that promotes customer service. We asked if they would buy us a drink at the bar and suddenly a room opened up! The room was very nice & the bathroom was beautiful but not an oversized tub as we were told. The room was very warm and although we kept the air blowing on high and the temperature at 50, it never got cool. Finally, they came to look at it, changed the filter which was filthy, and assured us it would cool down. It did cool a bit but never got cold. When we checked out, they did credit us $30 a night because of the air conditioning problem. While we appreciated that, it did not make up for the rudeness we encountered when we arrived. All in all, we had a great time but were disappointed in the lack of service for such an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: 2broadway
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Chicago in less than a year. All pleasure, no business. This time around we chose to stay at the Sofitel mainly based on the reviews from this site and the photos of the room. We were not disappointed. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we followed a reviewer's suggestion and walked over to Tempo restaurant for breakfast. The wait was not long and we both enjoyed our food. After walking around a bit, we returned to the hotel and found that the room was ready. I asked for a room on a high level and was granted such. The room was very nice, a little on the small side but I did like the bathroom. There was even a live plant inside. How nice. The toiletry items were very nice, unfortunately the brand name escapes me. We found the bed to be comfortable but so far my vote goes for the beds at LeMeridien as the most comfortable bed I've slept in while in Chicago. We received turn down service every night. The two bottles of Evian water(in lieu of chocolates) is a nice touch. Although the lobby and bar area were pretty noisy at night, ( I'm thinking the bar here is the hippest place to hang out - at the moment) we didn't mind at all. The best time for us to visit the bar was on our way to dinner. We had dinner at Gibson's, Ditka's, and a couple other places I can't remember. No complaints about the food or service in any of the restaurants. Breakfast at the Sofitel restaurant was very good. All of the employees that we came across were pleasant and helpful. Just one more thing, this hotel really is in a great location . I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Different...Unique”
Reviews.Author: ziggiee
Reviews.Content: We live outside of Chicago and wanted to spend a night downtown. We searched over Trip Advisor's site to search for a hotel that would suit our weekend visit. This is our first trip EVER staying downtown and wanted to make it a nice event. Our family of 2 adults & 2 teenage children stayed at Chicago's Sofitel for a Saturday night stay. We booked this stay last minute and requested an upper floor for a view. When we arrived, we were given a room on the 6th floor and asked if at all possible could the agent somehow find another room on an upper floor, and we understood booking this last minute didn't guarantee our request, but the agent searched for us and did find a room for us. The hotel was near full capacity, according to the desk agent. We were on the 30th floor...beautiful view. The room was small & very clean and very unique in a sense that it did not match other hotel rooms that we have stayed at. Very retro and just different. We liked the dual a/c in the bathroom and our sleeping quarters. So if you wanted it a little warmer in the bathroom, that was possible. The lobby is very retro and roomy. We ate breakfast at the restaurant on the main floor because others on this site recommended it. It was a nice experience. French cuisine for sure and we noticed that many visitors in the lobby were french speaking. We give this hotel 4 stars based on 5, because no one scores a perfect 5. Because there are so many other hotels downtown, we would probably try another for variety, but would l00% recommend this to anyone who wants to experience Chicago in a different setting. One more thing, the hotel is close to everything. Rush Street, Oak Street, Michigan Avenue, Water Tower Place . You have it all at this location. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip to Chicago and took my wife with me. I booked a room at the Sofitel after reading the reviews on this website. We weren't disappointed. The location is excellent and the room was beautiful and very comfortable. The concierge and staff at the front desk were great help to my wife, as she planned shopping and visits to different sites around Chicago. We had cocktails in the lobby bar and enjoyed the library of architectural books and the friendly conversation with our server. This will be my first choice when I return to The Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly new hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Digest
Reviews.Content: Sofitel was a fairly new property in a very good location. One large city block away from the large stores, Bloomingdales, Saks, etc on Michigan Avenue. The Hotel is also walking distance to resturaunts. The only thing wrong with Sofitel are the weard wash cloths, they look like puppets, and NO COFFEE MAKER IN THE ROOMS. Although you can order from room service, breakfast is awesome. The staff at the hotel were excellent. The room was a bit small compared to other 4 or 5 star hotels. The hotel does allow pets, which I am not one for this feature because of cleanliness issues, fleas, mites and pets sniffing your $300 Boss jeans. Sofitel, get rid of the pets. We personally find this disgusting. Do keep in mind Chicago seems to have a problem with cabs. I personally experience this on a couple of trips. No A/C, bad body oder, you name it, they have it. We are not a fan of public transportation but the trains are fine. If you want a larger room and do not mind a corporate style hotel, try the Renaisance River North, awesome views but a few blocks from Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Once again-Sofitel is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: maae40
Reviews.Content: We had stayed last summer in the Sofitel in New York. Consequently, we were so pleased with our stay there, we decided to stay in the Sofitel while visiting in Chicago. Once again, the hotel in Chicago is just as nice as the one in New York. The beds are very comfortable and the service is wonderful. Also, the location is just great! As you can read in the following reviews, the Sofitel is just grand. You will not be disappointed. Go next door to the Tempo Restaurant for breakfast. It is a nice treat. However, be sure and take cash, they do not take credit cards. We also ate at Ditka's restaurant and saw Mike, himself. It has wonderful food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-TA
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a recent 5 night stay based on the reviews on this website and I have to say that all the reviews of this hotel are accurate. Very good location (20 min walk from the lakefront, good restaurants in the neighbourhood, the Magnificent Mile in one direction and this kinda cool and funky upscale neighbourhood in the other direction (the Gold Coast?), really excellent room service, clean and attractive room in a very stylish building. It is not cheap but you get what you pay for in the Sofitel Water Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower during this past Canadian long weekend. What a wonderful location - a short block away from Magnificent Mile and very close to Navy Pier. Knowing that I would contribute some thoughts on our experience to Tripadvisor, I asked the other three for their comments and it seems that we are all in agreement. The hotel and its common areas (lobby, restaurant, bar) are sophisticated and extremely well-kept. We were looking forward to sharing a drink in the hotel bar after a long day enjoying the sites of Chicago. However, if you are not a cigar smoker or don't enjoy second hand cigar smoke the bar is a no-go. We were able to sit in the restaurant area but it was not the same as sitting in a lounge in comfortable chairs. The hotel rooms are modern and simple in design - great colour combination with lots of light coloured wood including the headboard and bathroom doors. The bathroom is spacious and luxurious - separate bath and shower areas, lots of light coloured marble, plenty of counter space, more than enough big fluffy towels and lovely French bath products. The bed was very comfortable with a special touch -two duvets on the bed - one under the sheet for a really comfy mattress and one on top. However the pillows were overstuffed and not that comfortable. My biggest disappointment was the lack of a coffee maker in the room. If we wanted coffee we had two options. We could order from room service - very expensive once you add on the $3 delivery charge and the 18% service charge! Or we could make a trip down to the restaurant for free coffee that you could take up to your room in a paper cup - not the same as drinking your first cup of coffee from a proper cup while still relaxing in your pyjamas! Seems to be quite a shortcoming for a luxury hotel. Don't spend extra for a room on one of the top six floor - not worth it. Its true that you don't have a great view from the lower rooms but the other buildings are far enough away that you don't feel that you are living cheek to jowl with your neighbours. Besides how often are you in your room anyway? In summary, I highly recommend this hotel, but the lack of a coffee maker in the room was a big shortcoming for me!

Reviews.Title: “IMPRESSED!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter2
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by this hotel. I stayed in one of their corner suites (bedroom, bathroom with 2 separate showers, desk, separate lounge area etc) and was very comfortable indeed. The bed is probably the softest I've ever slept in so it was a struggle to get up each morning! The floral displays in the lobby area are gorgeous, the room service food was very good (usually a disappointment in most hotels) and the staff were delightful. I've stayed in other hotels in Chicago when on business trips (eg Fairmont, Westin, W etc) and this one beats them all. It's cool (great lobby and decor etc) but still very comfortable and certainly a lot more stylish than many of the other big hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the rating.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago to celebrate our anniversary and this was a great hotel to serve as the home base for the special occasion. The DELUXE KING CITY VIEW UPPER FLOORS room was immaculate. The view was great as I could see the Hancock building, and parts of the Lake. The staff was friendly very responsive to our needs. Only nits were the hot water was not very hot but still ran out too soon. Reported the problem to the desk and water got hotter but still ran out too soon. Upon check out my credit card was charged twice: 1) accidental credit for balance due; 2) charged double to cover the accidental credit. Very confusing but technically correct. Despite these nits, I would come back. Note: Not a place to take the kids though. Very adult/trendy oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Siddalee33
Reviews.Content: Pulling up to the hotel at night is a treat for the eyes. The hotel started off with a high note, and delivered from start to finish. Great rooms. The bed was most comfortable, and the bathroom was beautiful. I did not get to use the oversized tub, but I will next time! An excellant stay!

Reviews.Title: “So perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne_Oslo
Reviews.Content: I would just recommend this hotel! For business travellers, but of course for holiday as well. The hotel is delicate; rooms, main areas, bars! A nice alternative nearby this hotel (if it is fully booked) is the Westin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room last-minute for an overnight stay on our wedding anniversary. As we live only a few miles from the hotel, we were hesitant to spend $300 to stay so close to home but wanted a special night. On the booking website, they asked for any additional information you wanted the hotel to have so I let them know it was our anniversary. When we arrived at the hotel, they had given us a complimentary upgrade to a corner luxury suite! The room was incredible, the service outstanding and the room service breakfast delicious! This is a first-class hotel in a perfect location with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel-chic, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: karenk58
Reviews.Content: our stay was absolutely perfect. its a cool hotel to look at, the design and feel is very trendy and hip. all the staff are terrific, especially the consierge staff-great info and attitude. our room was on the top floor, with great views. super comfy bed, and neat bathroom. fantastic, choose this with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sofitel - Beautiful and Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Varda C
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter on a "last hurrah" trip to Chicago before her first baby is born and I wanted a spectacular hotel for her to remember - and chose the SOFITEL near North Michigan Avenue. The hotel was gorgeous, the lobby was amazingly comfortable and inviting - many alcoves of comfy sofas to hang out in... The room was very nice - we chose 2 queen beds - it had an ultra contemporary decor. I had requested an "east view" which overlooked the shopping area which was nice! While the room was not large, it had ample closet space, nice terry robes, shelf and drawer space, a nice desk, lots of lamps and a beautiful bathroom! We had a tub as well as a shower stall - very nice shampoos and lotions included daily! We loved the fact that the bathroom was stocked with lots of extra towels! One thing we appreciated was that there were electrical sockets all over the room which came in quite handy between ironing, hairdrying, recharging cellphones, etc! There were two free business centers with free internet access. The bar in the Sofitel was "hopping!" and the restaurant was lovely. We followed a Trip Advisor tip and ate in the TEMPO diner which is right next door to the Sofitel but we never would have found it without the tip - as you have to turn right out of the hotel to find it...and you'd normally turn left! (Thanks Trip Advisor!!) Overall, we absolutely loved the location and everything about the hotel. The staff was incredibly attentive - sometimes there would be two people opening the two doors for us....helping with luggage....wonderful concierge, too! I would stay at the Sofitel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtndew837
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a top-notch hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Stayed for one night in a non-smoking room on the 23rd floor - REALLY good views of the city and could even see a little of the lake. The room was so comfortable thanks to the feather top mattress, feather duvet, in-room thermostat, and beautiful bathroom with plenty of towels and bathrobes and slippers!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Sofitel Chicago Water Tower!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower and would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a good location, convenient to the excellent shopping on Mag Mile and convenient to the major tourist attractions. The hotel staff was excellent, highlighted by the helpful concierge. The room was not huge, but the beds were great, bathrooms were very nice (good shower!) and we had a decent view on the 30th floor. We didn't eat at the restaurants at the hotel, but other guests we know did and enjoyed it. This was our first visit to Chicago, so there are assuredly other good hotel options downtown, but we had a really good experience at the Sofitel. If I had to breakdown some factors individually: Staff - 5 stars Location - 4 stars (there are others on Michigan or slightly further south closer to major venues, but Sofitel is in a very good location, just not excellent) Rooms - 4

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mstalls16
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel had its perks...great location, courteous staff, and comfortable bed...but I'm not sure it was worth the money we spent. Cons: -The room was extremely small -Parking was kind of a pain since the garage was under construction. -We ordered strawberry cheesecake one night...it was okay...kind of dry, accompanied by a couple berries...not worth it Pros: -The staff was extremely attentive. My husband and I brought back an authentic deep dish pizza (Giardinno's? it was delicious, but filling), but forgot to ask for takeaway cutlery/plates...we called room service and they were up within just a few minutes -Location-Right off of Michigan Avenue, you are in walking distance of everything -Went to Mike Ditka's restaurant for burgers, which were OUTSTANDING...I would highly recommend them.. Overall, we had a good time. If we could get a good price, we might stay there again, but probably won't...

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel for the best value”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoStevenM.
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the Sofitel for value, rooms, place and people. You can spend a lot more and get a lot less. We seldom give a five star, but this weekend they get it. Enjoy, enjoy, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sofitel a secret gem”
Reviews.Author: Flafreckles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from my first visit to Chicago. This hotel was wonderful and it made our visit all the better. From the minute we pulled up we knew we had a winner. The doormen were pleasant and responsive. The front desk was fast and courteous. The room was fantastic! We were greeted each evening by turndown service with some jazz on the radio - a nice touch! The bed was so wonderful that we slept in every single day. Bathroom complete with bath robes. marble, seperate bath tub and shower. We couldn't have chosen a better place. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. Lynn was awesome! She took into consideration our preferences and made reservations at some fabulous restaurants and got us on the architectural boat tour - which we loved! Sometimes the concierge desk will push you towards the $125 a plate spot but Lynn listened and gave us some spectacular spots that really gave us a complete view of the city along with some really great food and wine. The bar was cushy and posh. A fun spot to hang out and be seen before you head up to your room - where you'll be lulled into the most comfortable sleep ever! My local friends had never heard of the place but were impressed - we'll be recommending the Sofitel to all our friends. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Good , but too pricey”
Reviews.Author: Vegas
Reviews.Content: The Good: The building is very cool looking. The decor of the hotel is great and the rooms are nice. The Bad: $$$$$$$- too expensive for what you get My wife and I transferred to this hotel after staying at the Hyatt O'hare for business. We wanted to see some of the sites Chicago has to offer. The location is good, a block from the red line on Chicago and a block from the Hancock Building. The Sofitel Water Tower is a trendy and hip European hotel that seems to cater to the business professional. The hotel does not have alot of amenities to offer a casual customer. There is no place to relax, like a pool, spa or patio. It has a small lobby where they play contemporary electronic music and a small bar/ lounge that fills up fast. They have a restaurant which we did not try. They do have a fitness center. We had a regular room on the 20th floor. Decor was tasteful but basic. The bathroom was spacious, but the trade off is that the main room is smaller. The bed was comfortable. Wireless is available and they also have the internet available through the television for a charge. (Should be free for the money you pay) The room was very clean, although they did forget to service our room one day. They apologized and serviced it that night when they did the turn down service. The staff in the lobby was great. I have stayed at other Sofitels in Europe that had alot more amenities for half the price. The Water Tower is a nice stay, especially if your on business, or if you get a deal. Not worth the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Britraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during June 2005 and it is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The room was ultra clean, stylish and spacious. The restaurant is also very good here and the location cannot be beaten - just minutes walk from the hub of the city centre, shops, great restaurants etc. We were also impressed with the little things that make a good hotel a great hotel - like fluffy white bathrobes, free slippers, gorgeous Roger & Gallet freebies in the bathroom, free Internet use in the Business Centre etc etc. Chicago is a great city to visit but a stay here makes it even more enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “the reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: heartles
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel the first weekend of june. lobby nice, staff wonderful, room service great, location is perfect, bathroom was very big - entire hotel room super clean and like everyone has said - has great views. the lobby and hallways outside our room were kind of dark and dramatic - but they were nice. also, it rained while we there and they had umbrellas waiting right by the door for us .. that was great! only snag was the beds .. i may have missed it in all the reviews i read before leaving but the sofitel is into european beds and bedding. i'm used to sleeping in a king - and was sleeping in a full at the soiftel - by the way, they have twins too. i'm 5'4 and felt the bed a little small .. very odd. also, they don't have a top sheet - only a bottom sheet and a comforter (duvet with feather bed). the sheet and the comforter are wonderful but i kept waking up looking for my top sheet. i'm sure i'd get used to the idea of not having a top sheet but not in just a few days .. i should have just asked for the top sheet and tried to not be european for a weekend. there's a cheap (i'm pretty sure 24 hour) *cash only* restaurant to the right (as you are leaving the hotel). i think it's a breakfast spot for the locals and we had a mighty great breakfast. we found out about this place in our search across town .. we were over by millenium park and the guy at the hard rock said it was great .. we were like .. geez, we always turn left when we leave the hotel!!! there was a wait, but it went really fast. it was worth it; we couldn't find a good place to eat breakfast that didn't cost a zillion dollars. and this really was good. i love breakfast! sorry about the messy room in the photo :), the kinda dark photo is of the lobby .. like i said it was kinda of dark .. hard to get a good photo w/my amateur camera.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Chitraveler29
Reviews.Content: Was required to stay to here on company business. Pros: Great location, great views, very nice rooms, decent staff Cons: In my opinion WAY overpriced, as I paid about $200 for one night, and the elevators are VERY slow. Also, parking is ridiculous, although that is to be expected in this area of Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed over Memorial Day weekend. Can't say enough about it. Staff was friendly and attentive. Walking distance to Magnificent Mile and Lake Shore Dr. One block from Rush Street bars and restaurants. Two blocks from the subway. Beautiful rooms with minimalist design. Hugh windows afforded great views from 30th floor. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Luxurious bathroom. Room service prices surprisingly reasonable. Only complaint: all bathroom lights controlled by one switch and at one setting, which is very bright. Bottom line: would recommend the Sofitel to anyone looking for a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another Sofitel winner”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at and loved Sofitels in New York, Philadelphia and Washington, so I was excited to try the Windy City version--and wasn't disappointed. The building itself is a distinctive architectural gem in the City of Architecture. With its triangular shape and narrowing angle toward the top, it looks like a ship's prow--very striking. The lobby is chic and more open than some other Sofitels, with a three-story atrium. The front desk staff was very helpful (I was checking in early) and made a room available to me by noon on a sold-out weekend. And it had an amazing view over the John Hancock Center, Mag Mile and Lake Michigan! If you've stayed at other Sofitels, you know what to expect in the rooms: colorful, contemporary and comfortable. The carpet was rust-colored, which was very different but attractive. There was the trademark color-swirl painting on the wall, nice glass-topped bedside tables and a large work desk. There's plenty of drawer/closet space and robes in both the closet and the bathroom, plus a CD player. Speaking of the bathroom--heaven. Large, with a soaking tub and separate shower, shelf space and a large counter. Marble everywhere--and even a bamboo plant! The toiletries are also top-notch French products. As has been noted in other reviews, the bed is almost dangerously comfortable. Plush to the nth degree with better linens than I recall from other Sofitels. Perhaps they're upgrading their beds like all the other chains. Didn't eat at the restaurant but did have room-service breakfast which was a little overpriced but tasty, attractively presented and delivered on time to the minute. The lobby bar is nice, but was crushingly crowded on a holiday weekend. If it's full, you can always try the small bar in the restuarant for a more peaceful drink. We were always able to get a seat there. The location is perfect--less than a 5-minute walk to the Mag Mile (the hotel is on the same cross street as the Water-Tower Place mall and the Hancock Center. There's also a subway stop two blocks away. If you're into views, here's a tip: Go to the Bar on 96th at the top of the Hancock Center. For the same price as entrance to the Observation Deck, you can get a drink and enjoy the view from a nice cushy chair.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: HotelReviewer83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Water Tower in May 2005 and had a perfect stay. We were greeted warmly upon check-in, an earlier request for high floor, lake view rooms was promptly honored, including rooms next to each other for our entire party. Rooms on the 27th floor, overlooking the skyline, Hancock Tower and the lake in the distance were fantastic. Beautiful design, understated elegance, and yes; one of the most comfortable beds we have slept in in a very long time. Bathrooms are huge and again gorgeous, with separate shower and bath. Throughout, the design of the hotel is stunning, outside and in. Add to that the sophisticated atmosphere and a French touch and you have a great hotel. Celebrities also seem to have found the Sofitel, so don't be surprised if you run into actors or singers in the elevator. Breakfast in CafÃ© des Architectes is delicious, definitely very French: you won't find better croissants and pastries. Staff is some of the politest we have come across, and all speak French fluently. Sofitel Water Tower is the choice in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic - my new Chicago favorite!”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: It's all about the bed. Amazingly comfortable. I usually wake up 3-4 times a night in hotels due to the unfamiliar room, bed, etc. The feather fiesta that is the Sofitel bed is unbelievably comfortable, and I slept soundly through each night I was there. I think that is quite a tribute to their bed's designer! The hotel itself is beautiful in that 21st century clean, colorful Euro sense. You won't find anything with a floral design here, thank goodness! Very chic, down to the hallway carpets and the in-room lighting. The bathroom was huge and spotless, with a separate stall shower and very good French toiletries (I admit I brought the leftovers home!). Frette bathrobes, too. Location is phenomenal - walked everywhere from the hotel. Usually I stay at the Westin River North, which is very good. This is better, and I will stay here from now on. Can't wait to get back into that featherbed again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't think about it - just book it...Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smudger_by_the_Sea
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. I stayed in a standard room in 2003 and really liked the hotel. This April, whilst on a business trip, I switched hotels - to the Sofitel. I stayed in one of the suites - awesome. I cannot recommend it enough. The room was huge. Large sofas and desk, and long corridor leading to a sumptious bedroom. Along the way is the equally impressive bathroom. The place was spotlessly clean, with fantastic decor. The hotel makes use of large windows wherever it can. This makes the feeling of openess (not to mention the views) wonderful. A friend who came to see me reckoned it was "the best hotel she'd ever seen". The bar can get a little crowded - but this hotel is in a great location with lots of bars a 2 minute walk away. I'd stay there again - in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My teen-aged son and I had a great three days at the Sofitel. Location was great. Our room was very nice with super bedding, and the marble bath was very large. The elevators were the speediest I have ever seen in a big hotel, and the concierges were very, very knowledable and helpful. I loved the modern decor and especially the flowers in the public areas. All in all a really great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a superior room on the 24th floor with a fantastic view on Hancock Center. The room was spacious, furniture seemed to be quite new and a little bit extraordinary. Marble bathroom with bathtube and separate shower. The room was very quiet, except for the air-conditioning. This is the only critical point. AC was noisy and you could feel the draught when you were lying in bed. Breakfast was included in our rate. You could choose from the menu whatever you want (no buffet). The location was perfect, at one end of the Magnificient Mile (near Water Tower Center) with a four minute walk to the next bus-stop and a 20 minute walk to the Chicago River (Wrigley Building). The concierge we contacted with several questions was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Like Being In Paris For One Night!”
Reviews.Author: boodle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (and our spaniel Rosencrantz) all stayed at the Water Tower Sofitel for our wedding night! The rooms are exquisite, the views are breathtaking, and the staff is incredible (they speak amazing French as well!). We live in Chicago, and were particular in where we would stay. We are huge Francophiles and were pleased with their hotels when in France last summer. The food is very authentically French, complete with typical delicacies of France that we miss so much. It was like staying in Paris for one night. The staff was very accepting our our 10 pound pooch, for those who are vacationing with their dog. The bed and tub were outstanding. The most comfortable bedding I have ever slept in. Feather Bed, Feather Pillows, Feather Duvet Cover. I recommend it hands down over the Peninsula, Four Seasons, the Drake, the Congress, and other more "well known" hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: rongoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel for 1 night. The location is perfect blocks away from the Magnificent Mile ( Michigan Ave.). If your there just for a few days then use public transportation. The hotel is only a few blocks from the Red Line and from most buses. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge was full of useful information. The room was beautiful. We had a king room on the 16th floor. Once I laid down on the feather bed I didn't want to get back up. It was almost sinful how comfortable it was. The down in the featherbed is treated to be allergen free. My wife who is allergic to down had no problems. The room was decorated very nicely. Pictures on the walls, There was a chaise to lounge on. We ordered room service Sunday morning. The food came within 30 minutes. The food was hot and very good. The Sofitel is now my favorite hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: theway02
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about my stay at the Sofitel - stunning architecture, the gorgeous lobby, the hip bar lounge, the immaculate bedroom with huge windows and modern bathroom, etc. My only caveat is if you are a fitness buff, the gym is very tiny. But it's clean and not too busy while I used it. I am very finicky about cleanliness and most hotels aren't perfect (I found a tiny hole in my blanket at the Ritz Carlton Hong Kong) but the rooms at Sofitel were absolutely immaculate. My biggest pet peeves with hotels is their top cover/duvet. It's so dirty. Everyone always throws it on the floor. But at Sofitel, the duvet cover is changed daily just like the sheets! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Elegance at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower”
Reviews.Author: GlobalQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the weekend of April 15th for a combined business and pleasure trip. We were delighted to see the gorgeous architecture of the hotel and had a beautiful corner room on the 28th floor. The duvets , featherbed and pillows on the bed were fabulous and we slept like babies. The gym was a bit small for the size of the hotel, but had the types of equipment generally expected. The room service was prompt, hot and delicious. The chocolate croissants were very, very authentic...magnifique! The hotel seemed to be overstaffed (in a good way)...service was impeccable. The only downside is that we had to wait about 15 minutes for our car which we valet parked for $37 a day! They initially brought the wrong car. But, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuldJock
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Chicago to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We cannot recommend the Sofitel highly enough. The room was lovely, on the 30th floor, with a clear view straight across to the John Hancock Tower. The beds were very comfortable and the marble bathroon spacious and clean. We ordered breakfast in our room on our anniversary including a glass of champagne each. The hotel added a box of chocolates by way of congratulations. Another nice touch was a bottle of Evian water each every night at turndown - much better than a chocolate! The hotel has a beautiful lobby and the bar is very comfortable with lots of atmosphere. It is a little pricey as is the restaurant but no more that you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My very favorite place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why this hotel could be given any less than 5 stars. My husband and I visit family in Chicago every three months and our favorite thing (besides seeing family) is getting to stay at the Sofitel. The rooms are modern, crisp, beautiful and peaceful. The beds are SO WONDERFUL that we are asking for their bedding for Christmas (you can order from the hotel). The bathrooms are the best that we have ever experienced in a hotel- with separate baths, beautiful marble showers and deluxe bath products that are restocked daily. Each room has large floor to ceiling windows with beautiful views of the city. Two of our favorite things about the Sofitel is the lobby and the restaurant. The lobby is very sleek and lively, with beautiful color arranged fresh flowers throughout and wonderful relaxing music always playing. We dine at the restaurant for breakfast most mornings. Everything is delicious, fresh with a perfect modern fresh presentation. Definitely opt to have breakfast here at least one morning, or late night milkshakes via room service. Another option for breakfast is right next door at the little cafÃ©, Tempo, which is better for a hearty breakfast. The price is very reasonable for the amenities, comfort and service you receive. Also, you canâ€™t beat the location. I would stay here for a romantic stay, a long weekend with friends or on business. Yay Sofitel! p.s.- favorite Sofitel memory was seeing Bill from the Apprentice eating breakfast there one morning! Not a big fanatic, but nonetheless, it was cool.

Reviews.Title: “A little cleverness gets a better rate.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A last minute trip to Chicago prompted a quick perusal of the TripAdvisor site, and I decided to try a stay at the Sofitel. A quick check of online rates didn't turn up any great deals, so I opted to just walk in and see what I would get. I arrived at the hotel around 3:00 pm, walked to the desk, and asked, "What is the best rate you can give me for a room tonight?" The clerk told me that the best rate she could offer was $229. I responded with, "I was really hoping that we could do better than that," and she said "that's the best rate that I have." So, I replied that I felt I could get a better rate at another hotel, and the clerk let me walk out. Now, I would think that a room sold near the end of the day for any amount is better than a room not sold at all, but that doesn't seem to be the philosophy of the Sofitel Chicago. As I left the hotel, I was not halfway down the block when I got the wild idea to CALL the hotel. I placed a quick call on my cell phone directly to the reservaton desk at the Chicago hotel, and asked the very same question: "what is the best rate that you can give me tonight." I was quoted a rate of $145. Standing at the corner and gazing at the hotel, I booked the rate. So, just 15 minutes later, I walk back into the Sofitel, up to the same desk clerk, and state my name and that I have a reservation. She was as cold as she could possibly be. So, after all that trouble, was it worth it? The lobby is very hip and trendy, and I could not help but notice the half-dozen "security" men in dark suits with earphones lodged in place standing all over the place. I sense that they're placed there more for atmosphere than any real purpose. The room was of modest size, with a king-size bed and a wonderful down comforter. The pillows were plentiful and comfortable. The bathroom was large and nicely appointed. Everything was clean and well-kept. Would I stay here again? Yes, but only if I could get a good rate. I would try any of the Kimpton Hotels first, however, as they're equally lovely, with comparable rooms, with better prices. And their front-desk staffers could definitely serve as an example to the Sofitel clerk.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around package”
Reviews.Author: rfc_traveler
Reviews.Content: This is really an outstanding hotel. I have stayed here at least four times. The location is terrific - very close to North Michigan Avenue with good shopping, restaurants and sights within walking distance. The rooms are very well-designed with a modern flair. The marble bathrooms, which have great lighting, all include separate bathtubs and showers. The hotel also provides high quality amenities. The feather beds are extremely comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable, understated and central!”
Reviews.Author: marting
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for a few days at valentines weekend. With a great location (just off Michigan Ave) and clean, well equipped rooms this turned out to be a great choice, even down to the rose in my room on one of the nights! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “sofitel chicago watertower hotel”
Reviews.Author: seemount
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel over the weekend of 11/02/05 to 16/02/05 for a five night stay. This Hotel was everything and more. Upon arrival the staff even knew who we were as we walked through the door and all were very polite, helpful and couldn't do enough to help from the doormen getting you a taxi to the reception making phone calls. Then to the room this was spotless, the bed enormous and so comfortable the best hotel bed I've ever slept in. The bed was turned down every night, the towels fresh everyday. Toiletries refreshed everyday. The large all marble bathroom was excellent. Yes you paid for extras but these were reasonably priced. Ask for an upper floor room if your visiting Chicago for the first time the views are amazing. Finally the cafe/restaurant , the food was fantastic,the staff helpful. I would say this hotel was worth every penny no matter what you pay

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews on your site are right on. The service at the Sofitel was fantastic - rooms verrrrry comfy, and the lobby has an energy that was welcoming. Would have liked a coffee maker in the room, but it was an excellent hotel nonetheless! While in Chicago, we tried Arun's for dinner (not in the hotel - 20 minute cab ride away) for a 12-course Thai tasting menu - wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “SWT: My #1 Hotel too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm from Chicago. I've travel around the world stayed in hotels from Europe to Asia. I now live in Japan. I had the opportunity to come home to visit a couple of weeks ago. I stayed at The Drake at first, and then moved to Sofitel Water Tower. In my opinion, The Drake doesn't hold a candle to the comfort I experienced at the Sofitel Water Tower. The hotel services were great! This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed in. Next time I'm in Chicago, the Sofitel Water Tower is where you'll find me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! An awesome weekend getaway! Food was great, Try the creps for morning breakfast. So classy and romantic, but also can be fun an upbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveller
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It looks good outside and inside. Bed was so comfortable and big. Bathroom is perfect with the separate shower and bath tub. You have to try the desserts in the bar area. Only found out about them on our last day there! Location is perfect for the shops. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Oni242
Reviews.Content: first impression was that the room was a little small. then i realized this was because the bathrooms take up half the space! nice touches throughout like the seperate tub and shower and a door for the toliet. it was above average but not excellent. save that for the four seasons or the peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very pleasantly surprised at most aspects of hotel. contrary to other reviews, I don't think there were many hidden or extra charges at all -- certainly not for the gym. room was very large, modern, comfortable and quiet. lobby and bar beautiful tho we never ate in. perfect location close to shopping on michigan and right on rush st. expensive to be sure, and less than thrilled w/ the parking/valet options, but still very happy w/ our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the hotel... Our room was just beautiful.When I told the front desk that it was our first time in Chicago, she gave us a view room !! We were also surprised to have turn down service... We came into our room to find the music on...our bed ready... water at each night stand and the room smelling of potpourri!! The location is perfect for walking to the main attractions and the jazz clubs. We would go again in a heartbeat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the extras”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and it was quiet with modern furnishings and wonderful view. Be forewarned that you pay extra for everything. From the business center, parking, copies, using internet and working out. I had some things shipped to hotel and this added $60 to bill. I kept getting surprises. But even with this in mind I would stay here again. You can walk to michigan avenue for restaurants and shopping. I racked up taxi bills because I needed to be several places but you could stay here and have all you need. From accomodations, staff, food (palms restaurant) and service I will return....and pay for the extras ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ParisDreamin'
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while I was attending a conference at Mc Cormick Center last week. What a great hotel experience. I lived in Chicago some number of years ago and have been back to visit a few times. This was by far the best hotel experience that I have had in Chicago. We were in a top floor room with a view overlooking Hancock, Water Tower and some of the lake. It was lovely. The room, although, a little small, was nice and very elegant. The service was outstanding. The only damper, in fact, on the whole trip, was the fact that my wife had her wallet stolen while shopping at Filene's Basement on Michigan Ave. If I ever find the idiot who did that (not a whole lot of fun getting back through airport security for her without an ID), I'm going to see how they like trying to pick on me instead of my wife.... But I digress. Anyways, the hotel staff was wonderful, trying to help us in any way they could. The location is unbeatable. We had some great meals there, including at the award winning Blackbird and at Giordano's right down the street (I do miss Chicago stuffed pizza). Also, we stuffed ourselves at the original Morton's steakhouse, which is a stone's throw from the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieNovak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Sept. 16th-19th and the staff went above and beyond to make this a special trip. My boyfriend proposed to me in Chicago and the concierge was involved in every detail to make it a special weekend. The room(s) are stunning (my boyfriend upgraded us to a suite the night he proposed). Both of the rooms dÃ©cor and views are incredible. The food in the restaurant was very good and the brunch had some nice little â€œextraâ€� touches. The location is fantastic too ( just a few blocks from the mag mile and the lake) â€¦.the hotel is in a pretty upscale neighborhood/shopping area.. If you wanted a suite, I highly recommend room:1801 â€“ the room had a huge bathroom and floor to ceiling windows of the city. Overall the hotel was pretty close to perfect (good value too considering what you get).

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Valentine's Day in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay here if only for the comfortable, cozy down linens! My husband and stayed here on Valentine's Day. It seemed a bit swank for me, but the staff quickly put me at ease with it's great service. We had a romantic dinner at Cafe des Architectes. The food and service were great. A minor curtain malfunction was fixed immediately and turn down service included a chocolate plus a goody-bag of L'Occitane products for V-Day! The room was comfortable and clean. I wasn't thrilled with toiletries. Too heavy on the perfume. Overall, enjoyed our special, romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip to Chicago, my husband and I really enjoyed the fun and funky Sofitel. Especially if you travel alot on business, you'll appreciate the Sofitel's difference. It's a departure from the standard fare--big lobby Sheratons, Westins and Doubletrees, and formulaic hipster boutique chains like the W. Our room was bright and comfortable with a great view of the lake, and a very spacious bathroom (the hallway was quite dark, however...almost like all the lightbulbs had gone out). The staff was courteous and relaxed, and the lobby bar was as lively as any we've seen. With its great location close to fantastic shopping, lakeside attractions and restaurants, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: prose01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a three day holiday in Chicago over the Labour Day long weekend. The hotel was near perfect. We had booked a deluxe room and were upgraded to a deluxe corner suite. Very nice touch. The room was unbelievable, with stunning views of the Hancock Tower and Lake Michigan. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. The location was perfect; walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, the beach, Rush street at night and a Red Line subway station. The atmosphere was perfect; vibrant and busy, but not like a larger convention type hotel. We have travelled the world and stayed in many places and wouldn't hesitate to highly recomment this hotel for anyone taking a visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: cgardaddy
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay Aug. 28 & 29 was wonderful. Our room was spotless, well laid out, and beautifully furnished. The small shelf in our shower broke away and fell to the floor and broke. Although we didn't make any fuss, the front desk sent us a cheese and fruit tray which I would order again. Morning coffee (a peeve of mine) was quickly delivered both days with a paper, at a reasonable price. Valet parkers were friendly and efficient. Our server in the bar was attentive without hovering, (come to the bar, even if you stay somewhere else) and the drinks were right on. At 5 on Friday, the concierge got us reservations for 7:30 (Ditka's would be 9:30, Fogo 10:30) at a chop house a 20 minute walk (4 min, $7 cab) away. It was excellent. The Sofitel is our first choice in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best Hotel I've ever enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the Sofitel in Chicago in mid-July. I would rate this as the best hotel I've ever had the pleasure to experience. The Sofitel certainly ranks without peer in its price range. The building and public spaces are well-designed and pleasing to the eye. Fresh flower arrangements work in tandem with aesthetically pleasing art and lighting. The rooms feature large windows, spacious and well-appointed bathrooms, and the most comfortable beds I've slept on in any hotel. The location is wonderful, and a nice change from the Wacker Drive mega/convention hotels. Finally, I found the service exceptional. Of course, there was the helpful, courteous desk and lobby staff, but the rest of the hotel staff excelled as well. An example-- after arriving home, I discovered I left a compact disc wallet in the hotel's workout facility. I called three days after checking out, and spoke to a friendly person in housekeeping who told me, yes, they had found the cds, and would send them to me immediately. The cds arrived at my home in the mail giftwrapped... yes, giftwrapped! Though I was in Chicago on business, I would now consider a pleasure trip to the city, in part, to stay at this hotel again. The Sofitel Hotel Chicago sets the standard-- exceptional!

HotelInfo.Name: Sofitel Chicago Water Tower
